He rocks! He was one of my few professors who seemed completely unintimidating. Classes were fun, relaxed and interesting, and exams were easy as long as you studied your notes. He seems to genuinely enjoy teaching, which is more than I can say for a lot of instructors. My only regret is that I didn't get to take 502 with him before I graduated!

He is fantastic! He teaches history as if it were a story, he makes it very exciting. He isn't out to trick you, he is very straightforward, which makes it easier to really enjoy the topic. He got me passionate about ancient Greek history which I knew nothing about before! Take him I highly recommend it.

Greg Anderson was by far the best teacher I have had at OSU. He is extremely knowledgable on a wide range of historical topics, goes out of his way to help students and has such a great passion for his field. He sticks to the syllabus and actively includes members of the class. I would change nothing about his teaching style. Take HIM!
Awesome guy. Easy class, he makes history as interesting as possible.  Very funny and would highly recommend.  Don't bother with the text.

He's an awesome professor! I wasn't that interested in Greek History before I took his class but now I love the subject! He is very hands on and loves debating different subjects in class. He's just awesome!
One word; Arete.

501.01 and 501.02 are probably the best classes I've taken at OSU and my major isn't even History.  He's really funny and really helpful and his midterms and finals are ridiculously easy if you show up and pay attention.  It's the only class I've actually read everything for and enjoyed reading everything.  Definitely take his classes!

Amazing prof, great accent, great sense of humor!  Extremely knowledgeable and very willing to help.  Tests are cake if you take good notes and study the passages well.  Even though the class was easy, it was definitely the most enjoyable and I feel like I've learned a lot, I still bring up topics from class in conversations today!
It is an easy class, and he is super nice, and funny

Great Professor, HIST 501.02. Awesome British accent. Very willing to help. Lectures were strictly notes, but tests and one paper were not difficult at all as long as you paid attention. Highly recommend ... get in the class early, as it fills up quickly.
he was awesome, my favorite teacher so far. if you take good notes you have the answers for the tests. he's super kewl

He was thoroughly interested in the subject matter he was teaching. Lectures were a delight to attend (class was always overflowing), and tests were reasonable if you took decent notes. Greek names were a little tough, but he seemed sympathetic in the grading. Did a nice job of comparing the past to the present and making it all seem worthwhile.
Was a fantastic teacher, had taken his brother for a few courses, and am positive Greg is the easier of the two... would recommend
best teacher at wsu! i've had him for about eight classes or so.
I loved taking his class.

Appears nice in class, but outside of class...whoa!  If he gets p.o. ed about something, he uses profanity, will completly put you down...he's got a mean side to him.  If however, he is always in a good mood for you, then he's one of the better profs on campus.

I know he's a classics professor, but this history class was fantastic. He's really helpful and is actually funny (unlike most history profs) - I recommend taking anything from him you possibly can, because he's a visiting professor and I don't know how long he'll be here.

Great professor.  He takes it a little too easily on his students (towards the end we altered the curriculum, because Pliny was too much of a challenge), but he pieces apart everything so you know absolutely the grammatical reasons for the Latin. Great professor; everyone should take Latin from him.
Very fun prof., have taken 3 of his courses.

DR. Anderson is a great professor.  He sees that every student understands the material, does not play favorites with the students and overall a very nice, well mannered, and professional. He wants you to learn the material and will bend over backwards to help you.  Great Prof.
Awesome teacher! Still my favorite after four years here. Helpful, funny...  British...

Prof. Anderson has to be my favorite teacher here!  He tries to make things as easy as possible for everyone and is willing to listen if you have any problems.  I suggest you come to every class but as long as you come to the class before the exam to get the review sheet you'll be fine. :) :P :@) :)
Very friendly prof, always willing to help.  Tests aren't that bad, as long as you go to class, study and take notes, you'll be fine.
I think he was a great professor! Loved his accent. His tests were extremely hard but he would always listen to you if you had problems.
Very good prof. and very nice. Always willing to help and the British accent and good looks aren't bad either.
British accent!!! You learn a lot from him, and he is great to learn from!!!

if you want a class where you'd feel like coming to a good movie twice a week (for free:-)) take him. very interesting, smart, good dose of british humor, tests are easy. Makes every individual in class feel confident about the material.
Just show up to class and get the Review sheet and you pass the class with at least a B.  and the accent makes the material interesting
Very helpful, makes jokes in class, approachable, cool British accent!
He teaches this class like once in a blue moon but he is such a good teacher easy you just have to show up to class.
English Accent!! Way cool. Very nice, very helpful. The tests are a little rough, but if you go to lecture you'll be fine. Great teacher.

It's Latin...what can you say? You translate it, he gives about 3 tests. The tests have two previously-seen passages, one to translate, one with questions about syntax. He's kinda funny, it's a light-hearted atmosphere.
Lectures and quizzes are ok and fair.

I mean, there's a reason she's got such a high rating on this site. Easily the best professor I've ever had. She knows the material, she loves the material, she's fantastic at teaching the material, she makes you work, she wants you to learn the material, the tests are very fair and easy (If you've read everything and go to class).

Dr. Hunt knows the material very well. Two 4-page papers. One is a book review and the other is a movie review. No quizzes. Just easy midterm and final (which is not cumulative). Study guides look exactly like the exams. She's very nice too and replies quickly to emails. She has an accent but very clear and understandable.

Very nice and helpful; responds to emails within the day it was sent, clear and concise with material. She knows and has a passion for what she is teaching and is able to do teach a tough subject very well. I would recommend taking one of her classes 1010 times
Amazing Professor, very knowledgable and passionate in what she teaches. The course was very organized and she was  always available for help on assignments. I highly recommend taking this course
She is the best History teacher you can have. She knows everything and she just makes boring history so vivid and interesting!!

Professor Hunt is incredibly knowledgeable and passionate. She clearly loves teaching and the subject matter she teaches on. Her class was very well organized and while it certainly requires some effort (doing the out of class readings), if you put in the effort you will do well.

Dr. Hunt is a super cool , super nice. She's very smart & really knowledgable about the subject. She uses videos and movies to assist with understanding the material.Gives quiz questions in advanced and questions are EXACTLY like the homework. As long as you come to class and do the Homework you'll get an A. Finals is easy & she's a fair grader

She knows what she's teaching by heart and she's passionate about it. You are going to learn a lot from her about the early society. The class is interesting; she showed videos and brought Mediterranean foods for us. This subject is easy if you do the homework and complete the assigned readings. I really enjoyed her class. Thumbs up !

Dr. Hunt is extremely organized. Even if you're not interested in the topic, she will make it interesting with movies and primary sources. I would recommend this class to anyone needing the credit. I personally took it even though I didn't need the credit and I'm glad I did. It's not *EASY* but as long as you do the work you will do well.

Professor Hunt is a wonderful teacher who truly cares about all of her students passing her class. She reviewed all of my essays before I turned them in and gave really useful feedback. She expects you to know the material through and through but all you have to do is ask and she will help you every step of the way. I absolutely LOVED her.

Dr. Hunt is one of the best professors that I have had. She truly cares about helping her students understand the material and succeed. She is very knowledgeable about the topics covered and is able to teach them in a fair and objective way. This course has greatly improved my insight into world history.
Most organized professor I've had.

Dr. Hunt is truly a phenomenal professor and this class provides students with a strong understanding of Islamic history throughout many time periods. She truly cares about students learning the material. If you show up to class, do the reading, and pay attention, Dr. Hunt will make sure you do well in her class.

A great professor, has all the qualifications to teach the course at a very understanding level. The course is structured in a way that will let students explore the subject in the proper way yet ease the burden. Overall, if you keep up with class and discussion and do the required work you will do fine in the class. Definitely recommend!

She is an amazing instructor. Very passionate about Islamic and Balkan history. She is very compassionate with her students, and wants them to actually learn something from the class. If you are interested in learning about Islamic History, then this class will provide you with a great intro on the subject. I recommend taking the class!
I highly recommend this professor; she is very helpful, fair and engaging. This class will give you a better understanding of Islamic history.
Lots of work (reading), but if you do it all you will do well.

Dr.Hunt was an amazing professor. She truly helps you understand your material and is always ready to help you achieve the maximum potential in class. She truly has a kind heart, a rarity in professors these days. Her depth of knowledge is truly amazing which makes her class that much more interesting and engaging.

I was out of school for over 8 years. This course got my focus back. Professor Hunt was very knowledgable about the subject and displayed confidence when teaching her class. She provided clear cut instruction on her syllabus as well as everyday in class, and was available to help her students at all times via email in addition to office hours.

Dr. Hunt is an extremely knowledgable and helpful teacher. Instead of focusing on memorization of the text book, she focuses on the understanding of primary documents and their relation to one another. By far this is the best history class that I have ever taking in regards to maintaining my intrest and the knowledge that I obtained.

Dr. Hunt is just great! She is so knowledgable and helpful. And also, with my personal experience, she is the fastest instructor to reply emails, with very helpful and valuable content, not just a quick answer. As long as you follow the syllables to do what you are supposed to do, you will be able to get a good grade! Btw, she makes great desserts!

Very interesting class. Excellent professor in every way. She is clear, sticks to the syllabus, very organized and extremely helpful. As any other history class you will need to read a lot, but if you keep up with the syllabus you will not have any problems.

I took this course to fulfill a GEC requirement. History is not really my area, but Dr. Hunt made this class very interesting and worthwhile. She was very clear and willing to answer questions and offer feedback. You have to be willing to do the readings for class, but they aren't bad. I would definitely recommend this class and professor!
She taught the course with absolute clarity and was easy to contact when I had questions during the course.
She is a great teacher who is willing to help you with papers and exams, and focuses more on  interesting primary documents rather than the textbook, which definitely enlivens the class.
Mrs. Hunt was a great teacher who graded fairly and had very interesting lectures. She was very informed on the topics and provided a plethora of awesome primary documents.
Professor Hahn is an amazing scholar on the history of US relations in the Middle East. His lectures are engaging, insightful, and always inspire great discussion. Take him if you have the chance!

Knowledgeable, intelligent, and wise. He is clearly an expert in the subject material. He engaged the students in dialogue as well. The readings are not mandatory and you can scrape by just completing the bare minimum, but you will get so much out of the class if you engage with the material. Go to class and you will learn so much from him.
Dr. Hahn is a superb professor. He is an expert on US foreign policy. His makes you work in this graduate level class. But the level of learning is well worth it.

Hahn met all of my expectations for a history professor: In lecture, he delivers the content without going on tangents and without being boring. The slides were on Carmen, but it's necessary to attend for filler info, and he's tactful with student opinions For the midterms/essay, he's very clear with his grading criteria and fair with critiques.
Lots of notes for this class.  He is very organized and very clear.  If you like American History, this is a great class.

The hardest class at OSU is HIST 770 for all of you grad/doc students.  No amateurs.  They call the class "the sweatshop" because you have to read a thick-ass book and write a 4 page single spaced paper (not a book report but a comparison to other scholars etc) every week.  And give an oral report half of the weeks.  You will learn a****load and meet some great people if you can stick it out though.

If you lack a good background in American history(1920-present), definitely take a lower level intro. class first, otherwise you'll struggle majorly. LOTS of reading, but it's not necessary to read the subject specific books,BUT STUDY THE TEXTBOOK EXTENSIVELY. Class = a note taking marathon.
Had lots of interesting info to impart, but somewhat dry. Very notes-intensive class, not particularly helpful to students in small setting, but still knows his subject.
Lectures impecably organized, very knowledgeable, great sense of humor.
No Comments
Very thorough, interesting, one of the best classes I've taken at OSU

Dr. Limbach is nice and wants to see you succeed, but his class was just hard to follow. There were no slideshows, just lectures and the lectures were just him reading off a script that was hard to follow at times. His grading system also is anxiety-inducing because he decides your final grade based on numerous criteria.
He was fine as a professor, but it always baffled me that he used a Kindle(???) to read off of a script for every class.

Understanding that this historical period is broad, I wish I could give him more leeway on his score, but I can't. He reads off a script for his lectures and jumps around way too much. I don't think I truly retained anything from his lectures. The class lacks passion and clarity. Also, his grading system is weird and creates more anxiety.

This class was broken down into 7 modules (1 for each week) that included two of either a discussion board, document analysis, or individual reflection based off of the textbook. Lots of reading and you pretty much cant avoid it if you want to end up with a good grade. Professor didnt interact with the class much outside of module intro videos.

Both this professor and class were super easy. I will say, he doesn't really give 100% on anything, he will say that you did a great job and still give you 9/10 points. One weekly assignment to do and I would recommend buying the textbook so you can highlight inside it. I found that I could usually skim the chapters and still earn a good grade.

class is very textbook heavy. there were 3 assignments a week and they were not clear about what they wanted or expected. never stated a word min or max. the midterm was not clear at all. and the weekly lectures did not do anything for the class. this class would be better taught without a professor and someone just telling you to read the book.

Reasonably tough with grading assignments as you have to read the textbook well, but Prof Limbach has clear standards. He posted an example of how to get a perfect score on an assignment which was helpful.

I took this online (asynchronous) as a session 2 course, and it was a fairly easy for history GE. It was broken up into one module per week (2 assignments weekly). Honestly, yes you need the textbook, but I barely read and ended the course with an A-. If you read some, youll do just fine.

Pretty easy history gen ed. He requires a textbook as his assignments are based on it. His class is broken into modules and each model has a group discussion and either an individual reflection or document analysis of what we read. Each module covers about two chapters (7 modules in total) which is not bad at all. Class is also asynchronous.

Amazing professor and I don't mean that lightly. He was a very busy man but when he was in class and lecturing, he was engaged and you could tell his passion is very much there. I think it's important to note that this class is very engaging and you must pay attention to all material to understand. Lots of reading, movie watching and typing/writing

If you go to class and take good notes during lectures the exams will be easy! The "homework" is a lot of reading and documentaries, but your grade is just exams and a couple of super simple pop quizzes. The only stressor is that he is super disorganized and the way he uses Carmen is confusing.

Only graded on 3 exams, participation, and a final.This class requires a lot of time.There are many readings and videos to watch, although they are very interesting. You will learn a lot in lecture. Honestly not the easiest GE to take. Will need to establish a good schedule to watch movies and read weekly. Great professor,as he is very engaged.

I love Dr. J. This class was stimulating and easy as long as you participate in discussions and can write. Only 6 assignments. 3 1-page film reflections & 3 5-page film analyses. No textbooks, no readings, just films. Couldn't recommend him and this class more. He's also gracious with deadlines if you participate in discussions.

Dr. J's awesome. His course material was comprehensive, and I learned things about the Civil Rights and Black Power movements that are incredibly relevant modern day. Lots of readings, but they're interesting and informative. Dr. J cared about our thoughts and opinions; he facilitated extremely valuable discussions during class and office hours.

Dr. J is a true homie. he's absolutely hilarious and loves students speaking and demonstrating their personality in class! He's also very passionate about teaching and clearly cares about his students. He keeps the course interesting not only in the content and interesting lectures, but giving us a mixture of readings and documentaries.

Dr. J is hands down the coolest professor Ive ever had. He teaches some harsh truths in ways that are very accessible and understandable. I looked forward to my class every single week just to hear what he had to say and I would recommend everyone to take his classes at some point.
Just the best, all I have to say.

Overall great professor. Only issues I had were the occasional delay of posting of assignments, and a bit of disorganization surrounding the schedule. He always made up for it if he posted something later than planned by giving us more time for the assignment. Only 3 papers during the whole class. Lots of reading, but he added documentaries too.
Dr. Jeffries is seriously one of the better professors at Ohio State. Taking Civil Rights & Black Power during an election year was beyond impactful. Cannot recommend this class enough.

The best professor at OSU. There are a lot of readings and documentaries (about 30 pgs a week and an average of 2 documentaries), but they're interesting so it's worth it. For this class, there was no discussion posts, just one zoom class a week for reflections. Exams were take home and if you did the work, you'll do well. Take this class!!!
Never had such a fantastic professor. Does such a great job of explaining but being inspirational at the same time. wow

Dr. Jeffries is the most inspirational professor I have had at OSU. Every lecture left me totally speechless with my understanding of the world completely rocked. He creates a classroom space that feels like a family. TAKE HIS CLASSES.

He is such an amazing professor! He is flexible and it helps a lot to go to his office hours. A lot of outside reading was needed, but all of it was discussed in class and it paid off to keep up with reading. I would love to take a class with him again; he is inspirational, caring, and intelligent. He's also hilarious and keeps class interesting.

Dr. J is so amazing!  I took his 1-credit hour First Year Seminar called #blacklivesmatter, and it was so insightful.  We had 10 students in our class, and Dr. J truly cultivated an amazing environment.  He is a very understanding person, is lenient with deadlines, and is super hilarious.  Any class you could take with him, I would.

I'm in actually in love with this professor. He's passionate about the subject he teaches, invested in making students think beyond the classroom, he incorporates his humor into all of his lectures and he truly cares for you future. His class is hands down one of my fondest college memories because he was the BEST teacher Ohio State has right now.

Ohio State needs more professors like him. I took his film class and it was probably one of the most creative and thought provoking class I have taken so far. He is flexible on due dates. Fair grader on papers. If you're into Black history definitely take one of his classes.

Extraordinarily knowledgable and passionate about his subject. Excellent lecturer and discussion facilitator. He moved people in our class to tears more than once. Open to discussion on current events, and offers extra credit for some community events. This was the most memorable class I've taken at OSU.
Does not know how to teach. Spends his time putting in movies and allowing the students to watch them. He grades tests not on understanding but actual "in the book material"

took african american history with him... good writer, incorporated music, novels, movies and discussion into the class. even though I only got a C i think hes a pretty helpful professor since I wasnt doing well, and he went out of his way to help me understand.. sexy too!

Class limited on the scope of African American history.  Need to be more serious as we are in a University environment.  Did not allow me to take missed quizes due to my unforseen circumstances that cause me to miss class.
I took Hist323.02 with him and he's hilarious. He makes class very interesting and gives 10 quizzes throughout the span of the quarter, so going to class is pretty much necessary.
Best teacher I've had at OSU. Not only is he hilarious, easy to talk to, and makes class interesting, you learn a lot. I would 100% recommend his class to anyone. He's also not bad too look at

History has always been my least favorite subject, but I really enjoyed this class a lot. Dr. Jeffries is a great teacher... And he has not only his students' reviews but Ohio State's 2012 Distinguished Teaching award to prove it.

One of the best classes I've taken in my years at OSU. I hate history and really was not looking forward to my last one, but DR. J made it interesting,interactive, and intellectually stimulating. I totally recommend signing up for whatever course Dr.J is teaching simply b/c he's one of those rare great teachers who love what they do!

Amazing teacher!!! Great class and really interesting lectures. Watch movies, listen to music, and is all interesting content. Take quizzes once a week, one essay, midterm, and final. Not bad at all. AMAZING class.
Great professor! His passion and knowledge of the subject is unmatched. Makes class interesting and stimulating.
Terrible

Absolutely amazing instructor! What I enjoyed most about his class is that he uses a multi-format teacher style. He not only uses the textbook, but also incorporates images,primary sources and music from the time period being discussed to give the students a more vivid picture of the era. One of the best courses and teachers I have taken at OSU!

An an absolutely great teacher. Makes class interesting and fun, and the difficulty isn't terrible. Class is mandatory and there is daily reading assignments, but I laugh every time I'm in lecture. If your taking a 150 series history look for him.

Dr. Jeffries is one of the best professors I've ever had.  Class discussion was very interesting but you have to do the work. He's a real funny guy as long as you do your stuff.  I would highly recommend him.
African American HIstory from emancipation to present. very stimulating. one of those young passionate professors that inspire.

There were 9 books for this class(1 a week), but don't let that scare you.  It is very easy to get an A if you have half a brain in your head and are willing to work.  You have max 750 words on each book a week (that's way short) then one long paper on any topic.  He is laid back and really encourages you to create your own ideas.  TAKE HIM!

Must read the book and know your stuff...he is intimidating and calls your name off the roster and calls you out if you dont know the answer.  Class is pretty easy though just read and attend.  Very interesting and easy to listen to.  Plus even in suspenders he is very nice to look at ;)
Sometimes I felt like I was taking an African American studies class, but he still kept it interesting.  Soooo hot!

He gives interesting lectures.  I enjoyed the points of focus in the class.  Sometimes treats the class as a whole as if they are children.  Beware of the recitation instructors (some are truly awful). Overall easy class though.

I absolutely abhored history before taking this course. I am a biology major and only took it b/c it was mandatory. But Dr. Jeffries is def the best prof I've had at OSU; teaches history from a different point of view and teaches class like he's telling a story. Very interesting. If you get a chance, def take a class with him. plus he is HOT!!!!!!
Funny guy, but multiple choice portion of exams was harder than it should have been.

Pretty cool teacher.  Makes boring material somewhat interesting.  Lectures are mandatory and attendance is randomly taken.  Also, he calls on people in class to make sure you are reading.  Tests are pretty difficult and were worded funny.
Coolest teacher i've ever had.  Very easy class if you go and pay attention.  Wants his students to do well in the class.  Best teacher i've had so far at osu.
Very cool guy. He takes attendance in lecture often, but he makes it easy to go class. Not boring at all. Will crack jokes about the material and students if you don't know what you're talking about.
The material doesn't get boring.  He involes people in class so make sure you're there -- attendence is required.  He is funny and likes to crack jokes.  I've really enjoyed having him!
No Comments

Very knowledgeable about subject matter.  Good sense of humor and leads lively discussions.  Class time does not drag at all. A lot of reading but manageable.  Grading is relaxed but fair.  Awesome teacher, one of my favorites at OSU- I highly reccomend.

I thought this was going to be an easy A for a History of Ohio class, but this was extremely difficult. The only books that are needed are the Van Tine book and the Bluest Eye by Toni Morrison. the course is formatted to trick you on the quiz questions. lectures are short.

the grade is only determined by quizzes for the midterm, final, and discussions for the Van Tine and The Bluest Eye. But otherwise, the lectures are short and straight to the point. the issue with the course is the way that the questions are formatted in a way to confuses you even though you have just watched the lecture videos and taken notes.

Super interesting course, and the lectures were short and well-made. Didn't really expect much from the course, but got a ton out of it. There was a super easy weekly quiz based on lectures. Dr. Coil was also very understanding and easy to communicate with via email. As long as you do all the assignments on time, you will pass with an A.

Prof Coil was top notch without a doubt. Lectures are really engaging and the test questions were very straightforward. One of the best professors I have ever had. However, his TA Daniela was probably the worst grader I have ever seen. Takes points off without a reason. The class would have been so much better if she was the one that didn't grade

Professor Coil is super cool. He is super passionate about history and made the lectures fun. Probably the only history professor who's online lecture vids were interesting and engaging. He responded to emails quickly, gave solid feedback on all assignments, and made sure everyone stayed on track in class. Probably my favorite history professor.

If you are remotely interested in Ohio or history it is pretty interesting. It is basically US history through the lens of Ohio. Professor Coil has a fairly organized grading system, read the textbook, listen to lectures, take notes and you should get a good grade. Professor Coil has a nice narrative voice and encourages critical thinking.

Love this guy. This is my first history class at OSU and I got lucky having him. The video lectures he records are so interesting and he knows what he's talking about. Also, the textbook was free online and it was a great and very informational reference.

Great class to fill a history credit. there are quizzes every week (open note), 7 discussion boards, and 2 essays. It is a very doable class and I actually have learned a lot. If you put in the work, he will meet you halfway and help in any way that you need. the Discussions are easy points and the quiz/test are good as long as you take notes!

Only get once chance to answer a question on quizzes and cant change them. Takes points off for being late even when turning in before the deadline, VERY reading and video heavy even for an online class. Is by far the worst class in history I have taken, not to hard but boring, very tedious and un-motivating ( Ohio History )

Going into this class, I was quite nervous. History is by no means my strong suit in any way. I only took History of Ohio for my minor. Though, I ended up really enjoying the class, and professor Coil made the content easy to understand. He cares a lot and wants his students to succeed. If you enjoy history, you have to take his classes.

This class is interesting & you learn about ALL of the different groups that came to America &when. The textbook is mandatory, but it didn't cost a lot and is really captivating. He is very clear with his grading & provides a rubric. He responds very quickly to emails. Added bonus, I really like his voice in the lectures, it's like a documentary.

Very passionate about history. I found his class to be very interesting and thought provoking. His video lectures have a very soothing tone and he speaks super calmly. Its nice. Quizzes/exams are straightforward and if you watch the videos you should do well.

8 week online History of Ohio class. Was lecture heavy as u watch 4 videos a week which were 15-20 min long each. have 2 quizzes weekly worth 100 points each. Four discussion posts worth 50 points. 3 Essays which were graded very strictly. Assignments worth alot of points makes grade go up and down quickly. Finished class with an A, but wasn't easy

The class is very straight forward. A quiz and discussion board due weekly on two video lectures each about 15-19 minutes long. Three 6 page essays, two of them are on books that you have to buy. He is a very fair grader.

As an online class, you have videos to watch, a quiz, and a discussion post with 2 replies to do weekly. The midterm and final is an essay. Definitely makes you work for your grade but is very willing to help as well.
This professor made the class Very interesting and enjoyable. He and his TA's responded to my emails immediately. It was an easy class because it was interested and he was a very fair grader.

Dont take this class if you are doing it for a history GE. You have to do 4 six page papers that aren't hard they are just extremely annoying and a waste of time. You also have to watch 2-3 videos a week (his lectures) and do a discussion on them which is just again a waste of time.

He is a very hard grader, and the TAs are tough graders as well. On papers expect unclear feedback. There are 4 papers in the class and two are on books. There are plenty of points in the class with discussion posts each week, but can be very time consuming. Overall an interesting class but don't expect an easy A.

If you're taking the 8-week course, be prepared to move at a quick pace. Lectures/discussions each day that take 30 min to do, a paper due every other week (4 total), and 2 online quizzes. Coil is a good prof with clear grading criteria. Be forewarned that there is supposedly no curve and the average on essays are Cs. Work hard, & you'll be fine.

Coil was an amazing prof. His lecture style can be different at first, as it is almost like a Sermon--but once you get used to it he is an amazing teacher. The workload is fair. The class was very interesting to get a insight into Ohio and through it the world.

Great Professor. He was clear, nice, and thorough in his explanations. The lectures were not bad at all, probably the best you're going to get in a History section. He was very understanding, and even let me move my final date due to a conflict with my football tickets. That alone made him a great professor.

Good prof overall. Lectures are boring but he seems enthusiastic about what he teaches. Lots of info on powerpoints so a laptop is helpful for taking notes. He also gives study guides with all the info on the exams. Thanks to the help of TAs, assignments are graded and given back in a timely manner.

Class is easy.  Dr. Coil is interested in history and the lectures aren't bad, just a bit boring.  Exams are pretty easy since you get a study guide that is the exam.  Only part that was rough was recitation with Ashley Eberly as your TA, just don't have her and you'll be fine since she'll talk down to you and grade essays hard with out helping you

the online quizzes he gives are absolutely ridiculous, even with the book and the internet they are extremely hard. His exam questions are taken directly from the book. I never studied from his lectures. He loves history and thinks everyone else loves history just as much as he does. I hated this class

If you are not a writer, get out of his class!  Most of your grade depends on your analytical writing skills, and he's an ass with grading.  Doesn't seem to understand that it's a 100 level course...not a 500

EASY A! Attendance not mandatory, tests consist of a take home essay and the student memorizing 50 terms and then matching them 25 of them to the appropriate definitions in class. He does get in his political opinions though

His lectures are very boring if you're not into history, but he's good at what he does. Not necessary to go to class. He gives at home quizzes on Carmen every two weeks, where you can use the textbook. His exams are so easy...a take home essay and 25 matching terms that he gives a study guide for. An easy A!

He is great!  If you go to class, the essay questions are eventually answered.  Summer quarter we had 2 essays, 4 quizzes on Carmen (that you can take 5 times), and the Final.  He's kind of tough when grading though, but will look over an essay before you turn it in.  Final was a take-home essay and in class test.

the majority of these posts are when he was a TA, but nows he's full time at OSU-Newark. but hes really nice guy. easy A and you dont even need to go to class. has all of his lectures on carmen in powerpoint
He was very enthused about teaching.  He had a lot of reading, but he is an easy A.

Class difficulty mostly depends on recitation TA and how hard they grade your essays. Midterm and final consists of take home essay for half of grade and 25 matching terms you take in class when you turn in your essay.

I had him for both 151 and 152, and he was really good.  He makes the class interesting and for the most part his keeps his views out of it, there are a few times he slips something out, but its usually a joke and in good taste, nothing out of line of offensive.  Exams were very easy, an out of class essay you get a whole week to work on.
No Comments

A good lecturer. Like most left wing profs he can't resist the urge to dig at the President and Fox News even when completely irrelevant. If you can try to forget a lot that you already know about history and regurgitate his lectures in essay form you'll do well, after the class, resume using your full breadth of historical knowledge and good sense

He made me be really interested in history class!  He is a very good lecturer and makes class interesting by teaching wide-ranging issues instead of names, dates, etc.  He is really enthusiastic about the subject.

Nothing special about the lectures or readings, kind of rough. Although I didn't particulary enjoy the class I'd guarantee you'll learn some things that are significant or interesting throughout the semester.

As long as you show up to every class lecture and read all of the required readings, you should be fine. The class is pretty much entirely graded by three moderately difficult essays requiring the analysis of historical documents. The class itself goes into so many specifics that many lectures are dry, but Sessa does a good job making it all fun.
Grades extremely tough and has her TA grade most things unfairly. Nice lady but makes it impossible to get higher than a C or C+

She is an excellent professor! This is the second class I've taken with her and I'm glad I did. Professor Sessa is a very thorough and interesting lecturer. The reading is light, but you need to go to class for a good grade. Exams were easy and she pretty much tells you what will be on them.

Professor Sessa was great to have for an Intro to History class. I highly recommend taking it with her. If you are interested in the class and doing well she is more than willing to help you achieve the grade you want. The class is outlined very thoroughly, and the assignments are easy to understand.
Waay easier than expected. She only made us get to chapter books & a GREAT REFERENCE book (buy it).! She's helpful & allows u to turn in your papers as many times as you want to improve your grade

Sessa is a wonderful instructor. Passionate about the material, intelligent, always responds to e-mails quickly. The TA seemed very nice, but she is a tough grader (though Prof. Sessa is as well). Overall, a great professor.

Very fun class! It is very helpful to read her assigned readings, although it is not necessarily a MUST. She is very nice, but her TA is brutal and a brutal grader. Just go to lecture and take notes, you'll do fine.

This class is great.  Prof Sessa is very smarts and you will learn a lot from her.  You MUST go to class and while you can get by without reading the material, you will get a lot more out of class if you do.  She moves kind of fast so take quick notes or bring a computer.  It's very worth it. She's very fair and a terrific teacher. Take this class!

Sessa is wonderful. She is very strong minded but if you have a desire to do well, she is encouraging and helpful. Does not mess around. Come to class, listen, and engage. Very smart and to the point which makes the material easy to understand.
Great class. Learned a lot from her. Tests were hard and so was writing the papers but the material was interesting and she taught it well

I found this prof to be pretty annoying and boring. Her tests are all essay and graded really hard. There is a huge amount of reading and if you don't do all of it you will be screwed because she expects specific references on exams. I recommend taking this class with someone else if possible.
she never looks your eyes when you're speaking to her, which was really indicative of her overall attitude.

Hot stuff!! Amazing professor, but tends to have her opinions already formed and is very unwilling to consider alternatives. If you align yourself with her way of thinking you'll do great. Rather demanding at times, but class discussion is always smooth, deep, and just tons of fun. I'd say go for it!!
Doesn't respect opinions of students.

Sessa is incredibly brilliant and really excited about the material.  She comes prepared for class every day with notes for us and presents all material clearly and efficiently.  Shes really sweet, energetic and young and AWESOME!

Very hard course, but you'll learn a lot. Discussion always interesting, but hard to write her papers. They're long and have to be perfect to please her! Sessa is very nice though, and very very smart.
A very bad teacher. Doesn't listen to her students.

Interesting class, she's very excited about what she's teaching. The reading quizzes are easy to BS even if you haven't finished the reading (and theres A LOT of it.) Very helpful on essay rewrites. Overall a great prof.
Discussion is very good. Too many books to read in a semester (14). Papers are graded very strict, she has a model she wants you to fit. Knowledgable, and helfpul.
No Comments
Great Prof.  I learned so much and she presented the material very clearly.  She is extremely excited about her subject and very willing to help and talk with students.
Great teacher. Good class. Great to take. Very knowledgeable

This teacher gives quizzes every day in class, and when you write papers for her it is either her way or the highway (the problem is that she never tells you what she is looking for). Also, she does not listen to the students; only her ideas count.
Great class, just listen to the lectures every week then do the quizzes. Kind of an odd fellow talked a lot about mummies in a couple lectures. But interesting nevertheless.
Easy grader! Easy A if you go to the class and do the assignments! 100% recommend!

Probably the easiest history class you can take. Lecture video, a one-page analysis of an excerpt, and a quiz every week you can use your notes for. There was also a midterm essay and there was supposed to be a final essay, but he just made it extra credit. He is a super lenient grader on the writing assignments, take him if you want an easy A.

The course had little workload and the professor was super nice. 
Quizzes were straight forward and the grading for the papers were lenient. He accepted all late work with no penalties at the end of the semester.
I would recommend taking this course as a GE with him :)
Online class at last moment

Evident that he loves and is passionate about his work, but is absolutely not the professor to take for just a GenEd credit. SO much reading and homework twice a week and the exams were impossible-as well as the majority of our grades. He also grades our essays insanely hard, I've never had a problem with essays but he called my writing "appalling"

DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASSES. Unless you are a religious zealot whose entering into this class having already memorized proverbs and other sections of the bible, you will do horribly. He is so unorganized, and sends out EXTENSIVE study guides for tests that are only 20 q's. The amount of info. he expects you to memorize is absurd. A deplorable teacher.

Professor Meier certainly is a fun professor. He's funny, lighthearted, and knows his stuff. This class is unbelievably lecture and reading heavy. Every single day of class you will have a quiz on the reading from the night before. Also, I just did my final today and there is still not a single grade in the grade book, so I don't even know my grade

Dr. Meier not only knows what he is talking about but desires for us to understand too. Be willing to ask questions if you don't understand & keep asking until you get the answer you are looking for. I have never taken a class w/ a more qualified/educated, yet caring Professor. He has slim office hours, but is always willing to have them filled.

Sam Meier is what you hope for when taking a class in college. The only word that can be used to accurately describe him is "scholar." He's not only a world-class expert in his field, but he's probably the best teacher I've ever had. In 4 years of college, I've never actually looked forward to a class, but Sam Meier changed that. Value class!

Dr. Meier is the best professor I have ever taken in college. He knows his field extremely well, and thus any question you could possibly think of he probably has a good answer to. Biblical and Post Biblical Lit was again probably my favorite class I've taken. Extremely thorough and thought-provoking on a historical and philosophical level. 10/10

There is daily HW, but this class really makes you think. You enjoy a reading of portions of the Hebrew Bible and learn a lot, especially the little details that make huge differences like mistranslations. This is a value class. 10/10 definitely recommend taking a course with Dr. Meier while at tOSU.

Dr Meier is a great guy. His lectures are a refreshing change because he isn't afraid to take a Judeo-Christian look on modern issues (it's a Bible class after all). However, I'm just not a reading guy, and I don't comprehend things easily, so I didn't do very well.  His lectures are very informative, but hard to tell what you actually need to know

I generally enjoy history (that's why I'm minoring in it), but I did not enjoy this class at all.  It's very unorganized, and you never know what will be on the exams.  He gives you a verrrrry extensive study guide, yet the tests are only 20 questions long.  If you are not familiar with the Bible /Ancient Israel at all, don't take this class!

Dr. Meier is a very talented professor who is truly passionate about the subjects he teaches, and now, with this class finished, I can truly say this class has been a positive experience. For a GE, it is a bit of work in this class, but it is totally fair and you deserve the grade you receive. My favorite professor this semester.

There is homework that is assigned after every class, but most of it took me less than 30 minutes. His tests were moderately hard, but if you go to class, pay attention, and study, you should EASILY get a B if not an A. Definitely take this class, it fills up a GE and Meier is a cool dude.

Class was super interesting and Dr. Meier was extremely helpful.  He welcomed you at Office Hours and would even drop by our Midterm or Final Exam study sessions to answer any questions we had.  You definitely have to put in the effort and do the homework, but if you do, there's no reason you shouldn't get a good grade!
HE IS A HORRIBLE TEACHER! Do not take this class if it is a GE! It is soooo much work and the tests are so hard! He is so unorganized! SAVE YOURSELVES!

I LOVED him! He gives homework every night, and quizzes every class but as long as you do the homework you should get an A on all them. To get a good grade you MUST attend class, or else you are going to find exams impossible to pass. He has a great gift in teaching and I actually look forward to his lectures & find myself wishing they were longer!

He is an amazing professor. He is so passionate about what he teaches. You never get bored and you learn so much about the Old Testament. Its a great break class from all the demanding academic classes.

Dr. Meier is a good professor if you are majoring or minoring in his class subjects. DO NOT take any of his classes if they are for GECs. I am and he puts in little effort to help me when I am struggling even though I am interested in the subject of the class. He also gives about 2-3 hrs of hw a night making it impossible to focus on other classes.
The best class I've ever taken. Absolutely fascinating and highly recommended.
Definitely not an easy class, but it was very interesting and I did learn a lot. Difficult work, but not impossible. Worthwhile class.

Dr. Meier is awesome.  Basically, he was the reason I actually looked forward to each day during spring quarter.  He was always in a good mood, always making jokes, and always teaching from bell to bell.  I did not really have an interest in Israeli history before, but now it is one of my favorite areas of history.
Dr. Meier was an excellent teacher! Work load was heavy but the class was very interesting. Made class fun and was very knowledgeable. Great guy and awesome teacher!

Awesome professor.  He makes you learn a lot, but makes it interesting.  His tests are straight off the homework, so don't slack off during the quarter.  If you keep up with the work, you don't have to study much for the tests.  Very helpful!!

Way too much work for a 300-level class.  Completely non-conceptual; all knowledge had to be memorized, and the sheer amount of stuff we had to learn was ludicrous.  Homework was busywork, and it took a long time.  Too many readings, and we had to know the plots and characters in ALL of them.  Never went over homework, no review in class.
Kept class interesting.  The homework wasn't that bad, and the quizzes are incredibly easy.  It's easy to get a good grade as long as you do the work and take notes in class.
No Comments

I loved Dr. Meier!  He is energetic, ties in his material to pop culture, and made us laugh a lot.  I hadn't had any exposure to Israel history before this class but he made it very interesting.  He demands heavy amounts of homework but if you do it, you learn a lot.
Good professor, grade hangs on 4 tests, 5 quizzes and attendance so make sure you go to class.
Great prof!
He's Awesome.

awesome professor with great short and sufficient lectures. three books to read, a lot of the time-consuming parts of the course are the reading and the three lecture videos which are 15-30 minutes each. answers emails quickly. a great professor to talk about anything outside of the course material.

One of my favorite professors. Very short and succinct lectures, grades are clearly laid out, and this professor will reach out to you to check up on how you are managing the course. Grading for papers are also clearly explained and quizzes are 100% based on the notes and textbook.

If you want to take this class because you think it will be easy with your schedule, dont. It requires a significant amount of time to do the weekly work. You have weekly quizzes, multiple readings, podcasts to listen, primary sources to read. Also her lecture videos are just her talking with no visuals. Missing 1 question on a quiz B on quiz

Dr. Bond is alright. She requires lots of reading and her lectures can drag on sometimes. Lots of her instructions aren't super clear. Her lectures are mostly just her reading her lecture notes and she engages the class sometimes. She is very nice and mostly always available outside of class for any help and she is very approachable

Dr. Bond is extremely sweet and genuinely wants her students to do well. She is always available outside of class if you ever have any questions. If you are not a history major/minor or not extremely passionate about history you may struggle in her class. Reading is mandatory to do well and there is a lot of it. Definitely recommend.
Super helpful and understanding! Does a good job of integrating all varieties of media into the classroom!

Professor Bond's class was interesting but it was defiantly not what I expected. There were way too many readings due every week and rarely did anyone in the class actually finish them. She was a very tough grader and her expectations were not very clear.

Professor Judd is one of the best professors I've had at OSU. She is always ready to help students, and really cares about the course material. Get ready to read and participate, it's all graded. There's a big group project as well instead of a final exam. Judd is great, would take again.

Honestly, I was excited to take this course but It really disappointed me. TopHat daily questions were given for accuracy and attendance, need to attend class and answer the daily questions correctly or you really won't pass. Class total 100 points, midterm, and final exam heavy. Long boring lectures 9AMs on Friday:( difficult to pay attention to.

She was an ok instructor. Personally, she didn't seem very approachable. If you turn in something late, you get a 0. Ur grade is heavily reliant on the exams. You will have to read many articles, sources, +some books that you will need to draw off of for the final. If you study those, you will b fine. The midterm&final both consist of timed essays.

Robin Judd was a fine professor. You can tell she was passionate about the subject, her style of teaching just was not for me. There were barely any points in the grade book, so the midterm and final are basically the only grades that matter. Class is basically just listening to lecture and taking notes for an 80 minutes, not a bad class though.

Lecture heavy (obviously) but an amazing professor who knows what she's teaching. Kind and approachable and very understanding. Our midterm and final contained essays, which was stupid because we never wrote any in class, so you aren't sure of her grading method (or the TA's) or what she's looking for. But, she says she changes format each year.
Couse structure is awful and sets you up for failure with the strict grading. Way to many readings to comprehend. Not easy.

Professor Judd is definitely my favorite professor from my first semester of college. She is amazing and, if you participate in class, will get to know you. She is also super easy to communicate with. Go to her office hours and talk to her!! Literally the reason I'm doubling in history and english education!

Professor Judd is one of the best professors I've ever had. Her class is very interesting and she does a great job describing the events of the Holocaust. Definitely pay attention in class, you will do so much better on the final just by paying attention.

Prof. Judd was an amazing lecturer. She was interesting, but her lectures went fast. The class is very reading-heavy with homework assignments that went with the readings. She offers extra credit, but her course is revolved around a midterm and final (both essays). she has TAs to grade, but she is also a grader. Kind of tough, but fair.

Professor Judd is an incredible professor! She's very knowledgeable and passionate about what she teaches. There are no tests or quizzes, the homework assigned is simple and she even gives you extra credit opportunities. The only tests in her class are the midterm (1 essay) and final (2 essays). If you show up, take notes, and do the hw  get A!

Professor Judd was one of the best professors I have ever had. You can tell she is VERY passionate about what she teaches and knows so much about everything. It is very easy to reach her and she gives great feedback. The class is lecture heavy so if you skip it, you will fall behind. Just put in the work, read and listen and youll do fine.

Professor Judd is truly amazing. The class can be difficult but honestly if you just pay attention in class and do the weekly response questions, it shouldn't be too difficult. The class is only worth 100 points and 50% of that is the midterm and final. In all, she is a great teacher and is truly passionate about teaching this subject.

Actually the hardest class I've ever taken(against Calc 3 and OCHEM) though Judd is a real gem and very respectable. The class design makes it easy to fall behind. The wording of questions she asks is very ambiguous at times and makes it difficult to find what she wants. If you want help go to the TAs. You WILL come out of this class knowing more.

You MUST read outside of class, every week. Small quizzes, they are easy, but you need to read the material. The exams are 90% short answer and 5 paragraph essays, so you need to know what your doing. You. Need to cite the readings in your papers. She is very passionate and VERY willing to help. Her class is pretty difficult, so pay attention!
Hour and 25 minute class made this class very boring. But only had to meet twice a week. She emails back promptly. Very few assignments. Lots of content. Do the easy extra credit she offers.

She knows what she is teaching,very passionate,and eager to see students in office hours. Each class starts with a quiz about assigned material to be read prior to class. A lot of reading in class:4 memoirs/books. her TA's are very tough graders in all assigned material: exams,essay and quizzes. Gives study guide with possible questions before exam

Professor Judd is super passionate & knowledgable about the subject of the Holocaust. She gives an easy, 2 point reading quiz every class so you can't miss many, but going to class isn't a problem because it's interesting. She does a great job teaching & keeping your attention. She is also very willing to meet with you outside of class. Loved her!
Professor Judd is very passionate but somewhat standoffish. She doesn't give feedback, and if she does, its most likely a rude comment about your work. The TAs do all the work. She just lectures

Professor Judd loves what she does and what she is teaching about so much. It comes through in her lectures amazingly. I don't know how anyone could not be interested by what she has to say. Doing the readings are pretty essential to doing well. Grade is based mostly on midterm, final, and short essay, so preparation is very important to success!

Professor Judd is an incredible person. HIST2475 (History of the Holocaust) was a decent amount of reading and a LOT of work to prepare for the midterms and final but she is with you the whole way. She has the most amazing ability to keep the class engaged and asking/answering questions despite the large size. 10/10

She is a nice person but when I went into office hours to get feedback on my essay outlines for the midterm I got none.  Just a bunch of questions as answers and not much  help.  I was excited to take this class and learn more about the only topic in history that is bearable to me and was disappointed.  Study guide only helps for essays on tests

I learned more in this class than I thought I would. She clearly knows her stuff. Attendance is semi-mandatory via one question quizzes. Refers to the textbook(s) throughout the course and it is usually a requirement to refer to the text in essays. She provides excellent study guides that include the prompts for exams essays -- easy A with the SG.
She grades pretty tough but the material is very interesting. Even though her midterm and final require a lot of studying, she provides a fantastic study guide to help you.

A clear professor that clearly knows what she's teaching, there is a heavy reliance on the textbook and you go through about a chapter per week, but it's interesting and her personality make the lectures a bit more enjoyable than most other professors I've had. TA's were good too, but they may not be the same.

Not too difficult of a class. European history isn't really an attention getter for me but professor Judd made it bearable. I went to every lecture and section, but never did the readings and got an A.

This was a very interesting class, and I love professor Judd. I usually have trouble staying focused in 2 hour classes but it is very easy to stay engaged to the subject matter and to what she's saying. She's very approachable and is very interested in teaching and helping her students. I would highly recommend this class!

Great professor. She goes attendance checks once in a while. The midterm consists of one essay question (choice from two, gives you 5 in advance to study) and multiple choice questions. The multiple choice questions are from a terms list she gives you in advance. The final is similar to the midterm with 2 essay questions and multiple choice q's.

make sure you always agree with her. always read, always participate, but do not, i repeat do not contradict her. participation is 30 percent of the final grade!! I took jewish history all through highschool(her "specialty") and loved it but i swore off jewish history for my college career(after 1 class) because of her.

For such an interesting topic, I did not like this class! It is hard to know what things are necessary to take notes on-but make sure that you record all dates & details. Make a timeline to help you keep all of the dates straight. Prepare your exam essays far in advance & go in & have her look them over so  you know EXACTLY what she is looking for.
Simply excellent.

Professor Judd and her TA are very lenient graders. Discussions are stimulating. I have had no other professor who can so wonderfully generate discussion in a 90 person lecture. She is easy to talk to. She is excellent.

Quizzes, easy and no problem, just read the material on the PPT for next lecture. Term Paper, she will grade it like an ENGLISH teacher so be careful. Midterm/Final, easy, except you must be on the same mind set as professor Judd for essays!, try to understand questions on study guides, and ask her if you need clarification on essay questions

Robin acts as if her class should be your first priority and expects a lot of outside knowledge and work outside of class. This was the most boring and most frustrating GEC I have ever taken at OSU. She also grades papers like she is an English teacher, picking on every little detail.
Robin was a very thorough instructor and expected a lot of outside preparation from her students. If you didn't put work in outside of class, you definitely suffered in class.

If you want to think anything contrary to what she thinks, and express that thought in class... then kiss an A goodbye. Only attend this class if you plan of days of reading, impossible class discussion, and a poor sense of humor.

I thought this class was really easy and I learned a lot. She posts the slides online which is great. After the midterm I actually stopped going to lectures and only went to weekly the recitations. Do the readings and go to the reviews before the midterm and final and there is no reason to not do well. She's very helpful and knows her stuff!
Very unprofessional. So much tension between her and the students she sees as "not ideal." Seems more like a highschool teacher than a college professor. It didn't seem like she understood adults.
Really hard for a 100 level class. Could be a really good professor for a more involved class.
The lectures were great but the tests were horrible.

Fantastic class with a totally engaged and inspiring professor. While she's a tough grader, this ended up being my favorite class at OSU. Take a class with her-- if you put in the time, you won't regret it.
The class itself was interesting..I actually enjoyed the lectures.  Her grading, however, was extremely difficult.  I put a huge amount of effort into the class to only come out with a B.
Although the lectures were very interesting...her grading is very difficult.

i really didnt like the class or her at all i thought she was way to hard on the class and expected a lot. I also thought it was way to hard for a 300 level class. If you dont want difficult work that takes a long time, I would suggest taking another class

There are a****load of books to read for this class.  If you dont read them you will have a hard time getting a good grade.  A lot of papers and quizzes and Prof. Judd gets real into the specifics.  She is a very hard grader.

I absolutely loved this class!  Professor Judd is incredibly knowledgable about Jewish studies, and she was able to answer any questions we had regarding the Holocaust.  She graded fairly and also gave us the midterm essay questions ahead of time.  If you're wiling to work hard, you will do well.  I highly recommend her!
She is a good and interesting lecturer. Puts everything you need to know in the notes. I thought that this class was too difficult for a 300 level, but still worth taking if you can put the time in.
No Comments
She is a great lecturer and very willing to answer questions and disscuss questions and concerns with her students.  Her class structure is very fair and straightforward.
Very enthusiastic about history! Makes the class very interesting!
This was one of the best classes I took at OSU.  Professor Judd is a great professor and clearly has a passion for the material.  I recommend this class to everyone
Incredible teacher, my favorite here.  Demanding work but well worth it!

favorite professor by far. she's not easy by any means, but organized and passionate. she really forces her students to think and goes out of her way to make sure they succeed. she wants to help and to get to know her students and it shows
Fabulous teacher! She really cares about her subject and her students-- and it shows.
It was hard for a 100-level class and definitely catered toward her passion for Jewish Studies. She's a very demanding teacher but also very knowledgeble.
Great teacher, very interesting.  The power points don't detract from the lecture, they are just there as an outline and a way to provide source material.
She is really passionate about what she teaches and it comes through she grades pretty hard though. I do think I learned alot in her class too.
Only thing is its a power point lecture
she's nice but i thought she was pretending.  and the class is really tailored to her interests, jewish stuides.  thats not a bad thing, i'm just telling you.
great teacher and great person!
she is simply excellent.
No Comments

This class is so incredibly boring and the lectures made no sense, I do not think we ever actually got into the American Revolution. Random group projects that had to be done outside of class, and then were graded extremely tough. Odd points taken off w no feedback given. Really nice, understanding, and helpful, just boring and difficult to improve

Overall, her teaching style is very meh if I could call it anything. There was no order or structure to the class. One day we were in 1776 and the next 1664. The TA never knew what was going on because she lacked communication. Group projects were not assigned during class time. Not a hard class just very boring.

An easy course where you just watch movies and write about them. There is a single group project that's really easy and the course ends on a final paper. The final paper is just four to eight pages and is a creative writing practice (script, a movie pitch, etc.) more than an actual research paper.

Her lectures can be very boring and the slides are not useful. However, if you just pay attention you're able to pick out a couple of important things to use in discussion posts and essay exams. Exam questions are given beforehand and there are reviews.

Prof Newell is very boring. You need to watch the lectures to do well in the class but they are just soooo boring. She is very monotone, uses slides that are very boring, and rambles on for a whole hour. If you have a short attention span or don't do well with long boring lectures with no notes, then don't take this class.

This was an awesome class analyzing U.S. History as portrayed though film. Each week, we had one film to watch and had a discussion post due. We watched history lectures about the time period as well. There is a group project watching an additional movie. I highly recommend this class! Newell was amazing and brought in really nice guest lecturers.

I took this as my honors history GE. The class was very interesting, and you can't deny she is very knowledgeable on the subject. However, she expected us to read 5 entire books (including her own, 300+ page book), and there was no real grading criteria. I was surprised to get an A, as she consistently gave me a 93% for no clear reason.

I took this class as an elective because it sounded interesting and it was a lot more work than I was hoping for. Alot of papers with alot of reading. With that said, Newell does a great job of making it manageable and nothing is graded too harshly. She is also very helpful in her office hours

Prof Newell is wonderful. She has good power points and interesting lectures. She is great about preparing you for exams and holds extra review sessions. She is very open to peoples opinions. Its not hard to get a good grade!
Prof. Newell is great! There is a lot of class discussion, and there is a movie at least once every two weeks. There is a lot of reading and a research paper though, but it is worth the work.

I really enjoyed this class. This may sound cliche but I really am not interested in history, I was required to take this class. This lady really knows her stuff. She barley references her notes and she can rattle off such specific and interesting details. Lots of required reading, but honestly, I barley read anything and passed with an A-.

Dr. Newell knows her American history very well in general. Unfortunately, her lectures may get boring after quite a while. The readings are too long, class participation is required, plus the extra credit is not much, but the grades were fair in general, depending on your GTA. Nevertheless, I would recommend her for a decent grade in history tho.

tons of readings expected for recitations, reading in textbooks, 2 other books during class, george washington biography and uncle tom's cabin for us, both hefty books, as well as a book she personally puts out composed of writings, not a tough class, just not enough time in the day for the readings

Very slow on returning grades. Not an easy grader either. Takes attendance and expects participation which is 20% of your grade. Wouldn't take a class with her again. She cares about history but isn't the nicest teacher.
not a bad teacher, easy to understand and the notes are online
she was a good lecturer, your grades come from your TA, so it depends on who you get. I got Robert Bennett, who I liked a lot...Newell is pretty good

Lectures tend to be boring and she always runs over, but exams are super easy.  If you have recitation, GO!, the GTA's do not lecture more material they clear up everything from lecture and really prepare you for the exams.  She is also super helpful in office hours, if you have questions she is more than happy to help you out!
Not too bad.  Lecture can be pretty dull, but the class isn't very hard.  Lots of extra credit opportunities.

talks a lot, allows you to speak, but will always find ways to discourage you with counter answers.  seems to think shes always right never wrong.brings up good pts at times, but others..questionable. favors certain students that has the same mindset as hers or those who speak what she wants to hear.
No Comments

She is one of the best History profs I had so far. History can be boring but she does a good job in making it interesting. There is 1 paper to write and for the mid term + final, you'll get the terms and questions that will be on both exams. The TA's were excellent too! Take her if you can!!!
Great teacher, test are very easy, cares about history, and gives extra credit. Lectures can be boring but she does her best to make them interesting.  Gives you the tests before you take them.

The thing that irritated me with these class were the group presentations. Her lecture would run TOO long and then she would start doing something new at 12:15 when the class was suppose to be over at 12:18. You will NEVER get out on time!

lectures are terribly boring. Her notes in class mean absolutely nothing. There is no coherent or logical flow and order to her notes or what she is talking about. She skips from subject to subject, and half of the presentations in class she doesn't even tell you what they are. SHe speaks the whole time and doesn't stop tlaking. An awful lecturer.
Not a bad class. Midterm and Final were very easy. She pretty much gives you the test before hand and the test is based on ID's and Essay's.

She is very intelligent, and obviously knows what she is talking.  Her enthusiasm about the subject encourages the students to want to learn the material.  If you do the reading you will get a good grade.  Recitations are important, don't miss them.

Her lectures can be boring at times, but you can tell she really enjoys history. She's pretty clear and articulate and always willing to help. The tests are pretty simple - IDs and an essay (or two). Not a difficult class if you go to class and occasionally do the reading.

She explains things clearly, but class is unfairly hard. All essay writing, and waaaaaaaaaaay too much reading and work. Grading is hard. Few EC opportunities, but won't boost yr grade by much. Don't take this class
UHN!
very good prof
What fun! Interactive lessons and online powerpoint notes.  She has it together!  I would recommend her to anyone!  DOn't miss the Constitutional Convention class!
No Comments
She's way cool. Encourages and fosters student input.  Certainly a Prof. I would recommend.  Plus, she's accessible for students.

Difficult class, but the lectures and readings do a good job of explaining the subject matter. Kern grades heavily based on writing and grammar, which is unusual for a history class, but it probably made me a better writer.

I wholeheartedly despised this class and the professor. He is not an engaging lecturer at all and can be condescending to students, which made it hard for me to want to go. Attendance is mandatory, AND DO NOT SHOW UP LATE to class. He is a harder grader on essays than other teachers I've had, but if you're good at writing you'll do fine.

Beware, Dr. Kern has a whole lot of unspoken rules that can really hurt your grade. For example, if you turn in a paper late he threatens to automatically fail you. If you have 4 unexcused absences he lowers your grade a whole letter. Despite what he says, these rules are nowhere on the syllabus and they came as a big shock to me and my classmates.

I try to be forgiving with professors on this site, but Kern was one I can't recommend at all. He commands such a high level of understanding of theory and history from his students, but then fails to explain and help you understand. He grades on incredibly nitpicky things too. Overall, this class was exhausting despite it being just a 2000 level.

As much as I want to complain about Kern, I became a better writer because of his class. Also learned a lot about love. The only assignments are to read 3 novels and write 3 short papers. You dont need lecture to write, but your grade will go down so just go. He grades heavily on grammar, which sucks, but he also grades based on improvement.

This class had 4 1200 word papers and discussion posts instead of tests. Dr. Kern is an awesome professor, and I enjoyed his sarcastic sense of humor. He's always willing to talk after class and enjoys answering questions. This class was co-taught with Dr. McHale, who is also awesome. They worked very well together!

He gives some of the best lectures I've ever had at OSU! His way of looking at history may be unorthodox at times since he loves referencing literature, but this guy will really make you think and you will definitely get something out of this class. I had a blast and it was an easy A (just be prepared to have him critique your grammar)

He doesnt make sense. He will always get off topic. If you go back to study for your papers from his lecture slides, dont. His slides do not make sense even if you were in class. He cares more about writing than anything else. Not your typical history course.

Kern is a wonderful professor. He is incredibly knowledgeable about his subject area and he always does a wonderful job of making class interesting. Kern teaches through lectures while supplementing them with literature to provide an alternative angle. Be prepared to read and write but it is nothing that can't be handled.

I took his class thinking that it would be a somewhat interesting class on European history. Instead, the class was spent studying fictional narratives in the first half of the semester and Freudian psychology in the second half. Knowledgeable about what he teaches but lectures have very little to do with the class. I took his HIST2204 class.

You must go to class when he goes over the readings, which are also excellent pieces of literature. Attendance is taken at every class, but if you're ill you can send him an e-mail and he'll understand. Grammar and Freud are his specialties, just remember that some ideas are out-dated. If you sit in front and write well, he'll remember who you are.

I loved Professor Kern's class. He's intensely knowledgeable about his subject and conveys complicated topics well. Specifically, his unit on Nietzsche is some of the best teaching I've ever encountered. Take your time on the papers.

I loved taking the History of Love! Kern uses fictional literature as evidence to display what was occurring within relationships of that time. Class entails reading three novels and writing three papers. He provides all the evidence that he would like in your papers during class. Read, attend, and pay attention to detail in your essays to succeed.

What seemed like an interesting history class has quickly turned into continuous, opinionated preaching on all subjects other than history. The class is lecture heavy, unfortunately he constantly fails to stay on topic. Additionally, he doesn't grade based on actual knowledge of history, but on grammar. Overall, he is a self-righteous know it all.

Prof. Kern surprised me a lot with this class. I wasn't expecting the course to be so literary-heavy; the history aspect is almost supplementary to the reading/writing that you have to engage in, which I didn't dislike. I liked his concepts, although they were heavily opinionated. He related art, English, and social history in interesting ways.
Awesome teacherreally cared about helping me improve my writing. Lots of reading, but very interesting lectures. Sometimes goes off on tangents, but if you get on his wavelength, it's a lot of fun.

He is very passionate aabout what he taught us. To be honest I couldn't care less about the subject matter, it bored me. But, complaining about history classes not being "english class"? What are you talking about? History is all about conveying your point in a toughtful way. That's exactly what Kern taught me to do. He made me into a good writer.

I took this course for my history GE and really enjoyed it. The only grades are 3 papers that are graded rather tough. I've become a much better writer as a result (more helpful than English). If you are looking for a little challenge, this is the course. Kern really inspired me to open my mind, material was dry at times, but he's an excellent prof
