Dr. Kern gives fascinating lectures, and I like how passionate he is about improving students' writing.  His was one of the classes I learned most from, and I plan on reading one of his books over break.  I openly disagreed with many of his philosophic opinions, but he was always respectful and fairly open-minded.  His class is worth the work!
LOVE THIS PROF HE IS SO COOL AND SEXY AFFFFFFFFFFFF hot dayummmmmm

Kern made my History major worthwhile. Don't complain about the care he puts into your papers, guys and gals! You know how much work that is? Appreciate it. Writing is the most important/indispensable thing you will learn in college. His obsession with Freud does lead to more talk about love&sex than I needed. Newsflash: Profs. are quirky.

While Kern is quite intelligent and passionate, he is equally arrogant. Such self-importance really gets in the way of some great thoughts. I love analysis and welcome criticism, but, when regarded with such condescension, am dissuaded from participation. You either love Kern or you hate him. Prepare for challenge, insult, and lots of writing.

Dr. Kern is extremely intelligent and insightful. His class is well-organized to present the evolution of intellectual history. He gives feedback that is constructive and attentive. I found his class to be both thought-provoking and enjoyable. He also has a great sense of humor - very Woody Allen-esque.

It is obvious that the people who dislike Kern do not think broadly and are not in school to expand their minds. Kern is incredibly intelligent, and this scares many people when it should embolden them to learn more. to say that these lectures are useless is to say that you have made no use of them. I was a better writer after these classes.

I found his 19th Century European Thought and Culture class to be highly thought-provoking.  He focuses a lot on writing and is very helpful on that front.  He tells you exactly how to get an A, so you only do badly if you ignore him.  Showing improvement is enough to boost your grade.  Get to know him if you have the chance.  He changed my life.

This was one of the worst classes I have ever taken. I am an eduaction major and it was very discouraging to have a class taught by someone who is not a good teacher and does not seem interested in improving. Dr. Kern is an incredibly arrogant know it all who fails to actually teach you anything about history. I was incredibly disappointed.

If the course description interests you at all, you won't be disappointed with this course. Dr. Kern is brilliant in his subject field, and his writing workshops are extremely helpful. Easily one of the best courses I've had at OSU yet. I only wish I had the opportunity to take the semester version of this course.

Worst teacher out there. Diverges most lectures to sex. TA's grade papers to difficult. I spent a lot of time on the paper and still received a B. i mean come on, my GPA is a 3.8, i dont slack. do not recommend whatsoever.

The man can be just plain offensive. He's degraded the women in my class several times (his first question for the girls was "when did you first realize men were always going to be superior?"). On top of that, it's a history class - not an English course. I appreciated only having papers to do, but when he grades on his preferences, it's awful.

I think this class is easy, His class is beyond boring.. I only come when the TA ask me to come, the rest of his talk is nonsense and useless. plus he's not grading our paper, only the TA, come to TA class only, you'll be fine.

Prof. Kern would be interesting to listen to if I didn't have to figure out what he wanted us to know. He will go off on tangets (interesting ones, sometimes) but you never know what information to remember. No powerpoints - all talking. As long as you have a good TA and actually put forth some effort, the class isn't too hard.

His lectures are horrible, so hope your TA is helpful. I went to 3 of his lectures and managed a B+, so it all honestly depends on how well your TA re-teaches the material to you. Don't count on being able to comprehend much of Kerns lectures.Just read the books he assigns. Papers & midterm aren't difficult.More of an english professor than history

boring lectures, and most are useless, but the important one's are what give you EVERYTHING for essays. he seemed odd, but really into what he was teaching. his TA's grade papers way too hard, and they worry more about english, not historical content. overall not bad, but i would recommend another prof if possible if you want to learn about HISTORY

He has high standards, which I appreciate. But part of being a good professor is knowing your audience. This is a survey course but he lectured like it was a grad seminar. There was no flow or clarity in lectures- I mostly learned everything from my TA. That said, this would have been a really enjoyable class if someone else was teaching it.

High intellectual standards and authentic concern for students is Kern's hallmark.  No teacher of mine has ever critiqued papers with the flair and attention to detail as Kern.  His rigor, energy, and love of subject can be overwhelming; he is not for the timid and faint of heart, but stay the course with him.  He will change your life.

Prof. Kern is a nice guy but his lectures are not best organized and he cares exclusively about your writing.I wouldn't object to a focus on writing but he is a  of History not an English professors so his hang-ups about style won't necessarily improve your writing. In this class you will learn how to write the way Prof. Kern does for better or....

Interested in his subject, but a bit self-centered, not in an arrogant way, but rather more self-absorbed.  He assigns his own book in his 20th century class, an epic tome of a monograph wich reveals the depth of his knowledge.  His class is as muhc a writing workshop as it is a series of history lectures.

He's been teaching about 40 years. Though its a history, he mostly worries about how well you write on the topics. Bark is worse than his bite on grading/criticism of papers. He is funny in a pathetic kind of way, seems a little distant when approached personally. Always willing to help, and lighting fast on email response. Overall, an ubermensch.

This is a really nice prof who is very interested in who well you write.  If you aren't interested in working on your writing, stay away.  If you want improve, sign on for his classes.  Tough grading on papers, but generous with credit for participation.  Overall- a really good guy.

for a 500 level class, this is preety easy, plus, its not really a history class, u just read a few novels, such as frankenstein, and write papers on them, the guys a really good teacher and its a class you will look forward to going to

Engaging, informative, accessible, knowledgeable, enthusiastic. I really can't say enough nice things about her lectures. Generous grader. She had the entire class fascinated by Roman history, including me.

I don't rate professors that but she was amazing! Very passionate about the subject and went above & beyond to help students. Definitely the most interesting History course I've ever taken. There are quizzes, a midterm exam, and an open-note final exam (final is just 2 short essays). There are also extra credit assignments if you mess up.
I loved this professor and course! She was the nicest prof I've ever had. 10/10 would recommend.
Avoid at all cost.

I have now taken 3015 and 3016 with professor Stebenne. While his teaching style may not be for everyone, he is my favorite professor I have had during my time at Ohio State. Show up to class and you will get an A.

I've taken two courses from Professor Stebenne at Ohio State and he is easily my favorite professor. He is incredibly knowledgeable about his subjects and is genuinely interested in them. I look forward to his lectures every week, I wish all professors were as likable as he is.

This course was very lecture heavy and the overall grade was pretty much decided by the midterm, final and a book review. It isn't necessary really to finish every assigned book as long as you can understand the theme and ideas the book provides. Dr. Stebenne clearly cares about this period of history but lectures can be very boring at times.

Knowledgeable and gives great lectures. Honestly wouldn't have a complaint if it weren't for the fact that he doesn't put anything online. You literally don't know your grade until after finals. Your grade in the class is determined by a midterm, paper, and final, so there isn't much room for error which makes it extra anxiety-inducing.

Lowest grade I've ever gotten in a course but it's mostly my fault. As long as you don't miss class, plan ahead for midterm paper, and study the main themes Prof Stebenne lectures on, you will do fine. Class is only made up of 2 written response exams and 1 paper, so it is hard to get an A. But I learned a ton & his lectures are the absolute best.

I enjoyed Prof. Stebenne but for a history GE...I wouldn't recommend. It's an interesting class and he's very knowledgeable on many subjects, but it's not worth it. You're graded on a midterm, paper, final, and attendance. He doesn't use Carmen so you will have no idea how you're doing until it's too late. Left me wishing I took a different GE.

Prof. Stebenne really knows a ton about what he teaches, and often interjects with personal anecdotes that help to explain a topic better. Hes old fashioned in the way that he lectures but always seems to keep the class engaged- if you participate and put in the effort, youll enjoy the class and learn a ton too.
This guy is greAt
Get ready to participate.

I had Dr. Stebenne for my introductory class to history. He's a nice guy, pretty talkative. He will occasionally go over the class time. In my class he does a great job of facilitating discussion. We did a lot of writing in my class (6 papers over the semester) but he gives good feedback. He's very approachable as well. I would recommend him.

I like him a lot.  He's a fountain of knowledge and basically fires information at you for an hour and twenty minutes so be ready to write lots of notes.  As long as you take notes you'll be just fine.

He is one of the most knowledgeable and interesting professors I've ever had, and he is basically a living encyclopedia of modern American history. I'm a history major so I never found his lectures boring but others apparently do. Attendance is graded, but the grade is the percentage of days you attended, which is the fairest policy I've ever seen.

Tough to listen to. I was in the class with history majors and they were falling asleep as much as I was. Attendance counts but not for much, then there's only a paper and two exams. I didn't  pay much attention and got a B on the first midterm and on the paper. But not worth listening to him drone on. If you have another option, avoid him.

Professor Stebenne know his stuff. But it is all law, and incorporates it HEAVY into all of his classes (took others as well). He refuses to use Carmen, and his "updated powerpoint slides" are nothing. Very difficult to take notes. Avoid if possible.

He is hard but he is the best history professor I have ever had. If you are genuinely interested in history, take his class. His TA's are decent graders. He only has a paper and two examns. Study throughout the quarter and you will get an A. I had him for 565 and 566. Both awesome classes

Prof. Stebenne is one of the best History Professors at Ohio State. If you attend the lectures and don't surf the web while in class, you will be able to get an A. He doesn't really provide much of a study guide for exams besides ID's, but his syllabus lets you know what to expect and he'll tell you.  But don't take it if you want an easy A!

A great class and a great teacher if you want to go to law school! I learned so much about the Constitution and the Supreme Court from him. He also teaches at the law school so you know he knows what he's talking about. Great professor!

This class was fascinating! It's not a class you should take if you want to slack off- you have to do the reading and come to lecture. It can be a challenging course but the information he gives is pretty interesting and the exams can be quite fun. His background is in law so he often tells the class interesting tidbits about case law, etc.

Professor Stebenne is very smart and his class discussions are interesting.  For this class there's a lot of reading but you don't really have to do it...just skim.  The research paper is really in depth but he is not a hard grader and gives a lot of suggestions on your 1st draft.  Overall, great teacher.  Enjoys his job.

A great class for those interested in the Supreme Court and the law. I'm really confused by the ratings below because I found his lectures to be really interesting. If you're not interested in law, it could become boring I guess. He's a difficult, but fair grader - there were 2 take-home essay exams.
Difficult grader, difficult to get along with; has opaque standards for projects, and basically grades on the basis of how much he likes you.
Fair lecturer who presents all sides of the argument.  Very helpful in office hours and a genuinely nice guy.

Decent lectures, but impossible grader. I don't think Stebenne knows what he wants; I went to four office hours and asked tons of questions, did all the reading, and put in 2x as much effort as I have in any other class, but he was still unhelpful and gave me vague comments with low grades. If you can't make a great first impression, watch out.
Very boring and could never understand what he wanted.  I asked questions but he just confused me more!
A super boring lecture..ZZZZ but the class was easy. He has a law degree from Columbia. Not to shabby.

type of professor you have to get to know.if you make an effort beyond the classroom, esp. with emails than he is great.incredibly well-trained.best writing instructor i ever had. hes tough but he can teach you more about writing than anyone else in the department (except maybe boyle) get to know him and you'll be fine if u are smart. great mentor.

Last comment is completely untrue;went into Stebs several times for help and offered none whatsoever, just contradictory & vague instructions; very condescending and just not a good teacher; avoid if you can or if interested in American history and dont want someone who plays favs 24-7-365.

One of my favorite profs. I took many classes with him. He really knows his stuff, he's very moderate politically and very fair. He WILL help you write if you take the time. I'll admite he's monotone, but his message is important if you listen. Great preparation for law school.

Possibly the worst professor i've ever met. Well creditentialed, but the most painful lecture to listen to. Also the most horrible grader ever, gives no feedback, and plays favorites, usually to stupid kids. I ended up withrdawing from his class on the last possible day; he wasted my time and money.
Good at teaching historical writing.  Very interesting, has a lot of good ideas.
No Comments

This man is a weasel.He pretends to welcome questions, but if you go to his office hours he does everything he can to load the work off onto the TAs,who are mostly idiots anyway.Take it with another prof, if you can.

very boring teacher. class is extremely difficult to sit through. his tests/papers are really difficult, but he is willing to talk to you about them if you go to him. overall, its best to pick another prof.

Awful,terrible,worst-whatever you can say.Terrible prof,snobby,arrogant,extremely difficult grader,doesn't care about students or opinions.Worst mistake I ever made at OSU was taking his class-won't do it again.

The worst prof. I've ever had.  Unfair and super-critical of everything, unless he likes you there's no way you can ever meet his expectations.  Gave out an insane amount of work for a 300-level class.  Avoid if possible.
Avoid at all costs.  Very pompous, not helpful, and just not a pleasant experience.  Seems kind of jerky, too.

Very arrogant, downright pompous; "I'm the kind of historian who could wear a white labcoat"; unclear what he wants, then when you give it to him, he finds other things to take off points for, which in the last paper he said not to include.To be

While a very bright individual with an impressive CV, I would not suggest taking a class with him.  He has an odd grading style in which he gives you one grade for content and another for writing style and averages them.  He also plays favorites.
Very well informed and knowledgeable
Borrrrring!  Tests were average difficulty, but the lectures were horrible, he is monotone and mumbled  for 48 min.  He was VERY hard to hear.

"can everyone hear me"- Monotone, tests not hard if you studied All the material. He is very smart and well prepared for class, but a little boring, you have to like the material to pay attention. But still a good teacher and a nice guy.
No Comments
Extremly boring and monotone, test were not hard as long as you study.
great class, excellent clear teaching style
Boring, Boring, Boring.  Difficult to stay awake and pay attention.  Tests were very challenging to prepare for.
Lectures are jam-packed full of info... sometimes too much. He takes the class to an elementary level... it's pretty dry, but he's a good prof.
Hated this man and this class!  Too hard to follow his verbal lectures.  He was the most boring man!!
the best professor I've had at OSU!
Loves to hear his own voice and treats students like elementary kids.
No Comments
Excellent, knowledgeable professor who truly cares about his students.

I really liked Professor Brakke because he is clearly knowledgable about what he is teaching. He was always available to talk to outside of class or after class. Papers and exams were graded very fairly. Lots of reading but readings are talked about in class so it's not terrible if you miss a couple. Not easy for an A but not incredibly hard.

Really niche class so if you aren't super into it, choose something else. Cool history overall. Lots of reading. If you bomb the midterm like I did you're basically screwed. Your grade consists of 2 papers, a midterm, and the final. So mess up on any of those and you're toast. Attendance also counts. Overall, not bad. But also kind of boring

very nice guy, very knowledgable about Christianity and the facts behind it, doesn't get super religious or try to convert, merely presents facts. lecture attendance is optional but recitation is mandatory. 3 big papers, not many assignments, want to go to lecture and take notes besides those he posts online. would definitely recommend!

Absolutely terrible. He's obviously very qualified in what he does, insofar as he knows what he teaches, but the fact that this class (HIST 3229) is available for a GE is absolutely absurd, and moreover, he treats it as if each student in the class is a history major. You get 4 grades, no study guides, no reviews. Prepare to suffer if you take this
Prof. Brakke is one of the friendliest profs I've ever had.  Extremely inviting and very helpful if you go to officer hours.

Brakke is an amazing lecturer and makes information, that probably could be boring, super interesting. There's a lot of work in this class, but you learn A TON! If you're interested in Christianity in the slightest, you'll really enjoy this class.

Amazing professor. The class was very interesting--every day felt like story time. The class doesn't require any knowledge of Christianity or its history to be successful in the course. Be prepared for lots of readings.

I agree with the previous statement that the class was graded harshly, especially for a 2000 level class. I enjoyed Dr. Brakke's lectures. Very interesting & funny. Sam (the TA) was also awesome. Very funny and helpful, just a little tough on the grading. I'd recommend only if you're willing to go to every class and if you're a strong writer.
Great guy, but class is graded extremely harsh. Don't recommend it unless you're simply interested in the material and not your grade.
There is a reason he has such a good rating on here. I would highly recommend that anyone needing to fill a history elective take his class.

Brakke is FANTASTIC!!  This class was my favorite by far at Ohio State.  He is so learned in Christian history and we covered so much in lecture.  He was nice, funny, interesting, and kept the class pretty straightforward.  2 midterms, 2 papers, and a final.  Lots of primary source readings, but I didn't really do them.
By far one of the best professors I have had. He made the lectures really interesting, and was very clear about conveying the material. I would highly recommend him.

Took HIS 222 at SNHU from this professor and honestly do not recommend it. He expects you to go above and beyond the requirements on the rubrics and always has to dock points. Tons of pointless reading and just overall boring. He does do good at giving (sometimes pointless) feedback though.

I had the pleasure of taking his War and Society before 1800 at SNHU, and I enjoyed the class. However, he does require a lot of reading and writing. He was available and ready to assist in any way he could. I don't have any real complaints, but at the same time I don't have many praises either. Good teacher but could have been better.
Honestly probably the worst Professor I ever had. Please do yourself a favor and never take Clemm.

It is an essay based class, but Clemm really does reward thoughtful effort regardless of if you're 100% correct. Don't take 112 if you don't like writing essays. A reasonable amount of effort will get you a good grade in the course, and Clemm is willing to help if you ask for it early enough before the due date of an essay.

He takes himself way too seriously to be teaching a 100-lvl hist course ONLINE. He asks general opinionated questions like "Why is so-and-so important?" and if your answer isn't what HE thinks it should be (i.e. he doesn't feel your reason was important) he won't give you any credit.
DONT EVER TAKE A CLASS THIS THIS TEACHER!!!!

Two things robert does that you will not see with other professors, both of which are outlined on his syllabus making them "law." 1. He does not answer any emails on the weekend  2. He does not accept any late work (even if its barely late and worth 15% of your grade). Hes a young teacher trying to show he is boss but he has no phd. Not recommended
he assigns way too many essays

Professor Dragostinova is great! The class is almost all lectures but it is very interesting and engaging. She manages to make one of the most complex periods of history digestible and entertaining. You can tell she is passionate about what she teaches. If you go to class and engage in the readings, you should be fine in the course.

Nice professor, but her grading criteria are extraordinary, her discussion posts don't make any sense and then when you try to give some form of answer, she tells you to go to the Writing Center. if the assignment does not make any sense and all the students are confused about it, they might as well just do book report assignments then.

Engaging, passionate, and friendly professor. Post-WWII European History is a complicated and fascinating area that I knew nothing about! Grading is a little strange, she isn't particularly harsh but rarely gives grades above 95 and almost never above 98. There's a midterm and final paper, and a bunch of reflection papers (6 required, 10 assigned)

This class was alright I guess. The grading criteria were not clear at all, and you get docked points for the stupidest things. Also, the lectures are so boring, I have taken European History classes multiple times, and this is the worst one.

Despite my loathing of a majority of the material, I genuinely enjoyed this class and felt that I had actually learned a lot by the end of the semester. Dr. Dragostinova is very smart and likes the material she is teaching, which made the class better overall. To pass, all you should really have to do is watch the lectures and take notes!
Don't take this class for an easy elective. Nit-picky grader over small stuff and requires a lot more effort than a 3 credit elective should in my opinion.

She's a great professor. One map quiz, five response papers, a book review, midterm and final research project. The response papers, book review, and quiz are easy but the midterm was difficult (essay) and she looks for specific answers on the prompts. Make sure you understand what she is looking for in the papers. A LOT of reading, but a fun class

Professor Dragostinova was always energetic and excited to teach. As long as you fill out the outlines for every class you dont need to do the readings as the tests are based on the lecture material. The weekly discussion posts were a big part of the grade, but she does give extra credit opportunities and points for attendance which helps.

Professor Dragostinova is an amazing professor for modern european history. If I had to take another class with her I would. She genuinely cares about the material & loves teaching it & I actually was excited to go to class everyday. She's Bulgarian & has a slight accent but its clear & you know what she is saying at all times and isnt a problem.

Professor Cabanes is by far my favorite professor that I have had so far. He is more than willing to hear other views or respond to any questions. His exams are a large part of the grade but he makes sure you are prepared for them. The other assignments were actually enjoyable because it was either a movie or book. Would definitely recommend.

I enjoyed Mr. Cabanes' class a ton. The lectures were interesting. Homework consisted of watching movies and reading a few books so it wasn't difficult. The class is exam-heavy but the only really difficult ones are the Midterm and the Final, the movie exams aren't very difficult and are very fun to do. I would highly recommend this class!

Cabanes is incredibly kind and the lectures were always interesting as he is very knowledgeable about war. The grader for the course is a little tough and there are only 3 quizzes on movies, a midterm, final, & book essay which meant the weight of things was high. Easy review sessions for midterm and final w TONS of extra credit. Take this class!

Clearly knowledgeable about the material and makes the lectures very interesting. Read several short books and watched films outside of class. Grading based on two exams and a paper along with pop quizzes based on the readings. Fairly easy class and a great professor

Heavy course material but done in a way that is super interesting and really engaging. Professor Cabanes is a great professor, he's clear about themes in the class and emphasizes important concepts over intricate details, which is very refreshing for a history course. It's the first history course I've genuinely enjoyed in while.

The class is extremely interesting to the point I wished the lectures were longer. There is a clear grading criteria and the exams are easy. You have to take detailed notes and pay attention if you want to pass. Not going to lecture and sitting on your phone or computer will dramatically affect your grade. There are pop quizzes on readings.

Bruno was a great professor with detailed notes. His lectures were heavy and detailed, but organized and interesting. He and the TA made sure you were prepared for the exams and finals. Very interesting course.
Pop quizzes, one paper, midterm, final. The lectures are chock-full of information and dry if you aren't that into history. But no doubt you will learn a ton.

History minor, expected an easy A, but you will only get an A if you work reasonably hard. This was his first class taught at OSU, so the material is being pared down a lot, but originally it was a LOT of reading (60 pgsnight).FANTASTIC professor, cool French accent, great focus on EXPERIENCE of war (not military tactics). Interesting lectures!
Professor Esposito was an amazing lecturer and person, very accommodating for all circumstances and class work was straightforward!

Well-organized online class consisting of weekly discussion posts and then a final paper. Dr. Esposito's lectures as well as the readings are informative and interesting. Guidelines are clear and you can choose from multiple essay topics for the final essay.

I loved taking this class this semester. I dropped Spanish and needed another to fill its spot and I'm SO glad that I did. Only graded on 7 assignments which are all discussion boards, final essay topic and guidelines given well in advance, and overall just an interesting class. If you're into anthropology like myself I think you'll enjoy it!
I took Professor Tuxberry-Gleissner's SLAVIC 3320 class as a GENED. It was easy and pretty interesting. I would recommend if you are interested in Eastern European culture, if not you WILL be bored.

Goldish is very knowledgeable and funny but goes on tangents which can be boring, especially in a class where no electronics are allowed. He grades fairly, but if you're not interested in the Salem Witch Trials the coursework can get repetitive.

I found this class pretty easy. As long as you can watch a movie and do a (lowkey pretty long) reading every week, you're solid. His lectures are extremely boring but a of of people just left after taking the weekly quiz (which were easy if you did the hw.) The final test was online and the final paper was pretty fun to write.

Pretty easy GE but expect to read 60-90 pages a week. if you are not willing to read and manage the homework effectively, don't take this class. There is a quiz every week then long lecture afterwards. Paper was super easy, but he graded really strict on the final. He's pretty nice and responds quickly.

You can pour tons of time into taking notes and preparing for one class, but then there's no quiz on it. But the next class where you maybe didn't have time to annotate as much or have to miss for a UNIVERSITY SANCTIONED EVENT you best believe there will be a quiz. He drops two quizzes, but heaven forbid you're involved, there won't be an exception

The professor is so old-fashioned. No lecture material, he did not write anything on the board. It was like listening to a podcast but getting graded on it. The quizzes were on details from the long readings, so you cannot just skim them. Horrible experience. We live in 2023. Learn how to adapt to the times or do not teach.

Professor Goldish is one of a kind!!! His extensive knowledge on history and ability to teach it through a variety of perspectives is really interesting. He is super funny, so staying awake in class is never an issue. There is a movie and reading assignment every week that you get quizzed on, but they are very simple with no tricks :)

Professor Goldish does a wonderful job of making sure the students have to be involved in both the reading and the class by actively engaging in both conversation and the use of pop quizzes. Do not take this class if you are not willing to read outside of class and take decent notes within class. He is also fairly anti-technology, bring paper/pen.

There's a lot of reading, pop quizzes, no lecture slides, and no technology allowed in class w/o an exemption so if that's not your style this course isn't for you. I found the subject matter super interesting and unique and enjoyed Dr. Goldish, he is knowledgeable and passionate about his class. I would recommend to anyone who enjoys niche history

Professor Goldish laid out his expectations clearly in class and in the syllabus and wasn't lying! This is a high level history course, so don't expect to go in and learn spells and watch Hocus Pocus. If you are one that likes PowerPoints to guide your notes, you will not enjoy his lectures. Read his syllabus carefully as it lays out everything.

An average class. Dont expect anything like slides or key topics. If you do the readings, youll be fine, but make sure you take good notes in class. Lectures are not engaging. Not too difficult, just not too interesting either.

This is a HISTORY class, NOT broomsticks and spells. You WILL learn ways people classify religion, science, and technology as magic. The professor expects college level work and does ask you to prepare your own notes. He will not spell out the material for you. Class is based on assigned readings and discussions as well as easy quizzes.

Professor Goldish is awesome! Be prepared for class and show up and it will be rewarding! I am not a history major and took this as a fun history credit with no prior knowledge and was able to succeed in this course. Be sure to actually read the syllabus and understand how the course works before committing to it! Totally recommend for all majors.

Professor Goldish was interesting. He definitely seemed extremely knowledgeable in the subject, but either wanted to show off his intellect or thought he was teaching a higher level class. This course felt like it was incorrectly marked as a GE, but fits a high level history course. Lots of reading and lectures that didn't really apply to the text

Professor Goldish is probably the smartest person I have ever met, and his intellect is comparable to some of the great thinkers of the Scientific Revolution that we learned about in his class. The course was lecture and reading heavy, but his lectures were engaging and informative and I enjoyed every one. The class isn't for the faint of mind.
Prof Goldish was a really nice guy and had very few assignments that weren't that bad. The lectures were a bit boring sometimes when he would go on tangents.

Vehemently excluded Black jewish people from the course content and was argumentative about Black and brown Jewish peoples importance in the community. Centered the entire class around the contributions of white rabbinates, while entirely excluding Black and brown qaraites.

This class was a hybrid class (only meets 1x per week) so there is a decent amount of work / reading that you must do outside of class, but that's just what comes with a hybrid class. Prof. Goldish was incredibly knowledgeable regarding just about everything you could think of and as long as you read, you'll do just fine in the class.

I took his history of apocalypticism class and really enjoyed it. This class isn't for everyone. It was a 3 hr lecture with really heavy reading. I found professor goldish to be hilarious & extremely knowledgeable. This isn't an easy A but you learn a lot and it will change your perspective on a lot of different world issues. 10/10 would recommend.

Other than the fact that the class was a three hour lecture, I quite enjoyed my time in Professor Goldish's class. The man held my interest for more than half of each lecture, which was much more than I expected for a freshman history class that I was only taking to meet the requirement.

I am astounded every week at just how much this guy knows and loves to learn. He said last week he went several years reading Newton's manuscripts for 5 hours every day. He's written movies and books. Theres a lot of reading and the lectures get boring, but if you want to learn from an actual genius and a successful person, take a class with him.

Professor Goldish is one of those teachers who are way too smart to be spending their time teaching a GE. However, just listening to him talk is almost unbelievable considering his level of knowledge. He assigns an unreasonable amount of readings but if you pay attention in class you'll do fine on the quizzes-he summarizes the readings before quiz

Dr. Goldish is an inspiring instructor. He got me really excited about the history of science and the scientific revolution. I never thought that I would enjoy or learn so much from a history course. Make sure you do your papers in advance, and do some proper research and you can expect a good grade.
Loved him as a professor, very thorough and made mundane topics interesting. Lots of reading but it's a college history class so that should be expected.

God awful professor and class. He seems like a decent guy, but the entire class was structured in a way that promoted horrible scores.   Every day it was the same thing: read 50-100 pages of some dense book, listen to a nonsensical lecture where he mentions something that wasn't in the book, then take a 5 question pop quiz over lectures and books

I once came to college with the aspirations and excitement that i would be able to learn from amazing teachers who wanted nothing but for me to succeed. I want to happily inform you that this class has made me realize that my dreams are crushed and there are people out there who want to make you fail and hate your life.

It was the first time he taught this class on Witchcraft and Magic in Early Modern Europe, so I don't want to be critical. He seems like a nice guy, and if you're super into history then maybe he'd be interesting. However, if you're like me and just trying to get a GE credit done, his extensive tangents can get quite annoying.

I took this course thinking it would be different than it was. The whole course was based around the Salem Witch Trials, which I find completely uninteresting. Professor is a cool guy, but material was uninteresting.

I did not recieve the best grade in this class because I turned a paper in late but Professor Goldish might be my favorite teacher at OSU. He is original and interesting. I can't imagine someone knowing more about Jewish history that him.

His lectures were very good and he is an awesome prof, knows practically everything that is available to us right now as far as Jewish history in the renaissance. He grades very hard on the paper and the quizzes were simple as long as you studied the detailed lengthy readings. Not an easy class, hardest Ive taken, but good.
This class was really interesting, organized, and coordinated well.  There is a good amount of reading that you must do in order to get a good grade, but what do you expect, you're in college.
Great professor. A lot of reading, but that is a given. He was really interested in making his students better students and writers of history.
A ton of reading...but interesting lectures.  Quizzes fairly easy...1 big paper and a final. Very interesting man.
Great Prof!
Goldish is awesome - can make the most boring material interesting (or at least he'll try).  Demanding class - requires a lot on tests/papers but lenient when grading them.
HOW COULD I DO IT WITH OUT HIM. I LOVE THE EXTRACERICULAR ACTIVITIES
Funny, nice- has tendency to get lost on tangents, but makes the class fun. Lots of material to wade through, very approachable.
Best Professor I've ever had - very helpful and makes lecture very interesting.  Demands a lot but at the end his grading isn't too difficult.

I took Jewish Studies 201 with Dr. Goldish and it was wonderful.  His lectures are very entertaining, and as a teacher, he is very approachable.  He also does not interject his own opinion into the class.  Funny, engaging, and a fair grader.
No Comments

Great teacher! He never closed his door to me, even in the middle of lunch!  He encouraged me to apply to grad school and was very down to earth. Not a pompous academic. Don't miss his Salem Witches class!

Great teacher, makes use of a lot of comparisons with modern things which makes things easier to understand.  Funny, easy-going.  Always willing to offer extra help. Classes aren't cake, but definitely managable and interesting.

I've had several classes with Dr. Goldish.  He's funny and very helpful if you need it.  Really a nice person.  Be forewarned- TANGENT alert.  He does give study guides, and also grading criteria for papers, so all is not lost.
Great.  Expert.  Knowledgeable.  Caring.  Folksy comments; all good.  Don't try to correct him.  He knows a lot of good things.
Excellent.  Creative.  Gives good feedback.  Interesting lectures.  Writes books about subject matter in these courses.

Although the exams can be challenging, the lectures are engaging and worth attending. Using resources like Unstuckstudy helped make the material more approachable. Overall, an interesting class with a fair workload.

The most disorganized prof ive ever had. Starts the semester off with every assignment as a 0, you have to work your way up, but then you never know what your actual grade in the course is at any given time. He has no idea how to navigate the carmen site and rambles through all his lectures. I want to jump through the screen to yell at him.

Crazy disorganized. It's clear he loves what he teaches but his lectures are just him slowly rambling, I can hardly process any of it. The weekly quizzes ask the most specific questions that have little to do with the actual importance of the course content, they feel like very clear "gotcha questions". Not to mention the unrelated PCA

No extra credit, harsh grading,16-page study guide that didn't help on exams. Ridiculous from an associate professor in a 3000-level course. He unlocked quizzes/exams on weekends (Friday night/Saturday night at 5pm) due that Monday evening. A very intelligent prof who has a passion for history, just don't know if the passion is for teaching.

Professor is nice but babbles through HOURS of lecture, weekly quizzes, course long project, midterm and final, an just over all not the easy GE I was hopping for. I dropped the class after week 1 but I put more time into this class than any of my nursing classes. The slides had barely any words so no help on quizzes just not worth the time!!!!!

Professor Grimsley was definitely not my favorite professor, but he was not bad. The class was pretty disorganized and I didn't really feel like I learned the most after completing the course. I found the class relatively easy, I just wish he put a little more effort into his lectures and his posts on canvas.

Not worth the trouble if taking as a Gen Ed. Class can be mildly interesting at times but the exams are pretty difficult. The prof is fine but as a ECE major I needed a gimme class and this is definitely not it.

Professor Grimsley was incredibly disorganized from the start. Week to week discussion posts and assignments are fairly interesting and very easy. The exams however are pretty damn difficult. CLASS IS NOT AN EASY A. Professor while VERY knowledgeable, inconsiderately fumbles his way though semester.

Do NOT take his classes, any of them. I've never done more work for a class and I'm a 25 y/o 4.0 student. He is mentally unstable and students bear the weight of that. He shouldn't be teaching. The people that left nice reviews had to have been bribed. He's SO DISORGANIZED and grades hard w/o feedback. He's also just rude. Insert profanity here.
His lectures are slow and boring. If they are prerecorded you can easily watch them at 2x speed and think they are normal speed. Overall, he made the content interesting and the class easy.

One of the best professors I have taken since I got here, He is an expert with countless years of experience in his field and tries to bring out the best in all his students. Is sometimes a hard grader but you will learn a ton in his class. Absolutely recommend.

Professor Grimsley cares a lot about his students doing well, so over the semester he would make changes to the class format based on student feedback. You have several lectures every week, two short quizzes, and a discussion post. It's not hard, and he designed it so you can't put it off to the end of the week and procrastinate.

Professor Grimsley is an ideal professor. He truly cares about his students and their wellbeing. He is very passionate about the material, which makes the content even more interesting to the students. The course is content heavy, but as long as you watch or attend the lectures you can easily achieve an A+.

Really great professor who genuinely cares about his students. I found his class to be very reading heavy and had a hard time staying caught up because of this, but I was still able to do well enough in the class. The material can be a little dry, but he's a great professor.
One of my favorite classes i have taken

Prof. Grimsley cares about the subject he's teaching as well as his students. He cares less about the history you learn and more of the reason behind it. His essays are very open ended and allow you to choose a side and defend it. These and the exams are the only grades, but the exams are very easy if you study your lecture notes.

I found his class to be very interesting. Attendance to lecture isn't mandatory is not required but I highly recommend going. He tests mainly on the key words he gives at the beginning of class. Very test heavy, only 3 grades (2 midterms and a final). Only truly need to read for recitation and right before the midterm essay. Overall great teacher!

Your grade will be comprised of 3 Exams, which are half take-home essay and half easy in-class MC/short answer. You will need textbooks but can get away with minimal reading. History majors, HIS CLASS WILL GREATLY IMPROVE YOUR HISTORICAL READING/WRITING ABILITY. also worth noting, I went on to take 3551 with him after how much I enjoyed 2550.

This is a great gen ed.  Professor Grimsley is a good professor, I found his lecture very interesting and even looked forward to gong to his class. The only grades you will receive are the 3 exams (the final is not cumulative), which consist of a take-home essay and a short in-class mc/fill-in-the blank test. Class average was a B- on them.
Tough Grader. Really hard to pay attention in his class. He gets off topic a lot but really knows his information when he does talk about the lectures.
Excellent professor.

Not a history of war class! Just Grimsley's philosophy on the warrior code and his personal life struggles. Doesn't matter if you understand the overall concepts of the class; you better know the tiny details and people he mentioned one time. Took this class to boost my GPA and it ended up doing the complete opposite.

I loved this class! I went to almost every class even though attendance wasn't mandatory. He gives extra credit often - so definitely go to class! The in-class quizzes to go along with the written exams were based directly off of what he says in class. Exams aren't hard, but not super easy either. Definitely have to read 2 books, but they're quick!
His class is incredibly boring but if you don't write down every word he says you will do terrible on exams. He looks for specific words in responses and if you don't include them you will do awful.

I would agree with whoever said that you want to do well in this class just so you don't disappoint the guy. Each lecture is like a conversation with someone who is passionate and knows their stuff about history.

Took grimsley for 2001 course. Such a cool professor. Really chill guy and he made lectures interesting. Your grade consists of three exams all of which are take home essays which is awesome. You have to read a couple of the course books to do the exams well though so be prepared to read two books. His classes are very manageable. take him if u can

This class is NOT about the History of War. It is a philosophy class with much of the debate centered on something called the warrior code Dont be deceived by "History Of War" when signing up for this class Yes Professor Grimsely is a personable guy and can be entertaining But if you actually want to learn about actual war history find another prof
Really good guy and a fantastic professor. He keeps the lectures very interesting and is genuinely passionate about the subject.
Pretty easy teacher, there were three exams that were all very wikapediable.
He is very good at lecturing and gives interesting new insights. Class is relatively easy, if you're a good writer you will make an A.
Good lecturer overall, and a really nice guy to boot! Definitely knows his WWII history.

Great professor and great class. He really enjoys teaching, and he gets his points across very well. Basically, if you go to class, you're set to get a good grade. He does have some chauvinistic attitudes toward women in the class since it's Military History, but for the most part, he treats his students well and cares about their opinions.
Good professor.  Likes the students and the subject matter.
Excellent at lecturing and explaining.  Vast knowledge of military historical subjects.  Enjoys interacting with the students.
The only professor I have ever seen get a standing ovation at the conclusion of a course.

I have had him for two classes and he is a fantastic teacher... whoever typed he is a civil war specialist out of his league is retarded... for one hes a military historian and he was very knowlegable in ww11. I also agree that he was great but his ta;s suck... inconsistent grading and very hard to get a hold of
His quizzes are rather annoying but his history of WWII class was rather easy. I put in minimal work and received a B+
I am just about finished with his WW II course. Grimsley's a Civil War specialist who is hopelessly out of his depth in teaching WW II.

I really enjoyed the class. I do believe there is something wrong with the way the TA's grade in the course I took. I am unsure of why they are allowed to grade the way they do. Prof. Grimsley is very interesting and polished. Thumbs down for the TA's.

Grimsley is the kind of professor that makes you want to try that much harder just so that you don't let him down. The flair he brings to every lecture is inspiring. He certainly is not an easy professor; he expects alot out of his students. I highly recommend taking his course, (his WWII course is fascinating.) He is simply a great professor.
Grimsley's class is filled with an overemphasis on bizarre illustrations, bizarre overemotional outbursts, and generally inappropriate behavior.
Very enthusiastic in lecture, relatively dry and boring information made bearable through his interesting style of teaching. I actually enjoyed going to class!

While he was a decent lecturer, able to speak well the whole class period, his class was still too boring for its subject matter Plus his tests suck, each fill in the blank question is 4% of your grade so if you forget one word, there goes your chance of getting an A because the TAs also grade the essays arbitrarily, docking you 5 pts for nothing.
Very informative and educational. Enjoyed his lectures and teaching style. A++

Loved the class!  took a subject I've never really enjoyed and made it fun and interesting.  Very animated lecturer and dedicated to what he does.  Reading material is a little on the heavier side-but hey you're in college-keep up and it is likely you'll do well.  Definately one of my favorite professors at OSU over the past 3 years. Learned alot!

Powerpoints are often basic ideas of lectures, making you have to actually pay attention.  Reading was practically useless, I got a B+ without ever opening half of the books. He is very passionate about the information, but sometimes gets off topic for a long time.  Tests suck.  Multiple choice are random info. and one miss is half a letter grade!

fantastic teacher. he's energetic, fun to listen to, there were days that i was actually excited to go to his class because he is truly entertaining and you will learn a lot from him. i definitely recommend taking his class if you have the opportunity.
I thoroughly enjoyed his class.  He was very interested in teaching and lecture was enjoyable.  No homework. Exams are fair.

Great Teacher! understand concepts, not spew facts. Go to class, notes not on Carmen. Textbook not necessary(if you go to class), but get the correct editions of the other books. Exams: MC, Fill in, Essays; prompt given beforehand, the rest is easy. Study Guides great. Really enjoyed the class. if you don’t care, don’t take, you'll just get angry.

This class was pretty interesting considering the material that had to be covered. He seems to love this time period especially the civil war. When he talked about James Buchanan he reminded me of Lewis Black (the comedian). The book really is not necessary b/c it does not necessarily cover what he does in lecture. However, buy the assigned novels.

I was kind of skeptical after reading some of the comments here, but he's apparently improved since they were written. Lectures aren't terrible and the exams aren't too hard. Only thing that's bad about his class is there are 3 books including the textbook that need to be read, so you might be under stress if you've got some other hard classes.
Very energetic, has a serious passion for the subject and generally communicates clearly.  Also, don't be late, he doesn't appriciate it much.
I like his class, topic is boring but he is energetic. he has crazy policies, don't be late. but besides that its an ok history class.

i really enjoyed going to this class. he always kept my attention and made his points clear. the tests were a little tough, but fair. he did get off topic occasionally, but mostly want pretty interesting and he definitely knows his stuff. i'd recommend him to anyone who wants a class that is difficult to sleep through and wants to actually learn.

Seems to genuinely care about teaching the class, i.e. he does not just read off of overheads and ramble on for two hours.  Also. he uses media like power point and dvd clips to help enhance the class.
Amazing.  He is an absolutely amazing lecturer!

I took this class 3 years ago.  We are still in the same way we were back then.  Although now, however, I keep hearing the war is "over", and that we are only in the occupation.  Funniest thing, but ppl still keep getting killed over there.  Well, it's about time for this war to be over, so Professor Grimsley can say, "Well, guys, remember that ear

Knows his subject and is not afraid of giving his opinions, but is very clear about the division between fact and his personal views. Take one of his classes-- you may just find it to be one of the better ones at OSU.

Interesting class, warfare truly does differ between society's, tests are multiple choice and essay, mc can get really difficult since the text has a lot of info, and i mean a lot, essays or something relating to them are revealed before exams,can be easy, but difficult to bs TA's grade a bit unfairly (and won't give back your final after 5 emails)
hard to stomach.
Very good history teacher! Try to get into his class if you can.

This class isn't hard, but it wasn't particularly interesting either. I was personally offended by several things that happened in the class (such as bringing in a preacher to "talk about seperation of powers" that mostly bashed gays, abortion rights and women). But the worst part of the class was that he was just not a very good teacher.
This guy is great. He was a really fun teacher and extremely interested in his subject material. I would take another history class with him!

This class was okay except that he seemed totally disinterested in the students. Also, he brought in a envangelical preacher for one class the basically stood up there and showed aborted fetus amongst other things. I'm really suprised the ACLU wasn't knocking at his door. Pick someone else if you can.

"Caveman to Al-Quaeda".  History of War.  Not American Revolution and U.S. Civil War, but ancient China, Greece, Egypt, and early caveman conflicts.  Ancient warfare lectures always led to comparisons with current Iraq War, in that wars are still fought over needs, wants, money, religion.  Ancient weapons and fighting philosophies were studied.

Does his part as a teacher. Genuinely wants the students to learn and understand. Talkative, interactive, works to hold attention of students. Makes boring lectures interesting, fun, and amusing. Tests fairly easy. Gives extra credit. Truly doesn't want the students to get a bad grade. Approachable, friendly, knows a great deal about history.

If you're looking for a connection between religious fundamentalism in the 20th century and religion in the early part of the U.S's existence, you won't find it here, despite Grimsley's rather pathetic attempt to make the shoe fit.  This guy had a fundamentalist preacher come in armed with propaganda that he presented as FACT. What class is this??

Took his History of WWII class.... This is NOT the way to teach.  You do NOT simply rely on a documentary video for over half of the classes.  A very, very History Channel-ish class.  I've watched World At War... I don't need to spend the dough on a class just to get to see it on the big screen.  That's all this class was.  Not impressed.
Kind of a crazy dude. Like, for real.
Excellent lecturer.  His powerpoints were a good guide to what he was speaking about.  He is very willing to help students during the breaks and outside of class.

Great teacher.  He keeps it interesting in lecture and the tests aren't that hard at all.  He literally gives you the essay topics on the study guides he makes up before the exam.  The reading is substantial, but not unmanageable at all.  Overall, he might be the best professor I've had at OSU and I'd highly recommend taking a course from him.

I love the assertive style... and the aloofness... makes me believe what you are saying.  You can definately tell how much Prof. Grimsley LOVES and is absolutely passionate about history.  That is what true teaching is.

An excellent professor, if the student is willing to listen and put forth their share of the work.  He makes the class interesting and teaches history the way it was meant to be taught, if you talk to him one on one he is one of the most understanding professors you will ever have.

Grimsley does a very poor job of teaching in general. Also, his arrogance is very disturbing. He treats his students as if they are all stupid, yet expects them to history scholars when it comes to the exams (that he doesn't even bother to grade himself).

Prof. Grimsley is to excited about his subject - it interferes with the ability of students to actually learn.  He also has chosen to grade a 100-level class in an inappropriate manner.  He is not cognizent of the size of his class, and delegates too much responsibility to his TAs, re: grading.

The grading is absolutely ridiculous. I feel  the test is not reflected of the study guide or notes and that the essays are graded WAY TOO HARD! If you have the main point that should be it- I mean come on you only give us 30 min!!! Some TAs grade harder than others. It just is not fair in anyway.

Prof. Grimsley is passionate about his area, however, he seems to think everyone knows zilch about American history and politics.  Also, to do well on exams, you need to be an extremely talented essay writer as an essay score is half of the points per exam.  TA's grade essays way too hard-it's a GEC

TA's grade way too hard on the essays, they seem to be getting in the way of what was a good impression of the class and teacher to me.  Its a shame that much power is in the hands of TAs.  I like Grimsley though, but he does get off topic.

The class is not too difficult. But I do get a little agitated when he tries to lump students together as if we are all uneducated "mooches" of society. Also, don't diss him on this website. He gets off on it.

How can you say he doesn't care about the individual.  A girl asked a question in class one day, and he came back next class with tons of information for her.  How many other teachers would take the time?  His notes are easy to follow and I feel when he stays on topic well.

One of the best professors yet! Makes history very interesting and easy to learn. His passion for the subject is easily seen through his lectures; it is refreshing to still see some life left in professors these days. Honestly, this is my favorite class. (AND I HATE HISTORY!!!!)

I rather have a lecture from Grimsley than the monotone "Clear Eyes" guys that teach physics and math. At least this guy is passionate, educated, and enthusiastic. Personally, I am more interested in learning about History now than ever before...and i think he's conservative, not liberal..
i think he's helpful.  if you want someone who knows his stuff and doesnt teaches for a reason, then take this guy.
Enthusiastic professor that often goes off topic. class is easy if you read the book.

Good prof who really knows what he's talking about. The only problem is that TA's grade our exams, which are bluebook, and I feel they grade way to hard for a 100-level survey course. Also, the prof does have trouble staying on topic, but I think it's because he's enthusiastic about what he's teachi

Great Professor, has a lot to say and is very helpful. Probably one of the best professors I have ever had at Ohio State. But at times he can seem as though he is freakin nuts!

He actually makes a big lecture interesting.  You can tell that he truly cares and is so passionate about what he does.  I'd say one of the best teachers I've had so far and I am a junior.  I thought that he tried to encourage us to have our own views so I don't know where this other person is sayin

I think he has an amazing capability of getting students genuinely interested in the history of our country. He doesn't stress details, but instead emphasizes the relationship that the past has on our outlook today. He's so passionate about his work, also. This is one class I never want to miss.

Good Prof. sometimes gets wayyyyyy off the subject
I think he's a very good teacher.  He actually cares enough to come into an undergraduate level, non major class and give us a good lecture that doesn't just include memorizing bold faced words.

This is the most pompous jackass I have ever heard speak. Not only is he ultra-liberal, but he loves to hear himself speak too. If you don't memorize and regurgitate his views you will not do well on exams. He should be fired immediatly, as he is a disgrace to our university.

Very nice and easy going guy.  Had little trouble relating to students.  Aided lectures by inserting film clips to visually demonstrate ideas.  Midterm and final study sessions especially helpful.  Is enthuastic about his work.  Enjoyed going to class.

A nice guy and all but I didn't learn too much in this class, but how can anyone expect to cover the History of war in 10 weeks?  The exams aren't too bad, but make sure to write A LOT on the essays even though the instructions say not to.  If you write a short essay you will get a poor grade.
Very good teacher
great lecturer - he knows his stuff and he speaks very well. lots of reading assignments (3 books, online sources), but its not so bad. i leave his class wanting to be a history major.
Definitely knows his subject well- GREAT lecturer, very animated-- dense material. This is not an easy class- you need to be there for every session. His tests are pretty difficult.
This man is my hero.  If I wasn't so close to graduating, his class would have made me consider changing my major to history.

Going out on a limb before I get the final grade, but so far he is excellent, caring, and a jokester who uses his enthusiastic illustrations (and background loud music) to make his points.  He tries very hard to make a sad subject very interesting.

I took 682.01 & WW2 (team-taught w/Guilmartin) w/him. Great prof, animated & interesting, but demanding. I'm a history major w/a 3.8 maj. avg. If you work hard, he will respect you. If you no-show and don't study, you will not be "given" a good
does not email students back. does not reconsider any opinions that arent his. but still an excellent lecturer. Our class gave him a standing ovation after the last session and he deserved it.
Grimsley made me love History.  I used to get physically ill just thinking about this subject.  His lectures are very lively and interesting.  Definitely my favorite teacher at OSU so far!
I loved his class- great lecturer- I recommend his class

hey if you want a fun, charismatic teacher who never goads his inteligence over yours..take one of his classes. In a previous class, he opened the lecture in a huge hall, with dark lights Pink Floyd blasting. It was fabulous!
really intertaning in class
good teacher, enjoyed class a lot
Someone else said it best - this professor is very animated.  Very non-traditional approach to teaching a GEC.  Seems like a good guy.
Very good teacher and very compassionate.  The only knock is that he litters his lectures with implicit left-wing propaganda that many people get all too tired of hearing from liberal faculty.
Good speaker but not great lecturer
No Comments
Great lectures, good sense of humor.  Likes to pick on the females.
one of the top 3 profs i have ever had in all my years at OSU.  puts more effort into his lesson plans than any teacher i have had.  loves to illustrate historical points with films...very cool
Great Teacher!!!  Best That I've Had At OSU.  I Wish Every Teacher Was As Prepared And Dedicated To Education As Grimsley.
No Comments

grimsley is the best teacher ive had in over 3 years at osu. very animated, cares a lot about students, made fair tests that if you put any effort into, you got a good grade. lots of sweet audio/visual stuff too
No Comments
This guy is a great teacher. He says all kinds of nutty things to illustrate his points. My favorite was the Lothar of the hill people bit when we were studying Charlemagne.
Prof. Grimsley is an outstanding teacher who is very knowledgeable and animated.  I learned a lot from his History of War class.
Smart.  Knowledgeable.  Specific.  Expert.  Sometimes short and condescending.

I took Several classes from Dr. G when I was an undergrad and grad student.  He is an excellent professor who knows his stuff but you have to put forth the effort and think for yourself;  you will not be spoon fed.  If you are not in to learning about military history, putting forth serious effort and or are looking for a PC safe space do not take.

Best prof. I have ever had at Ohio State. Took history of WW2 and wish I could take it again. Grade essentially consists of 3 exams (15%, 30%, and 50% of grade respectively. He is a true expert. Exams are pick what you want, for instance pick 1 of 6 essays.  I caution because I love WW2 history and if you have no background this class will be tough

One of the smartest professors I've had here. Learned a lot about the political/military/cultural part of the Vietnam war, and his tests were pick 4 of 12 short answer, etc. so you could focus on what interested you. He was slightly disorganized, but if you attend class/guest lecturers you will be fine. Definitely recommend this class!!
Please stay away from this class ... Just stay away

This is easily the worst teacher I've ever had in my formal education.  His lectures and lecture notes are unorganized, his exams test on things that were never discussed in class, and the TAs were two of the most condescending people I've ever met. Stay as far away from this class as you can.

Deplorable class. Nice man & respect his 2 silvestars, but, it is time for him to hang up the coat & enjoy life - to be respectful. I did NOT get anything from this class - NOTHING. I learned more from The History Ch & Wiki than him. This was suppose to be a Vietnam War class - we barely touched the war. AVOID THIS CLASS & PROF!

AVOID CLASS AT ALL COST Impossible to study for half the stuff on the tests are not in his workbook and his lectures are pointless because he just reads his note without elaborating then expects you to write a page essay about it.  I would avoid this class unless you already know a great deal about not only the Vietnam war but the entire  history.

Dr. Guilmartin is indeed an authority on military knowhow, but unless you are a history major or only interested in the military standpoint of the Vietnam War, please do not take this class.  I love history, but this class holds absolutely no valueable information for you to gain if you aren't in the marines or a major.  DONT TAKE AS A GEC!

Dr. Guilmartin was a fantastic lecturer who is clearly an authority on military history.  He also was kind enough to allow me to do an independent study to make up the last few hours I needed for graduation.  With that said, he is a bit disorganized and his lecture notes are not always up to date or relevant for his lectures.

Word of warning: the class was completely unstructured. Prof couldn't stick to syllabus, and was all over the place. Literally no one took notes by the end of the quarter bc it was impossible. He goes into tons of details and tangents and the powerpoint is useless. Had to rely on book, wikipedia and memorizing facts to pass this class.
I really enjoyed the content of this class, but the tests were pretty wretched.  ABSOLUTELY go see the TA's!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  That got me through the class!!!!

If you aren't interested in military type things-don't take this class. He teaches it completely military based. There is no useful guidance for the exams which are difficult. He wrote the textbook which is in shorthand notes that dont make sense if you dont already know stuff abt this topic. Basically taught myself thru google. Disappointment.

Simply the finest professor I ever had in eight years of college at four different institutions (including study abroad and grad school).  He's military, you're going to get military thinking from this guy.  The insights are priceless.

Expert and knowledgeable.  Interesting explanations about importance of certain countries' aircraft in World War II.  Also interesting is his personality explanations about famous people, such as Churchill, Roosevelt, Stalin, and Adolph the Hitler.  He is also a great maritime/ships expert and historian.

Awful. He is so unprofessional. I can't believe he teaches at OSU. His lectures are awful and half the time he is injecting his political views (right-wing conservative). He blamed FDR for making the depression worse (after reading several "convincing" conservative books). He even found a way to bash Jimmy Carter in a WWII class! Stay away.

If you do not like military-type things, do not take this course. Sometimes I felt as though I were in classroom at West Point. The powerpoint presentations and the book, his collection of slides, for the course are worthless. Half of the class used wikipedia prior to exams.

Very sweet old man who just happens to be one of the worst professors I have ever had.  His powerpoints are confusing and his lectures are boring and self-indulgent.  I learned more from the 9 books on Vietnam I checked out of the public library than anything associated with this class.  Plus, he likes to quote himself.
I took the class to to as an elective for my major and was surprised . He is one of the best professors I have ever had. He is not P.C and brought in good guest speakers.

I love WWII history and really looked forward to this class.  Unfortunately, this class was nothing like I expected.  Dr. Guilmartin taught the class from the militaristic point of view.  If artillery, battle tactics, ect aren't your thing DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS!  Also, lectures are pointless--he digresses into random stories that don't help at all

Here's the deal: if you like military history, or just history, you can't go wrong with Dr. G. If you hate history or don't like having to go to class, then you'll have problems. He can be unorganized and his lecture notes are somewhat out of date. His tests aren't typical and there is a lot of material. That said, he's great. Give him a chance!

Fantastic Professor!  He is such a sweetie!  His lecture notes are given in a book, and they REALLY need to be updated, but if you pay attention, there are only a few times you extra times you need to write things in.  The tests are great when you have multiple choices on questions, only bad thing was it was the TA who was grading, not him.

Fantastic Professor!  He is such a sweetie!  His lecture notes are given in a book, and they REALLY need to be updated, but if you pay attention, there are only a few times you extra times you need to write things in.  The tests are great when you have multiple choices on questions, only bad thing was it was the TA who was grading, not him.
For and ex-military man he should be ashamed of himself for how unorganised his class is. His exams are unfair, study guides are worthless, and his class is not worth the money you pay.

Always willing to help students.  I took the online version and only had to log onto Carmen four times and I still aced the class.  People dropped out saying it was hard; I have no idea why.  SO easy if you know anything about writing essays.

No guidance or structure really. We were given written lectures and tested four times. The discussion forum was for soldiers and their wives to encourage the Iraq war. The lectures were unreasonably boring. Luckily, reading the lectures and texts didn't seem necessary to a good grade. If I cared about Vietnam, I probably would've liked the class.

I took the on line class, it was a piece of cake, never read the book just printed off his notes for the tests, which was enough to A the tests.  Felt like the TA's didn't even read what we wrote, just gave everyone an A, not sure that is really the case though.  Great class for a GPA booster.  I wouldn't take it in person though, would be boring

I took the online version of his Vietnam War history class.  I thought that the lecture notes were clear and very informative.  Expectations on the exams were clear and the grading was fair.  Always answered questions quickly and thoroughly on the discussion board.  Highly recommended.
real cool, kept everything interesting and was real easy to talk to
Very boring lectures, outdated course packet, and terrible slides.  The exams are unnecessarily complicated.  I learned more about the Vietnam War just from reading books on my own time.

Avoid like the plague! Boring lectures, obsecure test questions, and tries to tell horrible jokes.  Workbook hasn't been updated in what looks like 10+ years and his TA's (in my case) just seemed like they didn't want to be bothered with questions.   Unless you MUST take him, STAY AWAY!

He is probably the most boring man alive.  His lectures have nearly no structure.  If you take him in this second level history there is no reason to go to class.  All you have to do is read any one chapter in the section he is testing.  In my opinion he shouldn't be teaching at an intitution that has standards, but i guess thats not OSU.
Really bad jokes, tells them over and over again, and always screws up the punch lines.

Online format is a little messy, but Dr. G has great insight, is active in the discussion, and has intimate knowledge of the material. His required and optional readings are all great. It would be hard not to learn or do well in this class.
Great prof. Good lectures, fair exams, one of my favorites.

His online class was so unorganized that it was impossible to know when to turn assignments in, the best was when he posted the material the same day as the midterm so we had no chance to study for it!
Notes and exams were a little backwards initially, but once we got over that hump the guy was very helpful and the class got a lot more interesting.
Great for military historians!
Definitely knows his subject, but not a great lecturer. Hard to hear him in lecture hall setting, relies too heavily on outdated course packets that are hard to read.

He was my advisor and I took 6 classes with him. He is very animated, intelligent, and lets you learn what you value. He is very respectful of students and encourages class participation. The map questions rule! If you make the effort, it will be rewarded

fantastic teacher who is open to new ideas and listens to his students. would recommend him to anyone. i learned much more than just about vietnam during this class. i took away lessons about life and people.
Great Prof.  Would highly reccomnend  no b/s pc in his lectures either, he tells things how they are.

guy fought in vietnam and the lectures are really interesting, if you do take the class, the key is to pick maybe 10 different things from the packets and know those real well, dont try to know everything, just know a few things really well

He's a great lecturer!  He really knows what he's talking about and is passionate about it.  The only issue is his TAs.  One of them is VERY idealistic...so watch out!  Exams are straightforward, but tricky at times.  You really do learn a lot...
He needs to restructure course packets.  Not a great professor unless your into military politics.  There is a lack of social sympathy.
Boring! 30 minutes into every class, I considered harakiri. P.S. Woodrow Wilson was never governor of Virginia.
Wonder Professor! Extremely interesting and entertaining, brought guest speakers and gave his own first hand account.  He gives you every possible chance to do well in the class.
Best proffesor I have had at OSU, great
My all time favorite history teacher.  Take every class he offers.
Excellent Prof!  Next Sec of Defense!
One of best profs I have had. Very animated and knowledgable
i literally can't imagine having a better teacher for this course
Smart.  Knowledgeable.  Doesn't always know everything, however.  Doesn't like being corrected.  Expert, however.  Teaches good and clear writing and historic descriptions.

Super smart and loves the content she teaches. There are no Power Points so skipping class is very much not recommended. 3 book discussions say one thing and you get full credit. Doesn't use carmen at all so you won't know your grade until the end, but she doesn't really grade that hard. Overall good class and prof would recommend.

NOTE: History 2001H
Old school. Doesn't use Carmen at all, and the lectures are just her talking. This class was interesting, though, and a good light workload for an Honors GE. Besides a few in-class responses and discussions, most of your grade rests on the final, which was very straightforward. She also gives a thorough study guide for it.

Dr. Cashin was very patient and kind. There was a lot of reading to do, and she asks for a paragraph on each thing you've read. The essays you wrote weren't graded too harshly, and she gives you clear ideas of what to fix. The class is discussion based, so she doesn't teach that much but it works very well. Just come to class and do the reading!

She doesnt really teach, its discussions between you and your classmates. Shes more likely the moderator in the situation. That being said, shes one of the most understanding professors Ive had. Shell give you extended time for your work, she helps you out in any way so you understand the material. You wont use Canvas or know your grade.

Professor Cashin fails in every possible category when it comes to teaching. Rather than lecture, she relies entirely on readings and class discussions to "teach." Also, if she doesn't like you, you will not get better than a B. She seems to randomly pick who she likes and hates, and grades are subjective, so your grade rests solely on her mood.

Dr. Cashin is extremely knowledgable about American History in the 19th century and so her lectures are very interesting. If you come to class and read the three books she assigns, its is very easy to get an A. I am looking to take other classes from her in the future!

She is a more old school teacher. Very knowledgable on her subject, and she is really into writings. Lots of the grades you receive will be pass or fail, and the grades are never uploaded on carmen. If you skip class you will be screwed. Like majorly.
