First few weeks are MUCH harder than the rest. After that 3rd week, the workload (textbook readings) lightens significantly. Graded based on weekly quizzes and biweekly discussion boards; easy and accessible extra credit as well. Great and informative class to take, imo.

I took her class over the summer, and while I didn't do the best, she was very understanding when I asked. The course has a YouTube playlist each week of the lectures, along with an assigned section of the textbook (which is a pdf through Carmen). The lectures are long, anywhere from an hour to 4 hours. Space out your watch time to make it easier.

Professor Douglas was overall great, this was a 6 week condensed course, so lectures were extremely long, 4 hours, not taking into account additional videos or the reading material. During a normal academic term the work load would be manageable. Make sure you complete every assignment as missing 1 forum post can take you from an A to a low B.

Time-consuming class but Dr. Douglas is passionate about what she teaches and helps you learn a lot of interesting things. Follow her assignment guidelines and you will do fine. Readings are long but you can just read enough to get an idea and then skim for supporting info. If you have issues just email her and she's always happy to help you.

Professor Douglas is one of the best lecturers I have ever had. Lectures are long (1 1/2-3 hrs.), but they are interesting and she conveys the material very clearly. The only thing to watch out for, other than the lecture length, is that she will set due dates for papers on Saturday nights. Regardess,l if you have the chance, take this class.

Very very unclear grading criteria and probably the toughest grader Ive ever had in my 2 years in college thus far. If you see this class I HIGHLY recommend avoiding it if youre looking for an easy quarter class!!!

Dr. Douglas did a fine job teaching the content, however bulky it was. The main fault with her grading is that it is dogmatic. She establishes clear rules for what good writing is, and, upon a violation of her Bible of writing, she psychoanalyzes the cause of why you write differently. Maybe historians have the illusion of objectivity? Not sure.

This was the easiest class I've taken through 2 years. One quiz every week and 5 papers that were only 500 words. We also had the opportunity to fill out a 2 minute survey about ourselves and get 10 bonus points. Very easy class.

4 week summer course, 750-word+ discussion, three comments, and a quiz every week, quiz has two attempts but only shows you the ones you got right after the first attempt so do well the first time, easy A if you can keep up

Dr. Douglas is very passionate about what she does and I actually learned a lot from her class. Wrote like 6 papers and had weekly quizzes but they were not that hard, just be good at thinking broadly about topics. She was flexible with me when I had a deadline issue and you can tell that she enjoys what she teaches about. She's cool!

If you need a history credit, take history 1212. the easiest class i have ever taken. a quiz a week (with 2 tries and it shows you the ones you got wrong) and a discussion post as the "tests" which are also easy if you watch lectures and find some quotes from the book. so so so easy could not recommend it enough. you can also learn a thing or two

I took this over the summer. 2 discussions 4 quizzes. You need the book to find the answers for the quizzes but I didn't actually read assigned chapters. 65 points available for extra credit. Two chances to take the quizzes. If you want an easy A pick this class.

Prof Douglas is great. History is far from my favorite subject, and I only took 1212 to fulfill a history GE, but I am glad I took it with her. She is extremely understanding if something happens, and the criteria for grading in this class is clear. She works with students to help them learn and achieve. I would take more classes with her! Easy A.
Clear expectations, weekly assignments, lots of extra credit available. The workload was pretty typical for an online class so it was an easy way to take care of a GE.

Typical week consists of watching videos, reading excerpts from a text, then writing a discussion post. These aren't very difficult, but they can be time consuming. There's also a book dissection at the end of the course, so beware of that

This is the second class I've taken with Prof. Douglas and I would definitely take more. Interesting topic and I really liked the way that the course was laid out. Mostly discussion board based. Gave us the week off for Thanksgiving. Very understanding when I turned in a paper 30 min late due to a computer issue.

Super nice professor and a very straight-forward class. We had a discussion post every week, a break for thanksgiving, and book dissections to write on the 4th and 8th week of class. Very easy and goes by super quickly. I hate history but I loved this class and actually learned a lot. Very willing to help too.

Readings and Videos for course are excellent. TA's grade tough, but fair. The whole course is a great lesson on how to read information and articulate what you learned. If you work hard you'll do fine.
I'm not a history buff but everything was easy to understand
Way too much work for a second-session online class

This class was a lot of work in 6 weeks, but I feel like I learned a lot. There were papers on two (complete) books along with weekly reading and writing, so if you don't like a lot of reading and/or writing, Prof Douglas is not for you. Along with the readings, she includes video playlists to take the place of a lecture, which I liked.

Not enough room to explain. Far too much work for a 3k level class. 5 papers (5-7 pages) based on 400-700 page books that you have three weeks to read and write. On top of reading for these, readings are assigned weekly for discussion. Discussion 600 words and you better cite everything or she will report you. I beg you to take someone else.
Fair criteria and interesting topic
Be prepared to work because online classes are tough. That said, the prof was nice and helpful when I had question, the class was interesting, and I learned a lot. A solid class overall.

The class was a second session course, so she expected to get two weeks of material done in one week. While doing this you are expected to spend a majority of your week, reading and writing for her. Her TAs are also the harshest graders Ive ever had.
It's an online class so there's lots of work but I enjoyed it overall. It's different than an in-class course but I learned a lot and I would take a class with her again.
Way too much work for the course level. Tough graders (her and TAs.) Weekly discussion posts are extremely formal- never had a professor take discussion posts so seriously.

There is a ton of work in this class but Ive learned a lot and the prof is very helpful. Ive had family issues this semester and shes been more than willing to help me out and give extensions if I need them. Any mention of her being too hard is exaggerated and unfair, honestly. Id take her classes again any time.

very passionate about the subjects she teaches, learned a lot from her, little bit arrogant when it comes to knowing facts or when people question something she said, but she's nice enough. gave us 20 bonus points on a test for voting in the election, so that helps. not many hw assignments, so gotta do well on exams, all essay exams.

She's great. Loved her class. I hear people complain about workload but I really didn't find it bad at all. I also felt like I learned more from this class given the amount of work I did, compared to any other History class I've taken. If you have the choice, take Dr. Douglas.

Her class has 5 book dissections/reports, heavy reading, discussion boards with foot citations. Very tough grader. Not an easy A at all. Even if you think you're working hard, you have to work harder. Power points are nothing but her just speaking.

Took class online as an 8/10 week course. SO MUCH READING. Entire semester's worth of work in half the time. Professor is nice and communicates well. My advice: skim through weekly textbook readings (especially beginning and ending of chapters) and research topic independently and then write response--saves SO much time--TAs grade easy.

Dr. Douglas is one of the best. She clearly conveys expectations, the deadlines are clear, and her lectures are fantastic. She knows what she is talking about and I personally enjoyed her fun fact type stories she included. She will go out of her way to help you,but she is NOT a pushover. Don't mistake her kindness for an easy A, you must work.

Super helpful professor. Definitely need to attend lectures if you don't have the textbook, because her lectures are all notes and the powerpoints only have pictures on them. Willing to work with you and really, really kind if you pay attention and participate.

Great great professor. She teaches a bunch of different history classes at osu but I had her for 3500. She makes lecture interesting. Biggest tips would be to show up and do some course readings. Her teaching style is powerpoints that go with lecture, lots of neat history thrown in with lecture too on the side. Be willing to work and you're fine
She's great.  She understands how to relate what could easily be boring material to students.  I enjoyed her class.

Easy to work with.  Do the Carmen readings and show up to lecture (attendance is graded and her powerpoints don't have any words on them, just pics). Don't buy the book. She's really knowledgeable and nice, although a bit intimidating the first week or two.
The best professor I've had at OSU. Hands down!

Professor Nevius is a passionate and dedicated teacher who clearly cares about the topic he teaches. While he has a tendency to go on long - somewhat endearing -tangents, the lectures are usually interesting and on topic. If you focus in class and do the readings you will find Professor Nevius's class very rewarding.

Such an easy class. There's a weekly quiz that you can literally do while looking at the lecture slide to guarantee an A. There are also 3 book reviews, the third of which is the final exam grade. They're easy, I didn't even read the books and got A's. Mr. Nevius is very helpful in answering questions. I didn't read any of the books and got an A.
Good professor. Grade is based off three book reviews, two exams, and four quizzes. Unless you love reading and history, I wouldn't recommend this as a GE.

Taken over the summer so classes were longer than usual (3 hours, 2 daysweek). If you missed 2+ classes, participation dropped. There were three quizzes that went to the participation grade. Two book reviews. Written midterm and final. He cares more about understanding concepts than remembering dates which helps the grade. Really great guy!

Definitely a quality professor. He is well-versed and passionate about the topic. Class participation/discussion is huge. Wether this is a positive or negative thing has a lot to do with why you are taking the class and what you're looking to get out it. If you put in the time & effort to get an A, the things you learned will stick with you in life

Class was very boring, but easy. He doesn't explain things very clearly,but if you just read over his power points you will get all the information you need. His quizzes are online and midterms are essay format, but he provides 5 questions and you only pick one. Would definitely would recommend this class for an easy grade.

Professor Nevius is a nice guy who is clearly passionate about what he's teaching. However, I do not enjoy his teaching style at all. He's very abstract and makes things more difficult on purpose. For someone simply trying to fulfill a GEC, I would not recommend his course.

The class was challenging because Nevius would refuse to just spew out the facts and have you memorize them, you had to actually analyze what was being discussed.  He is very articulate and a pleasant person to be around, and I would recommend his courses.
Aaron really made this class interesting and is generally a super cool guy. He seems to care less about schooly nonsense and more about your actually understanding the material

Very good professor. I took one class with him and have already scheduled another one with him as the professor. Very helpful and very willing to help you understand. Relatively easy papers, with a lot of reading. Reading isn't difficult at all though. Very good professor and very helpful. I took a lot from this class.

I didn't feel like I learned much and lectures were uncomfortable to sit through due to the highly sexualized content matter and fact he uses British spelling, yet isn't from the UK. Essays weren't hard but were more political than historical.

Best prof ever. He listens to everyone's opinion unlike what the other review says. He does not make you feel uncomfortable in any way. It's easy to pass and his class is fascinating. I highly recommend.

Worst professor I've ever had. He is such a staunch partisan that anyone who disagrees with him feel uncomfortable to speak their minds, and essays must be written to assuage his point of view. I have never taken so less from a class than this one. We learned about gays in WWII, yet never discussed the war itself. He should not be allowed to teach.
She loved my papers I wrote about critiques of museums within the state.  She is thorough and caring.  She assisted the professor in handling a very large class.  She should go far in her career.
Always made res. fun !
No Comments
I hope I never have to have her as a TA again.

History of Ohio.  Mary is an excellent TA, and I understand she is in the Doctoral Program for American Women's History.  Mary will make an excellent professor, and I hope she runs for U.S. president someday.  She has very intelligent insights, and will go far in her career, in whatever she may choose.

Dr. Alexander is one of the best teacher/professor that I have had in my educational career.  I had her for the may term, for African American History to 1870. The class was rushed and I wish we were able to dive into the course work a little bit more but we were covering four hundred years of history in four weeks.

Dr. Alexander is a great teacher I had her for 2080 which was African American History to 1877. We actually only reached 1865 but she was a great professor she always made sure we understood the subjects. Her exams are exactly like her review sheets and there was no homework. We were graded on attendance,midterm, speech ,and the Final.

Probably one of the best teachers I've had at OSU. She is so helpful and will always pause to answer questions. She goes in depth to make sure everyone is understanding the concepts, and she was funny and relaxed through the whole semester. She gives study guides that literally match the exams, so you will do well if you do the study guides.

Prof. Alexander's political views dominates the course. She shows no tolerance for opposing views no matter how diplomatically they are stated. She users her position to force students into agreeing with her cult of grievance. I recommend avoiding her classes if you want to honestly learn about the African-African American experience.

Very helpful. she knows what she is talking about and enjoyed going to her class. this class is a lot of reading material.the test were short answer, extended response which were difficult for the time given and information to be provided.the TA i had was not very good, and each TA grades differently. would defiantly recommend if you enjoy history.

She's a decent teacher but class is very reading heavy. Neither of the books will sell back for more than $0.01 and the exams are BB/short answer. She takes attendance for lecture and assigns readings that are never reviewed in either recitation or lecture. I don't recommend taking this class unless you love reading boring scholarly works.

Good professor, easy class since the study guide she provides is the actual exam. TA's do all of the grading so try to get a nice one. Textbook used for the class is extremely boring, can't be sold back and is more than $50. I would recommend not getting the textbook if you take the class... not an easy A but if you work for it, it's possible

Great professor, truly interested in her students.  Makes going to class fun.  Taking notes on your computer is recommended since she goes through the slides pretty quickly.  But it isn't too hard.  Great class!!!

Class was very easy, tests are fill in the blank/ short answer and she gives a midterm review before hand. BUT attendance is required. Also, her lectures ten to drag on and she makes the same points over and over again and says a lot of really obvious things. By week 2, at least 60% of the class was bringing in laptops so they can do other stuff.

One of the most amazing professors at the university. Truly interested in her field which helps her to engage the class. Reviews are extremely helpful. Go to class, take notes and study. Easy Earned A

Absolutely an amazing professor. Many in the class agreed she was their favorite college profesor thus far. Enjoyed and looked forward to coming to every class. Got into come really interesting discussion. Also had her for 323.01 too, just wish there were another class left to take with Dr.A! Take her class, for sure!

She is absolutely amazing and I would recommend her to anyone. Lectures are clear and she supplies outlines to use for notes. The midterm was deceptively easy but as long as you know your terms you will be fine.

Great Professor, Easy to understand, Gives review before all exams and exam is modeled off of this review. The only downer to this class is the fact that you only get a midterm, RTAP paper, and Final which equal 100 points, so any there is no room for error!
Very nice, easy teacher. If you have to take History, take it with Leslie. Talk to her though!
Awesome teacher and really interesting. Very helpful when answering questions and really enjoys interacting with students. Course content was also great.
No Comments
I had her last quarter and the class was really great! She was very interested in helping us and pretty hilarious!
No Comments

1 class+9 books+9 papers+ 1 final 20 pg paper=lots of work....truthfully i dropped the first week after i saw how demanding it would be.  wanted to add this because the other rating said class was 3 on the easy scale...if ur a slow reader or non-history major stay clear!
Engaging and interesting in small classroom setting, good at encouraging students to participate. Recommend taking a class with her!

The class was reading heavy in the extreme 6 books and a few articles in one semester. Peggy though was easily accessible and willing to work with students if you needed help and were making a clear attempt to do you best at being successful in the class. The class was engaging & fun with short lectures followed by small group & class discussion.
Other reviews say it all. Peggy is absolutely wonderful; she mentored me through a rough patch in my undergrad and ran a very engaging classroom.
Awesome teacher. I can't say enough great things about her. Super nice, helpful.
One of the best teachers I've ever had. Her classes are engaging and fun, and as long as you do the work, you'll get an A. Go out of your way to take this teacher, she's one of the best!
Best professor ever
English is her second language so be patient with her.  Also she tends to go on tangents

If you need a history class... take it with him online! Not only was it not too terribly difficult, but he makes it pretty interesting. You do have to work for your grade a little bit, but overall a great course. Just be prepared for the quizzes and discussion posts and you will do fine.
I took this class online. There was a lot of reading and resulting discussion. Overall, I really enjoyed the class. I think the class was fair based on work load and grading procedures.

Cam does not post the notes online so attending class is necessary, going to class also gives participation points which are a decent percent of your grade. Other than that there was one midterm and one final, he gives the prompts ahead of time so it's pretty manageable to pass, other than that there are a few quizzes, and one-two papers

Kinda looks and sounds like a lanky Matthew McConaughey. Very sweet and well intentioned but very unprepared for class and I was never sure what I was expected retain in class. Relies too much on the expectation of discussion. Half way recommend because he is nice to be around.

Cam is a really great guy--he really loved teaching our class, and he always kept us engaged in what we were learning. He was fair with his grading--just had two short papers two write and he prepares you really well for the midterm/final. I would take another class with him anytime!
loved this class it was great
Great professor
Good class.

Very adimate and passionate professor. This was by far my favorite class I've taken in my college career in terms of content and professor. I recommended that he switch the class to more discussion-based instead of lecture-based and he did it! He's all about making the students learn and it's very evident. You've got to read but it's good stuff!

This man is passionate about his work and study, though unlike other instructors that are equally as passionate in their classrooms, Cook does not hold that over your head nor expect you to show the same interest outside of attentiveness. He is extremely helpful when you talk to him and has more priorities in you understanding then grading you hard
He's a great professor and this class was so easy and interesting. He's more concerned with students learning than on testing us terribly.

I'm not really sure why everyone has been saying how awful and hard he is. I thought it was one of the easiest classes at OSU I have taken. Easy A if you actually listen during lecture and take decent notes. If you read the text book, which isn't even that much, you will get an A. Exams are very easy. He's a nice guy who is passionate about history
If you read the book and come to each class, it's easy A. The exams are short answer and fill in the blank, and there is essay at end of semester.
This class is harder than it should be for a GE and he is not understanding when it comes to your grades. I definitely do not recommend taking this class if it's at all possible!!

Lecture information is extremely inconsistent with exam material. Ridiculous amount of reading from textbook and supplemental readings. Did not like class at all and it was very difficult for a GE course.

Paul is a very nice man and he DEFINITELY  knows what he's talking... however, would do better Speaking at African Seminars instead of teaching. He genuinely wants his students to do well, but doesn't do the necessary things to make this happen. If you're looking for an easy A in AFAMAST don't take this class.

He is very passionate about the subject but sometimes he goes on a tangent and gets off topic. He also teaches very old fashioned, no power points just chalkboard, what he says is what you write. Grade is based off 4 exams, a paper, and attendance is mandatory. He's a very nice man but not the best professor. I would avoid if you want an easy A.

This class is absolutely dreadful to sit through. He talks the entire time and it is very hard to take notes because you barely know what he is talking about. I swear he is the only person at this university who still does a fill in the blank exam for every single question. Avoid this class.

Worst professor i've had at OSU. He really dons't know what hes doing. Lectures are hard to sit through, he just talks the whole time about ancient african history and expects us to be able to follow along the whole time. He changes the format of the tests each time because he has no idea what hes doing. He thinks a 76% average is good for a GEC???

Easy  lectures to follow,  and very nice and doesn't grade too hard. Has a tendency to lean towards the left in his views, but I imagine that it would be difficult for any history teacher to remain completely unbiased when considering the politics of their teaching. Regardless, I would definitely recommend him. Easy class. Fun and caring professor.

Ive taken Steven Conn's classes twice & both times I loved it. One was 40 people, the other 5. Hes not a stickler for attendance in his larger classes.  some find his slight liberal bias annoying, I love it. He's funny &  energetic & cares about your opinions. While "tough" for GE kids, it should be a breeze for any history major worth their salt

Had no interest prior to this course but it was really interesting. Class is set up with lectures on tuesdays and discussions on readings on thursday--great way to do it! Exams were difficult and he graded difficult on the papers but it wasn't unreasonable. No book just PDFs to read every week. Really interesting class without too much work.

I loved him as a professor! Great guy if you put in the time and effort and go to office hours and class and actually study.  I am taking another class of his in the fall. Only professor thus far I have liked and connected with.

Dr. Conn is a great professor.   That being said, don't expect this class to be an easy A.If you attend all of the lectures & recitations, and read the book, you will understand the material. Do your best on the newspaper essays because they are graded VERY stringently. Be diligent if you want an A, it is possible to achieve.
Prof. Conn is a great guy but his TAs are horrible. They expect a lot for a simple History  based writing class. Sorry guys :(

The class is interesting but he is always trying to force his liberal views on you.  He will speak about a democratic issue like it is the best thing to ever happen but then talks down on every republican president or viewpoint.  Extremely biased history class, but what can you really expect.

Dr. Conn is knowledgeable, animated, and an interesting  lecturer. He gives room for participation and really listens to his students' questions. He definitely encourages the class to think, and the lectures are engaging. Exams are very fair and easy if you're engaged in class and if you read the book. I loved the class (FYI, HIST 152 = 2002)

Very wise man who knows his history like no other.  Very engaging and passionate in his topics.  Due to the low amount of assignments, it is critical to do well on the midterms and final.  But you learn stuff in there that you would never know without taking it.  If you aren't a history buff, you're looking at getting a B in this class most likely.

If you want to be moved by a Professor then you have found the man right here. He inspired a class full of young kids to think critically about our world and to not sit passively while decisions are being made by other people on our behalf.

He was an amazing teacher!! Very engaging!  You definitely need to attend class and read the RTAP to do well, but he is nice funny and helpful! I will be looking to take another class by him in the future!

He does nothing but spit his liberal view upon everyone. Also, he picks unless things to test you over. This is a general history class from Reconstruction to Present and he chose to go over little details more than overall concepts. I swear we spent more time going over a device that measures rainfall, than we did going over the whole Vietnam War.
Nice guy, but an incomprehensible subject being taught. The class was NOT at all what was advertised and it's boring.

Conn definetly knows his stuff. He's really smart and makes his lectures interesting. Can be a bit intimidating, but I learned a lot. Exams are all short answer/essay. Grade depends on your t.a. Lawerence sucks. He said " I didn't have grades at my college, so I could care less about yours. He'd spend half the class talking about movies.

Professor Conn is the sort of guy who'll make allusions to Claude Levi-Strauss in casual conversation. If that sort of thing intimidates you, watch out. Otherwise, definitely take a class of his - he's engaging, brilliant, and kind.

The historical intership class was easy. If you had any problems and emailed Prof. Conn he would get right back to you and was a great help.  Class was always fun when we had it, and you can tell he is really brilliant.
extremely easy teacher with very interesting ways of pressenting details
He seems like he would be strict in a regular course. As for this course, I think he did a good job considering it was the first time it was offered.
had him last year, hard, but I leanred a lot

He might be okay for an upper level teacher - but for history 152 it was hell. Conn is very pretentious. I thought he seemed interesting at first but he totally disappointed me. His tests are completely based on his lectures - not the reading. And his lectures sometimes contradict with the reading. I also had the worst TA - beware of Mark Mulchahey
One of the best lecturers I have had. Pretty tough grader, but reasonable workload for 500-level class.

Dr. Conn was a good History prof.  His lectures were entertaining provided you had both an intellect and a sense of humor.  He was a little rigid in his expectations, but we're not in high school anymore.

HATED this class, the only reason I got by was because I put forth the effort by going to my TA's office hours a few times and studied for the midterms and final in his office. 1st class I've EVER had to do that, I hate goin to office hours. So if you get a good TA, you won't fail.
WORST EVER!
The WORST prof i've EVER had... he WILL NOT help you, puts his stupid democratic views into everything he says and is just a total jerk..... DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS!!!!

Worst professor I have ever had.  Absolutely no help, makes students feel like they were stupid, tries to impress his political views on his class.  If you get him, use your TA, they will be your only help in the class and the only way you will learn anything.
one of the worst professors i've ever had. unclear, unprepared, not very helpful.
alittle strange, but really intelligent and totally doable!
No Comments
No Comments
Very interesting, great personality
I love Steven Conn!!!

Patrick was easily one of my favorite professors. He is extremely passionate and knowledgeable. He taught our class through books, using open discussions to promote idea-sharing. Discussion environments are very comfortable. Quite a bit of reading, but most definitely worth having no tests or papers - a challenging, but stress-free class.

Patrick is great! One of my favorite instructors Ive ever had at OSU. He truly cares that students learn, and he is very passionate about what he teaches. I never felt scared to voice my thoughts or opinions because he is open to all ideas, and he is very encouraging. I really wish I could take another class with him. Lots of reading, but worth it!

Amazing professor. Assigns great books and leads awesome discussions in class that truly help you to learn. Very well prepared each day, course was well laid out and connects to current reform movements well. This professor truly helps garnish a true learning environment where education and thinking for yourself are highly valuable.

Facilitated interesting discussions that challenged misconceptions and required students to think critically. The choice of readings was thoughtful, well-organized, and enjoyable. He used quizzes that included multiple choice and short answer, as well as participation to measure achievement. He was responsive to student needs and interests.
Patrick is a great instructor!  He is extremely passionate about the material and looks to get the class involved in group discussion.  Reading is key for this class, but it sure pays off!
Enjoyed the open class discussion. Never felt discouraged to participate. Would recommend this class to friends.
I would advise against taking this class unless you enjoy reading 100-200 pages a night and having an unnecessarily nit-picky quiz the next morning.

He is very knowledgeable about the subject matter and is very clear in conveying his understanding of the material to his students. The class is pretty easy yet interesting. Barely any tests except for one midterm and there are only two short papers and of course the final. Just show up, take a bit of notes, and pass. He's pretty good looking too.

He is a great professor. At the beginning of semester I thought I am going to sleep for this class but it never happened not to mention being a morning class. His lectures are extremely interesting, almost like watching an interesting movie
Brian definitely cared about how we were doing as students, he was all around a great guy, and he did he best to help you in any way possible. Great teacher, take a class with him if you can!

Ohhh my Brian Swain was the most attractive professor I've ever had.  As far as history was concerned though, he was a knowledgable guy.  He took some hard primary texts and made them a lot easier to understand, and was really understanding if we had trouble with them.  I'm pretty sure he was in charge of our grades as the TA for the class and I thought he was pretty generous; I got an A at least without really being that serious about doing the readings for the class.  Fun guy, learned a lot!

Brian was the kind of teacher that would make you want to get up extra early to dress up nice for. By the middle of the semester I would try to do my hair and dress just like him every day. His profound knowledge gave me divine inspiration for diving deep into Christian history texts.
He's a real person, and makes some pretty good jokes.
Brian looks like a man you would see on the cover of a dirty romance novel.  He was a fair grader although he was in no way easy. He came to almost all the lectures even though he didn't have to.
His bark was worse than his bite. He pushed hard but was a fairly easy grader (At least I think he gave me more than I deserved).

The greatest classics scholar to emerge from the United States in over two-hundred years, Swain is an erudite, caring, and muscular master of the ancient world.  His knowledge of Herodotus, though sometimes overwhelming, is breathtaking, and he also wrote every definitive text about the early Roman republic.  Amazingly approachable and august
He was very knowledgeable about the material and kept it as interesting as he could. There are quizzes over readings so do those and you're fine. He is also a fairly generous grader.
Dr. Poyraz is an excellent lecturer who knows the material well and presents it in a succinct, engaging manner.  I would take his class again, no doubt about that.
If you have to take history as a gen ed, you should definitely take him! He is extremely knowledgeable and passionate about what he does. Going to class is like going to a performance he's so good.

Great professor! You'll learn so much in his classes. Knowledgeable, well-prepared, helpful to those that ask for it. His lectures are super interesting and you can tell that he is passionate about history. Do the readings, attend class, and you'll have an easy time and enjoy the class.
Great teacher!

Very good history teacher! He knows exactly what he is talking about and is incredibly well prepared for his lectures. As long as you go to lecture, you don't need the book much except for memorizing the vocab words on the tests. I really enjoyed his class and learned a lot from it.
This is the easy class ever! Don't pay attention at all. You only need to memorize vocab words for the two tests.  There is one paper that is 5 pages also but it is just a summary
No Comments
No Comments

For an online class, he expected a lot. Annotated 3-6 court cases a week, a 1-page paper every week, a midterm, a final, a final paper, and 3 synchronous discussions. IMPOSSIBLE to work with vague feedback rubrics. Test was nothing like the study guide and included cases not available in public domain. Would not recommend.

Professor Kaye is the best. His class is great if you are actually interested in learning, not if you're there to do the bare minimum. Quizzes are tough, but he gives great lectures and is very accessible to get help.

Took this course online and was very disappointed. Each week you had to read the textbook and take quizzes. There was no lecture or explanation from the professor what so ever. He was also very slow at grading. He graded fairly harshly for not giving any explanation over what he was looking for in a paper.

He's a grad student that teaches from a textbook! He drops your grade an entire letter if you miss more than 2 classes. I'm an adult, things happen. If I miss a class then it's my job to get notes. I pay way to much money to go to this school for this guy to mess with my grades in such a way that has nothing to do with my knowledge of the subject

takes attendance way to seriously for such an easy class. Each class you miss he drops you down a letter grade. in my opinion his lectures are not insightful. i learned everything i needed to know from the books.
Few professors I have known have been as interested in my overall success as Prof Beyerchen.  I took this class over 20 years ago and he continues to be a prominent fixture in my mind
Great teacher.  Not easy though.  Need to stay up on the reading every week to be able to follow along.

I'm not a History major, but took this class as a GEC requirement.  I really enjoyed the lectures, and genuinely looked forward to class.  Professor Beyerchen is passionate about what he teaches, and really wants you to understand his class.  Would highly recommend!
Learned a lot.  Great teacher.  Not an easy class though.
Prof. Beyerchen was the best teacher I had at OSU.  He genuinely cared about his students and was always available to answer questions.I highly recommend his classes.

He is a great professor. Very passionate and interesting. I was rarely bored in this class. Always available to meet and answers emails thoroughly within an hour usually. Definitely not an easy grader though. Reading quizzes are really detailed and papers are graded very hard. Overall great teacher though.

Professor Beyerchen is arrogant and unclear in what he asks. He is available for questions, but his answers are often more ambiguous than the original question you had. I would not take a class with him again. He is very biased towards History majors.

Dr. Beyerchen is quite simply awesome. He clearly loves teaching and cares about his students. His class IS hard, esp. for a 300-level that includes a lot of non-majors. However, he is very willing to help if you take the time to ask. Excellent class.

Beyerchen is wonderful. Demands perfection but awards you for what you can do. Very fair grader. I wrote a paper in an hour and got an 85. Only one of the two papers count. He is very helpful and loves to teach. Made history very interesting, definitely worth taking his course!!

I have taken 4 separate courses under Dr. Beyerchen. Everything from freshman level Western Civ. to European and German history. Every course was thought provoking and educational. His lecture style forces the student to not just learn but to change they way they think about History. He grades fair and does not give busy work, but expect to read !

Smart man.  Arrogant.  Not a very friendly demeanor.  Loves graduate students a lot better than undergraduates.  Does have the fire of teaching German history.  The part about Clausewitz was interesting.  The TA was a little friendlier, but gave me a worse grade than I deserved -- and I am a history major.  Bad experience with these two.

One of the best professors I've ever had. Took the course 5 years ago and still remember his teachings. This class was tougher than many classes I took in Honors & Sorbonne; he makes you take an extremely critical look at everything. He forces you to ask questions about why you do or do not do things, which was essential to understanding WWII.

Beyerchen is a nice guy....but his class are NOT fun. Seriously, if you're not a history major, you are definitely overachieving if you take one of his classes. He knows a lot but tends to ramble, clarity goes out the window sometimes, and the lecture at the beginning of his courses is very repetitive.

Alan is such a nice guy and so knowledgable about the subject.  You can tell the Holocaust is a huge passion of his and he thoroughly enjoys teaching.  There is a lot of reading, but if you put in effort, he is definitely a fair grader, and very helpful!! Would take this teacher again!!

512.04 - Grew up detesting history, because my background in it is embarrassingly nonexistent and it bores the crap out of me.  That having been said, this was easily one of the best classes I took at OSU.  Spends a lot less time on textbook terminology and a lot more time putting you a century back in time.  Lecture actually enjoyable to attend.

I sometimes wonder why people are so obsessed with him.  I think his reputation is exaggerated a bit.  He's tremendously knowledgeable, but somewhat hard to talk to, especially if you already have different views than he does.  He was a good prof though, and I definitely learned as well as enjoyed the class, which are the two most important things.

Above and Beyond the most devoted professor I've ever come across. Makes you work for you grade, but that is how the real world works. If you take one class and do the work he asks of you, you will come back again and again, because professor's that put their students ahead of their research are the rarest thing you can find in a big ten research u

The man definitely knew what he was talking about. The class required some work but didn't kill you. He rambled on a bit but provided you with a vast knowledge of europe in the 1900s and was very insightful.
No Comments

He is definitely a thought provoking professor.  However, he was heavily German-biased in a general Europe history class, which was disappointing.  Be warned, he goes off on many tangents and often goes past class time.  Tests are extremely hard and he makes you work outside class material to study for them.

Prof. Beyerchen is an amazing professor.  His lectures are always thought-provoking and he forces us to really think about the subject matter.  He can go off on tangents, but he always finds a way to relate it to the material.  His book choices are excellent.
Awesome prof! Hilarious and captivating speaker all at the same time. You will love his class and learn more than you ever thought possible.
Excellent teacher, wish that I could have taken more classes with him- there's a reason that his classes fill up quickly- he's inspiring and dedicated, though vague about how he grades.
Beyerchen is one of the best, most insightful professors I have ever had.  He made us work hard, but it was worth the effort!!!  I will use things I learned from him for the rest of my life.
Pompous as hell.  Arrogant.  Short talking.  Short tempered.  Women can't get to the bathroom soon enough in the breaks, and he has already started the lecture when I get back.  Ignorant.

Uses readings as a base for truly intellectual & abstract discussions. Expectations re:papers often unclear, terrible about returning papers. Recommend his methodology courses esp.early in career. Be prepared your philosophy of hist. may radically change

Very effective teacher.  Always extraordinarily prepared for class, although he does get off on tangents.  Forced me to work harder for my grade than any other teacher.  Really knows and loves the subject material.

I recently found tapes of his lectures from 1985. I still draw on his classes and teaching ideas today in the work world. Prof. Beyerchen represents many of the reasons why I continue to study history today.
Informational, instructive, organized, interesting.  Loves efficiency of Germans.  Loves Clausewitz.  Enlightening (pun).  Very effective.
like, the toughest Professor I had in college -- we were, like required to not only know the subject matter but to commucicate it via testing in a coherent fashon -- Brillant
okay overall.  He clearly likes to hear himself talk.  But hot?  Come on!
WOW! This was the class I always read for.  He knows his students and can reach out to them through the material.  I wish that I could've taken more from him.
Interesting Class, well taught, but Beyerchen's a bit pompous
Truly a wonderful teacher...these are the professors that students get up and go to class for.  His Holocaust class was an enlightening experience, as are all of his courses.
No Comments
The best professor I've ever had.
No Comments
Dr. Beyerchen truly cares about his students and is interesting and brilliant
No Comments
very interesting professor
He is the absolute best and really inspires me

Put much effort to answer student questions. He posted assignments two days before they were due on multiple occasions. Assigned Kant's Groundwork for the Metaphysics of Morals to read in a week and a half. Doesn't go over significant portions of the reading. Spent 30 minutes of class talking about how to use the "n" word instead discussing reading

Took a class of his at Oberlin. Owen is a great guy, very thought provoking and his office hours were great. Yes at times he will make jokes and not talk about Philosophy, but his class was fun and I learned a lot. Sometimes lectures were a bit dry for the morning. Always willing to talk to you about a paper and gives great feedback when asked.

Owen was a great teacher and really cared about helping his students understand philosophy.  He was passionate and had interesting lectures!  He wanted his students to succeed and was willing to take time out of class to help. Very funny, cool guy!  Almost switched majors after taking this class!

Favorite instructor I've had at OSU. I took the pilot course for his Ethics of Computing class. He is passionate and knowledgeable about what he teaches. He fills the class period with thought provoking discussion that is much of the time fueled by student conversation/comments. 10/10 great instructor.
Awesome and truly cares

Promotes awful discussion by having a per-comment discussion grading system. He also never stops squinting. He also complained that his dog vomited on this floor at he once. Spilled coffee on himself once. Do not take unless you like dog vomit
wow
dude take this guy it's a blasty blast
It's very clear what you're graded on. She provided incredibly useful study guides. There's a lot of work to do outside of class, but if you do it it's a very easy A.

worst teacher i have ever had. would not even call her a professor. she should just quite now. Her power points are useless and you cannot even go off of what she is lecturing because you cannot hear her but so also does not know anything. best bet is to read the textbook to learn because she is reading the textbook to the class.
Andrew Skabelund is very knowledgeable and is a good teacher. He cares about his students and is responsive! I appreciated his willingness to help. I enjoyed his class and would take it again!

He gives great lectures with lots of information, and he likes to engage his students in discussions.  Since I took his class online, there were some limitations with that.  The work load was average,  not too heavy, just stay on it weekly.  Manageable  quizzes and reading,  3-4 short response papers,  and a few books to read for the class.

He is super helpful whenever you reach out for anything (extensions, more clarification, etc.) and his lectures are very interesting.  Sometimes they run a little long but the material isn't so bad to listen to.  There is kind of a lot of work, but all very straightforward and simple!

His online course is WAY too demanding. He prides himself on challenging weekly quizzes and several hour-long documentaries. Sorry buddy, but we can't afford investing too much time in your GEC history class. We've got other classes to focus on too.

He's smart but a little unsure of himself.  The class was extremely easy; as long as you do the reading and come to class, you'll be fine.  He was definitely interested in the material but you can tell he lacks a passion for teaching.  Still an extremely nice guy and not a tough grader, he's very forgiving and he wants you to do well.
Just ok. Online course so not much interaction.

she is great.  if you follow her directions for the papers, you get an A.  she gives a study guide for the midterm and the final which are really helpful. the exams are straightforward and directly from her lecture.  no memorizing tiny trivia facts necessary. she is the best history teacher of my life, seriously.
Made lecture clear and to the point but also interesting. Very helpful and made sure the class knew what was going on. Lets you know exactly what to study for.
Wonderful teacher!  Expresses herself well and tells you exactly what you need to know!  The woman is amazing!  Take her classes!
Excellent teacher. Very clear lectures, tries to make as easy as possible. Keeps lectures interesting. Wish I had her for 152!

She was a great teacher, and the class was incredibly easy. Go to her office hours before the midterm and she will help you so much! This was the easiest class I?ve had in college and I would take it again in a heartbeat.
I learned a lot from her she made sure we knew everything that was going to be on the test. I would take her again if I could.
great teacher...clear and to the point. the class was easy as long as you attended lecture. She was helpful when I had situations come up as far as turning in a paper.
I learned a lot from her!

Instructor did a great job with presenting materials. Learned a lot and will retain knowledge even after the final. Neumann was very helpful and very concerned with students learning and made sure her method of teaching was effective.

I had Sarah as a TA who led our recitations. She does an excellent job of analyzing the readings and clarifying some of the dense text we are assigned to read. Shes also willing to read over essay drafts and give great feedback. I dont know why she has such a bad rating on here except that she sometimes isnt very approachable.

Ms. Paxton honestly should question if she wants to be a professor. She does not take feedback well at all. She has multiple fill in the blanks in her test's , and these can often be answered in more than one way. Yet, she will only see her answer as the correct answer and that's it. She also graded the final which without leaving feedback.

The lectures were very confusing and rarely related to the textbook. The quizzes were all over the place and most of the answers could be correct. For a summer term 4-week online class there is way too much that you are expected to complete each week.

To begin with her online lectures are horrible! She mumbles and pauses constantly and does not speak clearly. The answers to her fill in the blank questions are not clear and could be one of many things. The answers to her quizzes often don't match with what is written in the textbook. She is a tough grader and contradicts herself often. Shes bad.

Hayley is one of my favorite teachers here at OSU. She seems timid at first but is super knowledgeable. While it is easy to get distracted during her lectures, she incorporated fascinating multimedia and debates and made the content interesting. The class wasn't assignment heavy but was always willing to give extensions / was super understanding.
Nice guy, very good lectures, fair grader.
cool dude.

Easiest HIST professor ever!! Don't goto classes. If you miss a quiz, just goto him and make up an excuse and he's retake it. Quiz is just 2 sentence piece of cake question. Exams ridiculously easy. I learned alot too about how messed up christian beginning was. He is veryyyyy easy. Negotiates extra credit. Paper is very easy!! EASY A!!!
Extremely intelligent guy. An very funny.
Never makes eye contact
Great professor! Highly intelligent and gave JUST the right amount of work. I wish I had him for all my classes!
Great guy, will help you if you need it, class is ridiculously easy. Definitely recommended.
No Comments

This guy is really smart, and integrates historical facts with larger concepts.  For 111, he focuses on the rise of Christianity, and 112 the dehumanization of killing.  He is a realistic teacher, and the quizzes and tests are a breeze.  Plus, he likes Batman!

Professor Andrien has so much passion and knowledge for his field. He encourages students to send him rough drafts, and he will sit down and talk about it with you. His lectures are very detailed and often cover what needs to be mentioned on papers and tests, so coming to class is necessary.

Dr Andrien is brilliant and so passionate about what he teaches that he will inspire you to care about it as well. He made what could have been tedious subject matter very interesting. If you are willing to put in the work, he will go above and beyond any teacher I have ever had to help you. He is a very sweet man and has my utmost respect.
Boring lectures and outside readings.  The tests and midterms did not reflect what we discussed in class.  Avoid his class.

Dr. Andrien is one of the most well-spoken and knowledgeable professors I've had in college. He is willing to help a student one on one if they have questions. However, the class is overall difficult. I was often lost during lectures because he jumped around the material a lot. If you're taking this, I sure hope you like history!!
Hes not very involved with the students so don't expect a close relationship. its also hard to tell what he wants or expects on tests

Professor Andrien is amazing and very nice! The lectures and the powerpoints very good and are extremely helpful. He knows tons of information! He is willing to help anyone who asks about papers, tests, whatever and is understanding. He will work with you. Take any class he teaches!! Make sure you attend class.

He is AMAZING! I was sick most of the quarter and at the end of the quarter he let me turn the paper in late, after rewriting it. And scheduled the final with me for another time. He is the most helpful professor you will EVER have. Take him if you can. And he loves history. The material is difficult, but he makes it interesting and easy to learn.

I was worried going into this class because of the ratings he got, but he is super nice and super helpful. He is really interested in the material and answers every question and if he can't looks it up for next class. The material for this class is very difficult though.
Good teacher, very knowledgeable. Graded very difficult and the lectures and discussion could be very boring at times.

Professor was OK. Not great when it came to questions, even though he says he is willing to help out. Easy to understand and explains things thouroughly. Be sure to GO TO LECTURE! The tests have a LOT to do with the notes from class

I took Latin American History with him and loved it! I had no prior knowledge or interest in the class but I came out loving it.There is lots of reading.It is not easy but I got an A-. There are 3 books in the class, a map quiz, a paper, a midterm and a final. He was a very nice guy! I would reccomend the class for a non-western history requirement
This professor was outstanding.  The class was not easy.  Thats what people complain about.  Its not his fault people are dumb.
Unhelpful and a total egotist; very cold man; in class makes announcements about his willingness to help, but don't be fooled, because he does not mean it; terribly boring, too.
Very arrogant, tests and papers did not reflect lectures
Wonderful class.  A bit long in places, but still fun.

Hunter is super passionate about History and it flows over into his students. His lectures did seem a little pointless to the class because all the tests and essays were based on novels or videos from class. A lot of reading, I read 3 novels at once, but an easy class if you do the work.

Hunter is a great professor at WWU.  He assigns 5 books for the quarter but they are pretty spaced out so you have enough time to read each. All the quizzes are based on the books, so as long as you keep up with the readings you'll do fine. Theres 2 essays, but he offers extra office hours and is willing to help you succeed. Extremely good looking.

He teaches at WWU now. He is one of my favorite teachers. Really funny down to earth guy. But he knows his stuff. Very sharp. Responds to emails within the day. I would recommend taking this class. No tests. Just two essays, and book quizzes. Pretty easy.
Amazing guy!... He is really helpful, and wants his students to excel in his class. His class is interactive; therefore, it is not boring at all.
No Comments

First of all.. it's a GEN ED. The amount of reading is ridiculous. Spent $250 on the books, easily. Reading is mandatory for the quizzes, finals, etc. I took this class because I thought it would be easy. If you're not a good writer (like myself), this class is not for you! And don't waste your time buying the textbook.

Prof. Rosenstein is by far the best professor I've had at OSU so far.  I loved his class, as will any history buff.  His lectures are very entertaining and enjoyable.  He is a tough grader, but I steadily got A's in the class.  It's certainly not impossible, I think most people just suck at writing.  Loved the class, highly recommended.

Just a good old fashion history buff.  Really a pretty funny guy if you listen and pay attention but it's true he's a real tough grader.  Don't expect to get an A on the exams because it just won't happen, for anybody.

I took this class because I love Roman history. I did't even need it as a GEC and I didn't take it as a pass/fail because I knew so much going in it that it should have been an easy A.  Expect essays on exams to be graded on questions that were not asked. I liked the way the material was presented but the merit of the grade is laughable.

Worst class I have ever taken at OSU. The grader is extremely hard and picky. Almost impossible to do well in this class. The instructions are to broad and you loss points for failing to include things not even asked in the questions. Save yourself and take a different history class!! I wish someone would have warned me!

This class was really fun.  His lectures are fascinating, and I thoroughly enjoyed going to class.  However, the grading of the exams was more than unfair - it was downright cruel.  It is impossible to get a good grade on the tests, and there was not curve for the class.

Dr. Rosenstein is probably the best lecturer I have ever encountered, and he knows his material inside and out.   Grading is tough and a bit capricious, but there's a curve and it becomes clear what they want after the first test or so. Any student who loves the past and/or enjoys stories ought to take Rosenstein!

Interesting lecture, nice guy, horrid tests.  Midterm and final gradings are contradictory and you will frequently lose massive points for objectively right answers that omit information not asked for.  I love Roman history, but avoid this class.

The stories he tells are interesting. Exams are essays, so memorize all relevant information and spit it off for the test and you should get As. I didn't do any work except for test cram sessions. Note: attendance is mandatory, as you need to take whole notebooks of notes for this class. I wish he posted his lecture notes so my hand wouldn't hurt.

Does a good job covering a massive amount of matierial in 10 weeks. His tests are all essay and graded very hard- be sure to include ALL relevant information. I liked him- he's pretty funny and seems like a nice guy.

Lots of reading, but lecture's weren't to bad.  He always felt bad he was keeping us from nice spring days.  All essay exams, that you needed to study for, but you were allowed cheapsheets and a study guide.  Also an extra credit paper, if you wanted to increase your grade.

Had him for Roman Republic. Basically just power reads through a stack of notes. But honestly enjoys answering any sort of questions that come up. Pretty boring sometimes, but thats history. Exams are all hypothetical situation essays and they are graded quite critically, so STUDY.
His exams are hard, the readings are a pain, but his lectures are great and you'll learn a lot.

meh...he wasn't that bad as long as you can drag yourself to class to listen to him read his lecture off a piece of paper word for word while you feverishly try to catch all the important things that he just skims by...
Lectures are fast and sometimes to difficult to follow. Occasional comparison of Michigan to barbarians makes class more bearable. All essay exams and are difficult to finish within 48 minute period.
He is boring!

I found this class to be very interesting.  Prof Rosenstein himself is a great teacher and kept things moving.  I thought the essays were entertaining to write, grading was unsure though because it was done by a TA

To “History 111 on 4/5/04”: big difference between 100 level vs. a 500 level course. In the aft mentioned, you are expected to do more than just regurgitate facts. 500 level grading is also affected by whim, mind reading, and snap character judgement.

Very good professor.  Make sure you take notes from what he says, they would help in the essays that you write in the midterms.  Essays are graded on thoroughness, so try to mention all the main points.
tough prof, very interesting classes though, he has a great sense of humor.

Took his Roman Republic course this winter. He is one of the toughest graders I have ever experienced. However, he is also incredibly nice, helpful, and knows his stuff. You will learn MUCH, worth it EVEN if you don't get your usual "A"...lol.

I actually didn't really enjoy this class. While Patrick certainly knew his stuff and would answer any question you had, he was extremely disorganized. I didn't even know how I was doing in the class 3 quarters into the semester.  I know being a grad student is hard, but it really affected the class, and he shouldn't keep using that as an excuse.
Patrick was the TA for this class. I enjoyed going to his recitations way more than going to the lectures. He really knows his stuff. He's also super hot.

Lectures were confusing, and often not clear. The material was not presented in an order that was easily understood. Basically useless class made worse by this guy. Plus he assigned readings that were extremely boring.

Professor Scharfe taught my 20th Century Middle East History class in Autumn 2013.  While this class proved to be more challenging than other classes, Professor Scharfe's enthusiasm for the content is contagious to his students and truly sparked a passion for the History of the Middle East and Current Events
Such a good teacher!

Patrick is a very cool guy.  He is helpful and knows his stuff.  This course contains a lot of work, but he makes it easier by handing out thorough study guides for quizzes and exams.  I took this class during Maymester and the course was very reasonable.  He responds to any questions quickly and has a genuine interest in teaching the subject!

He expects nothing from the students, and then gets really angry when test grades are poor. I learned more from the text book. He seems uninterested in the material, and the lectures are boring even though I was almost a History major. Had trouble answering questions outside the powerpoint info even though he was a doctorate? Easy A tho

He seemed nervous everyday. He never really answered questions, and he got upset when you didn't understand. If you tried to give your input he acts like it's not worth saying. I learned a lot, but not from him just the reading we had to do everyday.

The professor acts like he doesn't care about his subject matter, and appears to be boring himself. I almost majored in history, and listening to this man talk is incredibly boring. On the upside, this class is about as difficult as a freshman high school history class.

Easily the worst professor I've had at OSU. He was uninterested and uniformed about the subject matter he taught. Going to class is a waste of time. You won't learn anything at all if you attend. Wikipedia is much more reliable than the notes/the professor when studying for the exams. Avoid this professor if possible.

I love history, but this class was kind of really ruined for me. He glossed over so many things, and was very vague saying we only needed to know the big picture and not worry about dates, only to have his grad student grader (who is extremely harsh in grading)  take off an obscene amount of points for the very things he said were not important.
Worst professor I have ever had in college. Extremely strict grader, acts as if this is a graduate history class, which it is not at all. Class is a joke, not recommended

This guy is literally the worst professor I've ever had in college. I argued with him about my midterm grade that he was unable to explain WHY it was worse than I expected. He is unhelpful, unwilling to engage with students, can't look students in the eye, is a terrible speaker, is awful at leading discussions/answering questions. Don't do it!
Unclear, not entirely helpful, really strict grader. Assumes class is entirely made up of history majors, and most of us aren't.
Class was unclear. His grading was brutal. He didn't lead class discussions well. Good man, with good intentions. But as a teacher, he's one of the worst I've ever had on the college level.

Great professor. Teaches with a positive attitude, provides great/helpful feedback on written assignments, clear, engages students very well in class discussion. He's really willing to go the extra mile to make the class more enjoyable to the student, which is what it all comes down to in my opinion.
He was very interesting and easy grader
He graded fairly easy and study guide for exams basically said what was on the exam

This class was incredible!  My only regret is that we did not get to read James Graham Wilson's "The Triumph of Improvisation: Gorbachev's Adaptability, Reagan's Engagement, and the End of the Cold War."
What a doll! History's not my subject, but I would take every class Alex teaches if I could. He's interesting and sweet and such a hottie. I wish he'd ask me to stay after class... ;-)
This class was actually very interesting! It was pretty easy if you actually came to class. All you need to study is the notes, don't bother reading the text book so just come to every class!
Great lecturer. Sprinkles corny jokes throughout. Makes dry and drab subject matter interesting and enjoyable. Tough grader though.
He's so fun to have class with, and pretty easy on the eyes too!

This guy was a jerk. He rarely replies to your emails and questions and he is very short when he talks to you. He is arrogant and makes you feel like you don't matter or your questions. I have already warned all my friends not to take his class. His exams are really tough and its hard to take notes from his lectures.
I could listen to this man talk for hours.

He is VERY boring and knows how to make the class fall asleep. He is very tough on grading. His exams are circle all that apply and who, what, when, where, why and they are almost impossible. I took this class because I didn't want a monday-friday but looking back I would pick any other teacher.

This guy is rediculous!  He's very boring, and very synical.  His "pop quizzes" are useless because you can make them up if you miss them!  His exams are really tough, too.  Worst part, you have to buy his prepackaged books.  They cost $150
what a darling!  he teaches with a zest rarely seen in grad student professors.  he adds humor to even the dryest subject, and dare i say he would fulfill anyone's 'nutty professor' fantasies.
Related to the student well.  He wasn't hard but would sometimes grade papers and midterm tough.  Good teacher overall.

I do NOT reccomend this teacher.  not that you all have any choice about TA's.  however, this Alex never knows what he's talking about, his famous line is "im not positive or dont quote me on this" also, he is very unorganized.  He brought our 100 point papers back to us in a plastic bag.  He really is a bad teacher.
SOOOO TIGHT...History blows mad ass but this dude will keep you paying attention, and you will also learn. He puts stuff into evryday events, and relates the material amazingly.
Alex was anamazing TA. He always made himself available to help students and thoroughly prepared us for the exams. I'd highly reccomend having him as a History TA.
Indie-rock kick ass.
By far the best class I have taken at OSU.  Alex is bright, helpful, informative, and pretty cute, too!

I took online 152 with her.  DO NOT TAKE HER SECTION.  She treats this like a 300-level course full of history majors.  You'll have two midterms and a final paper, and weekly quizzes, and discussion, and copious amounts of reading.  This is not a class for someone who doesn't LOVE history, and deadlines.

I took her online African history class thinking it would be a breeze and it turned out to be more work than I anticipated. Weekly discussion posts and quizzes on readings and a midterm and final paper were the bulk of the work. They're probably easy if you do the readings - I wouldn't know about that. Overall, it was bearable, but pretty boring.
He's a really nice, passionate guy. You can tell he really enjoys the subject, he's so earnest about it that it's really cute. Makes you interested with all his enthusiasm.

Prof. Hobbins made the class very interesting. It was about the Black Death, and the class was essentially entirely discussion-based with a book assigned each week. The final 20-page historiographical paper was the most difficult assignment of my college experience, but there is probably no way to avoid it if you have to take a 598H class.

I'm a science major, I hadn't taken history in about 7 years.  Dr. Hobbins' made the class interesting and fun to go to.  The class was a lot of work for me, but nothing unreasonable.  Read and go to class and there's no reason you can't get an A or B.

Dr. Hobbins is an awesome professor. I really enjoy his class. He is super helpful, and very easy to talk to. He has a great sense of humor, and I can tell he really enjoys what he does. I highly recommend his class, especially to people who have an interest in history.

Dr. Hobbins is truly an excellent teacher. You can tell that he knows his material, and he makes each lecture interesting. He infuses humor with historical facts, and mixes notes and video clips to keep the class involved. Class discussions are great because everyone can state their opinion.He is an excellent teacher. Highly recommended. Excellent

Dr. Hobbins took a class that could have been about boring readings and rote memorization and made into a interesting an interactive class (the Illuminated manuscript project was just genius). That said he is a pretty hard grader, not very understanding on spelling/ grammatical errors, but if you do your readings/ go to class you'll be fine
great professor. He really knows the material and does a great job on lectures. The tests are a little difficult but overall recommended.

Class must have changed over the years. There is tons of reading and the midterm was absolutely ridiculous. As a professor, he's not a poor teacher. But the way the class is ran makes it difficult to get good scores. Little chance to increase grade. Killer study sheets. Don't recommend.

Definitely knows what he's talking about, but if you're not into history you'll be bored to tears. He does his best to make it interesting though, given the material. Be prepared to read a lot from the primary source readings. He's not too hard of a grader on the papers/exams though.

Best professor I've had so far, period. Dr. Hobbins is extremely intelligent-I don't think he ever said anything without qualifying it or backing it up. Lectures are interesting, and cover almost all of what will be on the test. Lots of reading, but this led to great discussions.
Good lectures. Do quite a bit of reading that is discussed for half of your classes. Very, very, very interested in what he's doing and loves to be teaching. Overall a good class.

The rating for clarity is probably a little misleading. It was his first time teaching this class so it was a little unorganized. Dr. Hobbins knows his Medieval history and he will introduce good info to you. This was a writing course so we didn't have tests. Did write about 5 papers though. Good guy, highly recommended. Be prepared to work.

Honestly, I love this professor. I feel like his lectures are "story time," and really enjoy coming to class for a change of pace. Exams are essay based, 1 midterm, 1 final (non-comprehensive). Your grade depends entirely on the TA.
Dr. Davis was pretty engaging in class, but sometimes his lectures seemed all over the place. Exams were all essays. Your grade depends entirely on your TA-- Dr. Davis lectures and that is it.

Great professor. He is fair and if he sees you are interested, then your grade is guaranteed. Papers are important in his class, and you have to right a term paper in this one which is 40% of your grade and attendance with  the discussion grade is like 20%; the Exams are easy and multiple choice which is hard to find in a 500 level history class.
A lot of fun

He is one of the best lecturers I have had yet. His lectures are interesting and informative. He is able to relate the material to make it easy to understand. His exams were essay. One part on ID's and another on one of the major themes. I cant really comment on the grading, because that is all subjective to which TA you have. Overall great class.
very funny guy, very helpful. 60% of our grade was a paper, but it wasn't bad.
Awesome teacher! Fun classes loaded with information. Tests are straight forward and he is eager to help anyone.
Fun teacher! Makes the lectures interesting, although its kinda tough to take notes he really knows what he's talking about!
No Comments
Shows clear interest in what he is teaching(especially the Renaissance), which he accomplishes very well.
Very Interesting, alot of information.  Funny, witty, and all together a great teacher.
No Comments
Great Teacher!  Hilliarious and easy going!  Highly Recommended.
She's so wonderful.
Pretty good at teaching, takes attendance every day. If you don't talk in class or go to his office hours your participation grade will suffer. No tests, just papers, but he's a tough grader.

He does a fantastic job at organizing the lecture/recitations. He wants everyone to think critically and be able to interpret historical narratives. He is politically savvy, but his progressive views are definitely not getting in the way of teaching. I wrote a pro-dictatorship paper and still got an A 'cause it was argued well. No exams, 2 papers!

Everything said in the previous comment is correct. To add, we had to write four essays (1, 3, 4, and 5 pages), and discussion/participation in the recitations was one-fifth of the total grade. You have to write.

Structured the class very well. Very captivatiing, so much so, that I had friday lecture and I didn't skip it because I enjoyed it so much. His theme of subjectivity in history is fascinating and true. But his teachings on Paul of Tarsus don't line up with what he actually said.

By far my favorite class of the year. He truly enjoys teaching and loves the subject. Though I had class early in the morning, he kept it lively so I was always awake. One of those classes that you can actually look forward going to! Highly recommend taking a class with Matt!

It's hard to cover 500 years of History in one class, Matt does a great of job of helping students think for themselves and is INCREDIBLY open minded... he is politically savvy and if you write a paper that is entirely against his views, you still may receive an A on it if he hears your voice... I wish there were more active students in the class

This was the professor that replaced Dr. Keith for History 141. Mr. Yates was an awesome teacher; he really knew his material and did anything to help us learn more. The lectures are definitely helpful if you want an A and office hours as well.

He knows his stuff, but the class is torture. Text is a collection of primary source documents, that while useful, should be used as secondary material to really drive the point home.  Writes nothing on the board, so you had best be a great listener and quick writer.  Nice guy.  Tough but fair grader.

Matt is very passionate about what he teaches and he's incredibly knowledgeable. A lot of studying is required but he makes it interesting. I would take history with him in a heartbeat. Plus he's a total sweetheart - he even let me take my final after I screwed up the start/end times :)

I have really enjoyed his teaching style.  He's very knowledgeable and extremely helpful if you don't particularly understand the material.  He's made one of my least enjoyable subjects very interesting.  Great professor for any school to have!!!  Take his class!

I thought he was an awesome teacher. He took over for our class since Dr. Keith had health issues. Mr. Yates was really, really knowledgable with the material and I thoroughly enjoyed his lectures. Good guy and teacher. His office hours help a lot too.
This guy should not be a professor. There are quizzes every class and his lectures do not make any sense. Doesn't give students a good idea of his teaching style and what to expect for tests.

This guy quizzes you every day about primary documents and twice on wednesday, one quiz being a geography quiz.  He then lectures about the civilizations that wrote the primary docs.  It was like taking 2 classes at once.  He is SO insanely difficult that he makes a GEC 100 lvl History course seem like graduate school.

Mark is a good guy and makes the class enjoyable overall. His lectures involve powerpoints but a lot of the information you need he gives you verbally for the exams. This class involves a ton of reading and if you don't keep up on it you will find yourself falling behind fast. Other than that a decent class and not terribly hard.
I thought he was a good instructor. Very knowledgeable, seems to like what he's doing. You need to attend lecture, tests are from lectures rather than texts.

Hated this guy. lectures are so dry and boring. The TA for this class literally LOST my bibliography for my paper and I got docked points for it and Cressy wouldnt listen to me that she lost it. Stay far away from him, Im a senior now and hes the worst teacher ive ever had at OSU.

I loved Dr. Cressy. For the most part, classes were interesting and assignments manageable. One midterm, 3 papers and a Final is all. If you aren't somewhat interested in history you'll probably be bored but Cressy is a great guy. Grading depends on the TA though.

I found him very interesting so it was easy to pay attention. Attendance isn't taken in lecture, but that's the only way to get the notes. Go to discussion with the TA, attendance counts part of your grade. Your grade is made up of one midterm, one 4-5 page paper, discussion section grade, and a final. Definitely recommend Dr. Cressy.

He was a good teacher and the classes were interesting and pretty easy.  Just go to class and do the readings and you should do well.  He answered all questions I had and gives extra credit. He's a nice guy.
