He's a nice enough guy but boring. doesnt seem to be very good at teaching. Had several TA's tell me hes still learning how to teach. Besides his area of expertise, medieval period, doesnt bother 2 brush up on the material well. Not a hard class b/c based on TA grading and the tests are essay format. go 2 REC. Grade in class largely depends on TA.
If you're not a HISTORY MAJOR/MINOR...be prepared to be BORED out of your mind.  Good instructor for the most part tho.

Good Professor. I took his British History class and enjoyed it. He keeps his lectures interesting, and only goes through relevant information. There are only a couple of papers and two midterms, which is nice, but he is a tough grader, so it's important to do well on them.

I liked him a lot.  Only one paper (you get to pick your topic) and 2 test.  Midterm was an easy A and the readings aren't hard at all.  He made the material very interesting and did not test you over anything he didn't cover!  I highly recommened him!!

Cressy's class was just simple. There was one paper and two tests that made the grade and the tests consisted of an essay, a couple ID's and a map. The class requires two books but you only really need the sources book as long as you goto lecture.
I took Cressy for a British history class. The class was great, and so was he. The content and lectures were always interesting, and the assignments were few (2 tests and 2 papers).

This class is so boring.  I thought it would be interesting because some historian was suppose to take all the boring stuff out of the book because there are so many stories in history.  But I can't blame him, there must have been loose knockout gas in the lecture hall because I was the only one gone.  Most expensive nap I ever took.
easy class, study and you'll get an A

Best professor I've ever had. He has so much passion about history and is so encouraging. He's not an easy grader; you have to work very hard. But he will give you every guideline and tool that you need to succeed and will proofread your papers. Brilliant man. Funny an charming. Cant say enough good things about him

Best professor I've ever had. He has so much passion about history and is so encouraging. He is not an easy grader; you have to work very hard. But he will give you every guideline and tool that you need to succeed and will proofread your papers. Brilliant man. Funny an charming. Cant say enough good things about him
Absolutely brilliant, always willing to help,a pleasure and honor to attend his classes.

Hands-down the best professor that I have ever had. It felt like a privilege to go to class every day. He lectures so passionately and intelligently, it's impossible to not catch his enthusiasm. He's universally claimed yet helpful and personally interested in every student. So sad the semester is over.

Great guy!  I would recommend this class. He took attendance half the time, on random days.  There is a lot of reading, but rarely checked to see if we actually did it.  We had four papers to write, all on themes we talked about in class.  As long as you support your opinion, you will be okay!  Really interesting class, that's pretty easy.

Dr. Boyle was my favorite professor at Ohio State. His lectures were interesting and fun. I learned so much American history from him. He even would sit with kids before class outside in the hallway and chat about life. Before you graduate, you must take one of his classes!

One of the best, if not the BEST, classes I've ever taken. I'm not a history major, but Prof. Boyle made things entertaining. I looked forward to class. Class involved four papers, so don't take it if you're just looking for a blow off class. Take it if you want a class that is interesting and easy to pay attention to. I'm going to miss the class.
He kept things entertaining. His lectures were interesting and quick paced. I learned a lot about American History. He teaches from a different perspective which captivates your mind and heart.

Dr. Boyle is a great teacher! He is so interested in what he is talking about, he will make you love it too. It is a LOT of reading, and you will be frantically catching up before a paper is due, but it's interesting reading. Papers make you think, but are not graded too tough. A really great, funny guy. Definitely take him for any history class!!

Out of all the classes I've taken so far, this was hands down my favorite. Professor Boyle was an engaging lecturer and often makes witty comments. Though the class may seem easy at first, his essay assignments really make you think and require a substantial amount of preparation.
My favorite Prof. at OSU. You won't regret any class you take from him.
He is an amazing teacher.  He keeps your attention and makes you want to go to class.  He does, however have 5 required texts... so if you take this class, be prepared to work!  Loved this class!

Phenomenal professor.  He'll make you want to come to lecture, even though you're not required.  Class grade is based on four papers who are graded by the TAs, so if you're adamant about getting an A, hope you get a good TA or you are a flawless writer.

By far the best professor I have ever had at OSU! His lectures are extremely interesting and you can tell he truly cares about what he is teaching. There are two four page papers, a midterm, and a final. The midterm and final are both take home essays. Highly recommend this class!!

Dr. Boyle is an amazing professor!! He makes History interesting and fun. I would recommend him to anyone. He is very clear during his lectures. One can never fall asleep during lectures either, he keeps you interested. If you don't like papers though I would avoid Dr. Boyle. Every assignment mid-term and final is a 4-8 page paper.

Absolutely one of the best professors at OSU. He is an amazing lecturer. His lectures flow and tell stories rather than just list dry facts. There is a high amount of reading and writing for a 300 level course, but it's worth it. Go to office hours and ask him questions, he is always willing to help. HIGHLY recommend both the class and professor.
I am obsessed with this man! he is by far the best teacher i have ever had! i would take every class that he ever teaches!! I LOOOVE him!
One of the top 5 professors at OSU.  Take this man's class whenever you have a chance!!
Best Professor I've had. Makes class interesting and fun to go to. Very fair and understanding.

Extremely helpful professor, especially when it comes to improving your writing.  He encourages students to think for themselves and presented class in an interesting way.  I looked forward to going to class every day.
Great story teller, extremely helpful and easy to talk to
Really a great teacher.  He is extremely smart and is always available for help.  All exams are essay style, just try and get an easy ta and you're set.

AMAZING teacher. he set up every lecture like a story. didn't use powerpoint or slides during lecture, so you had to listen to take notes. midterm, final, and 2 papers for grades.. and they were all take-home! overall great prof.

Kevin's a great teacher! Really makes class worth going to. I highly recommend him if you need a history class. Sure there's a lot of reading and writing, but tell me a history class where that isn't the case.
Best professor at OSU

Kevin Boyle is no doubt the best professor I have had at OSU. He offers visuals that compliment his lectures while making lecture fun. My two hour lecture flew by as I was transfixed by his differing perspectives. It's a shame I won't have the chance to take one of his classes again.
Excellent professor. Very knowledgable and willing to help. A stickler for attendance though. Missing one class loses you half a letter, 2 classes a whole letter, and three classes you fail.

LOVE LOVE LOVE PROFESSOR BOYLE! I could have been any more forunate to have the opportunity to have him as my staff advisor. He is by far my favorite teacher while at Ohio State. I am truly going to miss him when I graduate in March. He does have the best
kevin has the best stories

Great teacher, great guy. Tells the best stories in lecture. Sometimes hard to take notes on material because his stories make it hard to pull out important information. Class was 3 papers, lots of reading. Great class though.
He's amazing....I enjoy going to class b/c he tells the stories like we are there! He's teh best professor I've had so far.
Fabulous! Spectacular! i love him. best speaker i've ever had. makes history interesting. my notes rock. he is sexy and i want to marry him.
not a ton of work except for reading. all exams take home but lecture notes r almost impossible to take
GREAT PROF! probably one of the best I've had, if not the best. He is funny and interesting and always willing to answer questions. I strongly recommend him, going to lecture isn't a chore!
easily understood
he is a very good professor, he makes history interesting for everyone and tells about things that aren't common knowledge to give different perspectives on events in history.

This was one of the best classes I've ever had, in my entire life. The lecture was actually interesting, and the books that we were required to read, weren't text books. If you have to take History 152, I strongly recommend him.

This was a great class.  He is very good at making the lectures enjoyable and interesting, and all the information really flowed together and came together before each midterm was due.  If your going to take History 152, you should take it with Boyle.
No Comments

He is very passionate about history which makes his lectures very interesting and fun, also for my class at least we had papers instead of mid-terms and finals so that was also nice. There is a fair amount of reading but thats true for most history.
Very good professor. Always willing to meet with students and very helpful. He knows his stuff and explains it well. A little nontraditional, but that keeps it interesting.

Tough class. Lots of reading. I thought it was challenging for a GEC. He expects a LOT out of you, but he is a really caring guy and genuinely cares about his students. Just.. be prepared to read and spend a lot of time on papers and preparing for exams. Good professor but not a good class.

Colin is the best professor I've had at Ohio State. He makes the material come alive and spends countless hours outside of class helping with the midterm. The most impressive aspect of him is his dedication to his students. He has spent hours writing me glowing recommendations and editing papers for other classes, quarters after I took his class.

Best professor I have had thus far.  Not a fan of history but enjoyed going to his class.  I recommend him to anyone that has to take this class. Listens to your input and helps you out on an individual level. A teacher that actually cares.

Colin is awesome. He took a GEC in a subject that I generally don't have any interest in and made it enjoyable.  He engages everyone so be prepared to participate in class or on Carmen. Basically you decide what is important with the discussions in class and that's what shows up on the quizzes and tests. Awesome professor.
This TA was awesome! Makes you feel comfortable speaking up in class, and a pretty easy grader. Go to class, take some notes and you'll get an A no problem. Colin rocks

Awesome teacher.  Prolly the best TA I have had at OSU.  Made a pretty boring class extremely interesting. Will even give you his next quarters call number so you can take him again.  Fair grader.  Just an all around kickass dude

Has a vendetta against technology. Ridiculous cell phone policy - will embarrass students for texting in class. Disorganized and a tough grader. Information in the book does not match what's given in class. Lectures were so boring I wanted to cry, and that's saying a lot since I came into the class with a genuine interest in the Vietnam War.

I found MacMahon to be an excellent teacher. He is generally interested in teaching and answering students questions. He puts alot of emphases on group discussion, which is really helpful for getting questions answered and learning extra  details. However, the information in lectures can be found in the books and his lectures can be a little dry.
Wow...that spring semester was BAAAAAD. His speech...choppy; his information...found in the textbooks; and his insight...ummm, not so much.  I'm sure he's stimulating to the dead.

I actually think he is one of the best history professors (and that says a lot, because I believe the department is VERY strong). A lot of reading is required, and the lectures were old-school (he talks, you take notes). But if you take  good notes and read the study guides the tests shouldn't be a problem. Class was 2 exams and a paper; very fair.
Dr. MacMahon is his favorite figure in history.  Between his soliloquoies about his personal accolades and his unctuous smarminous...I don't know which to revile more.  Embrace an asp before him.
Professor MacMahon is a tough grader.  He won't change grades given by the TA.

This professor gives unclear lectures and false information,I was marked off for using information he gave in the notes because it was wrong. I went to talk to the t.a. about my grade an he refuse to ajust. It's not even worth going to class because any notes you actually get are probably wrong, unclear, and in no paticular order.

Boring class, but that may be because I don't like history. He grades the exams tough, but the quizzes are easy. He's a nice guy though! But showing up to class, even if you don't pay full attention, is definitely to your benefit.

Easy class!  He gives you a short list of topics that could be on the exam and picks 5 of them for you to write about.  Reading quizzes and map quizzes are easy if you study.  If you study, you will do pretty good.  I never paid attention in lecture.  Quizzes are almost every class and count for attendance.

A overall good guy, but gets off subject easy and grades tough. He grades all writing assignments on a level comparable to a 300 level english course. Brings up many interesting point of views and look into material deeply, but too much for a 100 level course. Much better suited for a 300 level or history major.

She is the smartest and hottest teacher you will ever come across in your university lifetime! I hear her friends back home in Canada are pretty hot too - especially LB & CO (we're down to 3)! Ask her about Louis Riel and Lord Nelson, she is an expert on these topics.  Andrew you're hot too;)

Ursula is probably one of my favorite professors here. I hated 111, but she made 112 easy and manageable. She was always willing to answer questions and explain things outside of class. I would definitely recommend her to anyone taking History.

Ursula is probably one of the best teachers I have had at OSU. She goes to a lot of effort to make class very interesting. She really cares about her students, but is always willing to help. She expects you to work hard and attend class. If you do that you should be able to get an "A".

Pretty nice person; easy-going, cuts people a break; seemed pretty easy to understand to me- I don't know what everyone is complaining about- everything seemed pretty cut and dry, and she seemed nice enough
Really, absurdly nice. She makes the class as easy as it could possibly get. I would definitely recommend her to anyone who only takes this class for a GEC, or anyone else for that matter.
No Comments
One of my favorite. Very successful at making the course material painless and uncomplicated. Gives good hints for exams*. Super friendly, approachable, & reasonable. =)

I don't know what these kids are all taking about.  she makes the material clear, she knows what's going on and she has great commets.  plus, she seems to really care about her students.  but be sure to do the work for an A in this class.
Ursula is the best TA ever! History 112 sux tho.
Great teacher, I would highly recommend

She is a great teacher. Caters to students, is always helpful if you approach her, gives away the answers to tests if you pay attention. History 112 is not the most interesting class to take so don't expect the ta's to make it intersting. Ursula is one of the kindest teachers I have had at osu. Blame history 112, not Ursula.
She's a freaking joke- I can't understand why they let these clowns into graduate school.
Nice enough, but not too bright, not too organized; get into a different recitation section (if you can)
good TA. way better then other history TA's i've had
The comments below are unfair; she tried to make a confusing Prof and lecture make more sense. She was nice and cared enough to make an 8:30am class somewhat entertaining.

Yes, she's beautiful, but she doesn't seem to know what's going on.  She seems to know barely more than her students.  She is very nice, though, but doesn't seem to be on top of the material enough to be helpful.
Does a good job in helping the lectures make sense. Fun and interesting.
Does a good job helping students prepare for the exams/essays. Nice, and always willing to help.
Always willing to help the students, very nice. Helped prepare us for the exams/essays.
The other ratings speak for themselves.
No Comments
Horrible! Watch out!

While a nice person and very VERY attractive, Ursula is not the most brilliant person I've ever met (understatement).  This was an easy class, but I do not feel she had the greatest grasp of the material.  She would ramble on and on without making a point
Good teacher, helpful, Canadian history stories were really interesting. Go Canada!
If you do the work, the prof gives you a good grade. I learned a lot from him. Recommended

James seems to be unaware this is an online gen ed requirement. Class requires multiple comments every week on discussion boards. Multiple papers to write for the class of which he provides no guidelines on grading. He consistently awards low grades on papers citing vague reasons as feedback. Unwillingly to discuss grades when asked. Avoid Helicke.

Literally the worst online professor I have had. I would not recommend this class with this professor if you want an A. He seems to be having a power trip and doesn't think that we are enrolled in any other classes. Regardless of how well your paper is he always manages to find excuses and give you a B.

Professor Helicke is a very good professor that has a very clear teaching style. His assignments are not that hard and he puts his slides on Carmen. I would highly recommend this professor to anyone that wants a painless GEC history course.
Great lecturer.  Gets the class involved in discussions.  Be sure to participate as part of your grade is based on that.  Would highly recommend for any history class!

He acted like reading 90 pages was okay for a GEC history class.  From those readings he would pick small details and get angry if you didnt know what he was talking about.  He was a fair grader but his pop quizzes were tough and hurt grades.  I would not take his class again if i had a choice

He is interested in the material which comes across vividly but treats students as if they already know the material. Condescends to students who don't know the material well/at all and gives difficult pop quizzes over long readings (60-90 pages).

JT was a great teacher. He had to teach over 2000 years of history in ten weeks, some of it really dry material, but he managed to keep it interesting and constantly get the class involved. No papers, just 4 map quizzes, a midterm, and the final, and he gives you the essay prompts beforehand. Very fair grader and nice guy.

My favorite professor at OSU and I was an English major. He made the class so interesting by telling stories that helped you better understand the concepts. If you like history, take any of Dr. Steneck's classes.

He was ok. I kind of liked the lectures, even though it was pretty impossible to take notes. He's more of a story teller. So just sitting there was kind of nice. There was way too much writing for a GEC 100 class. Take this class if you like to listen to stories. If you want to actually learn some stuff, find someone else.

If you have the slightest interest in history, you should take Dr. Steneck. Yeah, his class might not be as easy as others, but you LEARN! Steneck is passionate about his subject and it shows, even if he is not an American historian. I almost wish I were an European history major so I could take more of his classes.I would recommend him to anyone.

The only thing he does well is speak clearly. His lecture notes are terrible. His quizes are way too hard. He teaches the class like its a 500 level class. He seems to have way too much confidence in knowing his material and speaks like he was there at the time. DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR. He is absolutely terrible.

Took the class on modern German history. From the other reviewers, it sounds like he may not know much about other history, but this class is his field of specialty. Knew what he was talking about, and the books he assigned were great - lots of memoirs. Take this class only if you're interested in the subject.

This prof is HORRIBLE. He goes too fast in lecture and skips over thousands of years of history just because he doesnt know the material. My girlfriend is taking this class with a different prof and her prof treats it like a real INTRO (100 level) class. This guy acts as if we are all working on our masters in history. AVOID STENECK at all costs!!

Is a very hard course but he is up front about it and says during the first class this it is the hardest intro history course offered so you know what to expect. Exams are ridiculously hard as expected. he speaks quickly during his lectures but only because there is a lot of material to cover. he is a nice guy, it's just a hard course.

I don't agree with others' posting.  Yes, his lectures are a bit on the boring side and the study guide was a bit long but this is college right?  The info isn't hard it is just a large range of topics/time frames - hence the title "World History."  He explains his expectations up front...what more do you want?  Overall, take it at your own risk.

hated him, he was ridiculous.  gave us so many terms for the midterm and final and only tested us on 5. his lectures went so fast and he told us he expected us to fill in his lectures with the book, impossible. horrible teacher, graded and taught us like we were grad students not undergrads taking a GEC avoid if possible!!!!

The Syllabus clearly states in BOLD lettering..."This is the HARDEST intro to History class you can take at The Ohio State University". Need I say more?! He is like a book on tape, his lectures are better for practicing your doodles than learning History, and he teaches as if we are grad students, not GEC students
No Comments

so basically he teaches this class as if it were a grad level course. his review guide for the midterm and final was made up of about 200 terms we were told to memorize and then he only tested us on 5 of them... ummm can you say psycho. definately stay away from his class. it was a nightmare

Like everyone else said, even though he knows his history he makes this class was too demanding for 100 level GCE. Study Guides are pages long filled with worthless terms. Even multiple choice quizzes are sometimes confusing. Avoid for history 112, unless you REALLY love history.

Man this guy is a jerk. he knows alot about history but goes way to nuts for a 100 level class. he dosen't put up notes for lecture, you have to sit there and scribble as fast as you can each lecture while he talks without slowing down. If you don't do that then you are stuck reading 200 pages of a thick text book for the tests. NOT RECOMMEDED

He definately knows his stuff, it's just that he writes his tests so they set you up to fail. Be prepared for lots of double negative questions. Also, his key term study guides are worthless. It's basically all cause and effect from lecture/the book. not so much people or things
This guy makes class way too hard. Its a 100 level class and he makes it too difficult! His TAs were all useless as well.
THIS GUY REALLY MAKES YOU WANT TO LIKE HIM, BUT FOR THIS TO BE A LEVEL 100 GEC COURSE, HE REALLY GETS CARRIED AWAY WITH THE TEST AND QUIZZES.

Nice friendly guy but the class closely resembled that of Graduate level. Had very broad questions to answer on assignments but he was very honest and up front about 20 students dropped the class the first 1.5 weeks.
Good guy, teaches fine, but takes himself way, way, way to seriouslly. This was a freshman level class and he treated it (and graded it) like a graduate class. At least he was honest about it though.
Excellent class; he knew his material and communicated it well.

I took IS350 & IS553 with Dr. Steneck. He is one of the best instructors I have ever had. As long as you pay attention in class and do the readings you will be fine. He is always willing to meet with you if you have questins/problems with the material.
I didnt have a problem in the class, as long as you do the reading show up for the class you will be fine.

Dr. Steneck was a good instructor.  Lectures were always a little dry, but he tried to get the class involved.  Lots reading for both 350 and 553.  Paper assignments were fairly challenging in 553 but 350 were easy. If you come to class and discuss the readings he'll respect you and your grade will benefit.
What the hell is going on here?  Like the other guy said, I would sit in his class for 2 hours and come out with no more knowledge than I went in with.

Dr. Nick is a very nice guy who has a ton of knowledge about German History. That said, the only thing he knew about the Intelligence class was what he read in the articles he assigned. This survey class was turned into the most difficult class I've taken in 3 years (including 500 lvl classes) because of his rediculously critical grading critique.
Terrible.  Does not direct "socratic method" at all.  One of those classes you can sit in for 2 hours and leave without really knowing any more than you did before class.
If you have the opportunity to have Mr. Steneck as a professor, definetly take his classes. This is a great teacher and he is more than happy to help you out.

Sarcastic and funny but dont skip class cause he apparently seems to notice. Your grades will reflect your attendance...so if you like to skip class a lot, dont take him. He's very open about what pisses him off, so pay attention to that. overall a decent teacher, but he does grade pretty tough, I thought at least. No quizzes/tests, only papers.

Steneck is a good and very knowledgable teacher. If you take the class seriously it is very easy to get an excellent grade. He gives tons of extra credit to those that show up for lecture. I would highly recommend him for those who WANT to learn about History.

A lot of fun, but don't take course with him if you are not interested in group work.  I loved the class, well taught, and very interesting, but again, he likes to give a huge group project!  Project was worth 40% of your total grade
his class made me interested in history.
Great class, great teaching style. He speaks unbelievably fast.  Tons of useful knowledge and he makes it very easy for the ones who deserve it. Just attending to class will get you a B+.

he takes the intro class way too seriously.  His multiple choice questions are way too hard.  He expects too much for a intro GEC.  The study guides are all right but studying 50 terms for only 5 to be on the test.... come on
Thought the class was going to be hard at first but he is very clear and the study guides helf a ton!! as long as you study those you are good to go!!!
Way too much work for an intro class. Lots of boring textbook reading. A large group project and paper. By the way, he is so not hot.

Tho this class has a lot of reading (no textbook tho) it's pretty durn easy to get an A. Don't do like I did and wait to the last minute to read. It's more work for you.  Just follow the syllabus and do the discussion posts. She's really accommodating if you have any issues and is super easy to get hold of.
Best class I have taken in a long time. From the videos she uploaded this prof is hot as all get out. Def be gettin in on another term if ya know what I mean.

I took the class online for a GEC and I really enjoyed it! There's no exams only discussion posts and short writing assignments on the books read. It may seem like a lot of reading but it really isn't. She was really helpful and clear in her assginments and I would take another class with her. I reccommend taking the class!

Sandy is very confusing when trying to follow along in class.  She says that attendance is not mandatory, yet she takes it randomly throughout the year.  I found my participation grade low because of the 'non-mandatory' classes I skipped.  I would not recommend her, she takes grading too seriously for how little she actually teaches the class.

He's a nice guy but a little harder to understand and his class is really really really really hard. It's almost impossible to get anything above a C. Strict grader. Good luck. If you have him for seminar, switch out now unless you're fine with reading a million books, writing a thousand essays, and failing the quizzes and probably the class.

Vefa was an excellent TA. He is pretty quiet but if you approach him and ask him a question, he is more than happy to help. He is a very very kind person, and genuinely wants students to do well in his classes. I highly recommend that students who take this class do NOT hesitate to contact him, as he is more than happy to help. Great class!
He is a good prof. Helps a lot.  If you don't like to read, then don't take any history classes. Because any kinda history classes = reading+ thinking+ writing !   Good luck.

Oh my...ok so everyone who wrote something about him was COMPLETELY wrong. Yes, he is extremely interested in History, but honestly he puts me to sleep during every lecture. I asked him if my assignment looked sufficient and he said "Sure"...sure? I am not even halfway through his class and I am miserable.

I can not understand anything he says. He makes you read and write a one page response (1 space) to your reading. He goes on and on about topics and is not interesting at all. I am interested in history and he he makes me not like it any more. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS!
By far one of the best and most interesting professors I have ever had.

Hist 182 Very nice guy, but I'm not a fan of history so I didn't particularly enoy the class. His quizzes are based off the readings from the book. He gives you study guides that cover everything on the midterm and final. I got a B but only because I skipped class a couple of times and didn't keep up with the reading as much as i should have.

He is an awsome Professor! He helped me a lot during his office hours and via email. By the way, he gives the exam questions before the exams! What else can be said! Taking this course was a great experience.
He's very nice and helpful, make sure to participate in discussion sections which require you to do the readings. Overall great guy
Awesome guy. Probably the best History 111 T.A. If he knows you're attending class, you will surely receive a good grade.
he is nice...

Shannon was a grad student teacher so she has room to improve but overall I really liked her. Very knowledgable. The class itself was very interesting but the tests require lots of memorizing specific primary sources. She gave a lot of terms to know but the textbook was the most helpful thing to tie them all together, which was ultimately the goal.

While her passion for teaching is commendable, she asks a little (a lot) to much from her students as far as what to know for tests. You are basically given a book and told "Know this". You will need to know every little detail of everything, so unless your memory is excellent, don't take this class.
Long powerpoints, but easy to follow along. Good amount of reading, but not too much.

Although she is not an actual professor, and only ever taught one lesson, she was the grader for the course. The one lecture she did give was awful, and on extreme fast forward (even the actual professor had to have her slow down because he could not keep up.) There were several issues throughout the semester with her poor & harsh grading for many.

This was an online course and I thought this expectations were clear cut. Every week you have to do 2 discussion posts and as long as you answer the questions while drawing from the book and the primary sources  you will get an A. Class was mostly made up of essay writing so if you are a good writer this is the class for you!

Dr. Parker was a fantastic professor.  He is very respected in his field, and it shows because he is absolutely brilliant when it comes to history.  His lectures are funny, interesting, and entertaining.  His tests are essay based, which can be challenging as it requires you to read.  But the class isn't challenging and a good GE.

I have recommended this class to all of my friends but most of them have covered their History GE. Dr. Parker's lectures are detailed, and he is very funny, clear, and shows his interest on the topics he covers. 10/10 would recommend, I will be missing his "jokes that you won't be able to repeat ever again" (direct quote from his last lecture).

One of the most interesting lectures i have ever had. Buying the textbook is not necessary for this easy his 111 class. Exams are just one essay question and not graded by parker but by his ta's. If you like montey python and mel brooks sign up for this guy, hes a riot.
very good
He's an amazing lecturer. His exam questions are very broad so, just focus on his "explanation" and "conclusion" and your grade will be fine.

First of all, hist111 is an intro  class and I think there are way too much works for intro level. The lecture and recitation have its own readings sometimes the materials covered in lecture may not be the same for recitation. For history major students I highly recommend this class since there are lot of readings.

this guy is awesome, his lectures are actually really interesting and he loves to throw in movie clips between slides. cracks jokes during class too. i honestly enjoy his lectures everyday. i highly recommend him.
We heart geoff

I took the Reformation class from him last year.  It was awesome.  He is a very entertaining and engaging lecturer. Lectures the first half, break, then discussion of reading.  Read the coursepack documents, but the book isn't strictly necessary.  Its just good to give an alternate position to Parker's own.  He also helps outside of class. TAKE HIM

The worst part about the class are the exams: essay format, so i suggest reading the books and having a good grip on ALL the material. Class is interesting, lectures are not really necessary, just keep up on all the readings, cause there's a lot of material to cover.
extreamly knowledgable, knows what he is talking about, entertaining lectures

Dr. Parker is a great lecturer, very knowledgeable. He reminds me of one of those historians on the Discovery Channel. The tests are hard because they're essay format, so you actually have to read the textbook. Overall, I enjoyed this class.

Whoever wrote that 1st response is a dumbass.  This is a wonderful class.  Yes, you have to read AND study, but it totally pays off!  The TA's are great, very helpful.  These people are NOT out to get you they want you to do well.  I HIGHLY recommend this prof. to anyone!
All tests are essay format. Gives a study guide for sample questions, but it doesn't really help bc you still have to know everything.
Extremely personable, very helpful.  So interesting to talk to.

Austin is one of my favorite teacher. He speaks Mandarin with American accent. Go over the lecture slides before you take the weekly quiz. NO MIDTERM AND FIANAL EXAM, in stead of that, you will write two 5-page double space essays. If you interest in Asian history, and want a GE history class with a grade A, definitely take his class.

Austin is a really good teacher and I can tell he genuinely cares about his students. The lectures are interesting and the homework isn't overwhelming. There are weekly quizzes, but if you review last week's material they're easy to pass. He made his East Asian History class interesting even if you didn't think history or Asia was your thing.

Austin is a great guy and a great teacher. He is really enthusiastic and is a very great teacher whom I highly recommend to anyone. Easy to understand. There is weekly quizzes and homework, and a midterm and final exam but I never felt overwhelmed. I thought that it was a mainly easy class. He is my favorite professor so far.

Austin is an amazing teacher who genuinely wants you to succeed. His lectures are discussion based and always very clear and easy to understand. Quizzes and homework are regular so there are no surprises, but the amount of work is completely appropriate. My favorite professor so far!

Austin is enthusiastic about East Asian History, and he did a great job teaching it. I only took this course to fulfil my GE History requirement, but end up loving the class. We do have weekly quizzes, but as long as you review the material last week, you will be fine. Midterm and final are all take-home essays, need to go into depth though.

He assigns 3 papers for the semester and attendance being the 4th grade. I like the way he tracks participation. He gives everyone notecards and collects one from you every time you talk, tracking them, and giving them back the beginning of next class. Dr. weeks is over opinionated and papers are written in CHICAGO STYLE. No one uses that.

A difficult prof that told the class if you tried, went to office hours and participated, you would do well in the course. I did all of the above and he did not know my name. I found him rather useless and unclear with his assignment expectations. I learned a great deal, but it was mostly self-taught.

Not a bad teacher, but not really an easy class.  Lots of reading, 2 papers, only 5-7 pages each. But he has so many english rules for his papers that you are probably better off taking a different prof. Rather opinionated, though he is usually pretty fun. His class discussion technique is questionable as well, I didn't care for it.

I went to his office hours 10 times to receive help on my papers.  He was extremely helpful but definitely tough.  If you work hard, you'll get a good grade.  Don't take this one if you're looking for an easy A.
This was the worst teacher i have ever had in my life.

Extremely difficult, hated going to class. Discussion is 20% of grade but likes to only call on certain people, therefore making it hard to get any points. All discussion based therefore I learned nothing. Very strict with paper writing, not much leeway at all. Don't take his class- opt for 4/5 days a week instead.

very strict attendance policy! does not use carmen! lots of reading. very strict about using chicago-style referencing in papers. but he tries very hard to get the class involved. if you put in the time to skim over a few pages every night, you'll be just fine.

Weeks thinks he is a history god. He is very vague about what he wants on assignments, then marks things wrong on papers even if it says it in the book. He WILL absolutely push his liberal views on you. He treats this class like an honors course and is very arrogant. Don't expect a cakewalk.

was very unclear in what he wanted, seemed to favor certain students. His lectures were somewhat offensive, he pushed what he thought on you and did in a way that if you disagreed with his conclusion you must be stupid, I went and met with him about a paper and left almost in tears. If your a good student you'll do fine, but very frustrated.

Contrary to others' beliefs, I found Weeks to be a very easy instructor for those who regularly attend class.  Lectures are the basis for tests, so you HAVE to be there.  He spices up class with humor and politics, sure, but when it comes to assignments, we had 4, and they were graded VERY fairly.  If you TRY, you'll go far in his class.

way too careful about making sure the minorities in class were not offended by things that were saidback in the 1830's, hard grader, but does appreciate when you take extra effort.  if you're looking for an easy grade or a class you can skip, do not take

This teacher was one of the worst I've had as a grader. He was very intelligent, however horrible at making clear what he wanted. He doesn't care to know you or your name. He states one thing for a paper, then when you turn it in he states a completely different thing. I would not reccommend this guy if you are seeking help in receiving a good grad

Welcome to Mr. Weeks' class on the advancement of liberalism. He didn't even try to hide it. The main theme of his class was how republicans hate minorities. People like this is why university faculity have the reputation that they have.  A joke!

Jim is a hot, very smart guy. He is always there for you and he is specially nice to people with disabilities. He got an award on best teacher in that area (sorry I am not a native speaker of English). Muchas Gracias Jim! (he is hot)

Sadly,my section was fullof a bunch of lameasses who couldn't even bother to do thereading for class discussion,but cried quite loudly the day that he-w/ full justification-kicked them out of class.Hello,you're in college now,nothighschool!He is readily available to help.Lotsof office hours/feedback

Not recommended..he was very rude and arrogant. Kicked the whole class out one time for not doing the reading. Difficult grader on papers, never expect full credit. Does appreciate extra effort if you seek extra help. I'm just glad I had Hegerty to counterbalance this guy, she was wonderful.
No Comments

He was my TA under prof Hegarty.  He gave us very little extra work above what was needed for lecture so I would say he's pretty easy.  Expects a decent effort for the papers, but still fair.  Very helpful if you ask, and does good exam reviews. Do yourself a favor and take him, Hegarty's easy!!!!

Worked the class extremely hard, but appreciated every ounce of effort put forth by the class. Made himself available for help constantly and promoted beneficial class discussions as well suggestions on how to teach the material better.
He makes me swoon when talking about Rosie and her riveter...
Cares about his students, but kinda confusing. Now that he shaved the **** star mustache, he's really hot! What's with the Browns T-shirts?? I've taken him twice- he keeps getting better.

Dr. Herron is a very pro student professor. She wants to see all of her students pass and is always willing to help. She assigns 4 books which you have to write a précis( summary) for each book. Midterm was easy and i assume the final will be the same. Show up and pass. She tends to let you out early every class anyways.

She's very helpful, if you have any questions she is more then happy to help you. She very funny and makes  the class fun. She does have long lectures, but gives great information. If you show up to the class, take notes, skim the chapters and do the weekly quizzes you'll do just fine. I really enjoyed this class. Very easy to pass.
Dr. Herron is hilarious. I had her for Modern European History, she is hilarious and has great lectures. I would definitely take her class again
Attendance is only mandatory to turn in discussion question responses which are all opinion based, class was let out early 90% of the time, amazing instructor!

She is the best history teacher. Had her at Wright State. She was very clear & didnt mind stopping in the middle of lecture to explain something.  Quizzes are easy, make sure you read the book for tests. Other than that I enjoyed her class a lot.

She taught at Wright State and is probably the best professor I've ever had. Her class is very easy and her quizzes are a cake walk. She is very understanding if you miss a lecture and always reviews at the end of the week. Her exams are straight from the book and her writing assignments are opinion based.

Great professor! Knows her material and enjoys teaching it. Expects you to know a lot of information for the tests, but then only chooses a few things (only drawback). Other than that would highly recommend her, especially if you enjoy history :)

Professor talks way too fast, cannot complete a sentence, and is rude towards students who ask him to repeat or have a question. He makes you feel like your going to fail the course. Worst professor I've ever had.

James is a very interesting professor. While his class was on the hard side, it was very easy to become interested and to study for it. Went out of his way to help get me prepared for exams and is a funny, interesting person. His lectures are fun, social, and he even makes fun of people.  He will help you out (gradewise) if you come to class (E.C.)

Okay, not as easy as you think to get an A for a 111 course. He's a really good teacher, but if you're an engineer looking for a GPA boost, look elsewhere.  I did well on the midterms but he raped me on the 8 page paper, which was graded rather stingently.  Do the project instead, the dense ones did and i'm sure he gave them A's.

I don't really care for history classes normally, but Sam was super knowledgeable and really funny, which made his lectures enjoyable. The tests were a little difficult but reasonable, but I would have preferred fewer papers. Attendance is a must, but you can get away without doing all the readings.

He will tailor the class in the first few weeks to make sure it's not unnecessarily difficult. His lectures were sort of long and he could definitely ramble and include unnecessary details. Easy grader on the assignments - definitely not my best work. Overall, not a terrible GE but not my favorite. He doesn't go out of his way to make it hard.
Excellent professor! I would recommend one of his classes to anyone looking for an interesting GE. His lectures are very engaging, and he cares a lot about his students.

Western Civ. in Maymester was very tough. There was a lot of material and if you didn't divide it up to study with someone you would have to study 3+ hours per night to get an A.  During the normal semester this class wouldn't be bad. He's hilarious and very nice and makes very boring material not as bad.  Book was not as helpful and took forever.

Great professor. Attendance is mandatory, but he is a good lecturer, so class is not painful. Tests can be tough, but if you attend class and pay attention they are pretty straight forward. He offers extra credit to earn back half of missed points on exams. He keeps class light and is incredibly knowledgeable.

Sam is obviously very passionate about history. A good professor who wants everyone to do well. You will need the book and coming to class is a necessity especially because attendance is part of your grade. Overall a great, fairly easy class.
Good class. Professor was funny and kept lectures interesting. Tests could be a little hard, but doable.

Dr. Fernandez is my favorite professor at OSU! She is extremely kind and gives great clear lectures on the material. The class is super interesting, but does have substantial reading (although not imperative). There are some long papers and exams, but she gives plenty of help and time to complete them. Would recommend her for any class!

Lilia made this class very interesting. There was only one midterm in the class worth 20% and the rest of your grade was made up of three papers and attendance. I didn't do any of the assigned readings and it did not affect my grade at all. Lilia is an amazing professor, and this is a great class to take to fill your history GE.

Classes are basically all lecture based but she really knows what she's talking about. The class was really interesting and not too difficult as long as you attend class and takes notes. Two papers (midterm and final) and five quizzes, she drops the lowest grade.
Absolutely amazing professor! She knows what she is talking about, wants to teach and truly cares about the subject and her students.
Professor Fernandez is great! She clearly knows her subject and is excellent at teaching students about Latino History. Expectations are fair too. I would highly recommend her!
Lilia is the bomb. She is super nice and really helps her students. She is not one of those profs that is just going through the motions, she actually cares.
Professor Fernandez actually cares that you learn and is very willing to help. She's fun to have class with and the class is not hard for a 577. You watch a few movies in the class, it's a good deal.

I really enjoyed this class. People have been giving her bad comments but I really think it's unrealistic. The only reason they're bad is because she actually believes you can learn and achieve something. She's perfectly willing to give good grades, just as long as you don't spout nonsense. Unlike other teachers, she's competent and not a pushover

I don't find the History of the Family class to be difficult in the slightest (although some may disagree); my main problem with Professor Robertson is her extremely liberal bias, inaccurate comments about the Catholic Church, and general rudeness.  If you are conservative or want an unbiased opinion, you will extremely dislike this class.

Agree with the other comments. Claire grades in a completely unrealistic way. The workload is intense, and she is far from helpful or understanding. You spend the whole quarter trying to scrape by. She's smart, but that doesn't make a good teacher, now does it? Don't do it!

This is the worst women' studies class I have ever taken. Claire gets off topic too much (which is usually fun, but not in this class). The papers are not difficult assignments, but she grades ridiculously hard. Try to take this class with another professor because she is sooo boring!

NEVER take this class...unless you are a grad student with like one other class. The amount of work is completely unmanageable and her grading is unreal. I loved women studies before this class...but it is giving Africa and the department a bad rap in my eyes...

I was really nervous about taking a class with Dr. R because of the comments on here, but I think they are kind of harsh.  Dr. R is very nice and helpful if one needs help, and although her class demands a lot of reading and grades are based on quizzes and essays, she is very clear in her lectures and lets the student know exactly what she expects.
constantly contradicting herself and the only way to do well in her class is if you read her mind.  even then, you'll probably get a C.  ruined my quarter.

it would be okay if she was just hard, but claire is just downright mean.  she's condescending and does nothing but make you feel stupid and like a worthless human being.  this was the ONLY professor i've ever disliked in my 4 years at OSU, so it's saying a lot.

Ruined my quarter-- twice (she teaches the required 550 sometimes). If you MUST take her class, NEVER EVER EVER turn in anything late-- not for a funeral, not if your sick, never...because you'll never hear the end of it.

Well, the topic could have been interesting - but with the lack of personality on the teachers part... I dreaded every class. She has her mind set in one way - and you better agree with her. She is very difficult, and very hard to please. Make sure to look
This class was definitely one of the worst classes I've taken at OSU.  Think twice.

Visiting professor at Kenyon. Great teacher. He really knows the history of multiple Latin American countries in and out. Loves to use the word phenomenal.  4 papers on books we read in class, all were clear cut, and if you put some effort into them, he'll give you an A. Extremely helpful outside of class and loves talking about sports.
Very helpful and easy to work with. A lot of reading but it's mostly interesting. 4 papers (4-6 pgs) in 5 weeks but he explained what he wanted well so they were easy to write.
His lectures are interesting and he has a good sense of humor.  There is a lot of reading to keep up with, but if you can do that, you will do well in the class.
Great teacher... Makes class fun and interesting... Exams are graded farely... Really funny guy...
he is the beeeeeest i loved and enjoyed his classes his notes are very clear and helpful,don't miss class shows clips and the exams and paper is easy!!!if u take hist he should be your first choice
Looooove him. Funny and clear lectures, very fun! Would recommend him over anyone else ever.
he is the nicest man and very funny.  he is very down to earth and glad to help anyone with questions.  i wish he was teaching my 152 class!
was a very interesting lecturer and was extremely helpful. enjoyed his class! be sure to go see him about papers, will be benefical to your grade.

seems like a tough teaching at first but once the lectures went underway it was entertaining and very clear. He is quite funny and have tons of movie clips in his powerpoint lectures, attend lectures! You won't get bored ;)
Great teacher, very helpful and entertaining! Wants to help out- go to him if you have any problems! Lectures were particularly poignant and enjoyable, so show up! Overall, a wonderful professor.

Pretty funny guy.  Class is really organized and he is pretty clear.  Go to class and you should do just fine.  Never boring and is willing to help you out.  Look for his name cause I know history can be a bear.

Great lecturer, gets a lot covered, but knows how to make it interesting by including clips from movies, songs, and The Simpsons.  Be prepared to work hard on your papers though, and DEFINITELY get his input before turning papers in, it will help a lot.
This woman is unbelievable.  If it wasn't for my T/A, out entire class would probably be failing because of Mangus' impossible grading scale she uses for the ridiculous exams.  AVOID!

If you like a 100 level class being taught as if it's a 500 level, take this. This teacher takes herself way too seriously & for a GEC class, this is not worth it. Exams are essay style & from the pits of Hades itself. Take Vantine, he is an actual human being from this planet. Avoid psycho Mangus!

Her class was a miserable exeperience.  She is inconsiderant, moody, and lacks anyform of personality.  She teachers like a dictator in a vikings body and offers absoluty no room for others opinions.  Good class if you enjoy praising womens role in hist.
Great teacher who really knows her stuff. She is very willing to help students.
she is a good teacher, if you're a **** and care only about what women have done in history!!
