Tough essay grader
I loved the way she taught.

Extremely engaging and a wonderful lecturer. You will never be bored in class. However he assigns too much reading. You will have hundreds of pages due each week. I adore reading more than almost anything and I had trouble keeping up. He is a fairly easy grader though. Also make sure you show up to class!

He assigns a lot of reading, which tend to be more than 100 pages weekly and expects you to remember everything. The quizzes and exams are based on the readings, where the quizzes are 10 minutes long and expects you to immediately know the answer and not getting a chance to think it through. If you hate reading, I recommend not taking this class!!

From a GE standpoint, this class takes a lot of work. Expect to be reading a lot of material. The tests are tough and graded somewhat subjectively on "Identifications," and the essays (3 in total) are strictly graded. While attendance isn't be necessary, you will have to study hard outside of class to learn the material instead.

Cool dude. If you listen to the lectures OR read you will do fine. I read only what i didnt know already. Easy class and funny guy. If you actually talk in his class, he will really like you as well (he actually thanked me at the end of the semester for making his life easier).
Took his class two semesters ago and it is still my favorite history class I've taken. Best teacher I've ever had and I think I am in love with him
Coolest teacher I've ever had. He is super chill and really young. His class is not hard as long as you pay attention and study some. He is also not bad to look at.

He made the lecetures rather interesting, especially considering i don't like history HOWEVER it is a class that requires alot of work. our final consisted of writing 2 5 paragraph essays along with 6 short answer and others. basically, exams are very tough, lots of papers, 2 midterms and final. study guide would consist of 100 terms for 10 questin
Lincoln was a great teacher. I absolutely loved his class. He made it interesting and he was really enthusiastic. I was surprised how much I learned.

Graded papers strictly. Contradicted himself often.At times didn't seem like he cared about correcting himself. Often said: We'll skip this because you guys don't care. Great personality but sometimes hard to take seriously as a teacher when I see problems with his teaching methods. Hipster too. Hard to take him serious when he doesn't wear socks.
stole the words right out of my mouth- loved him. made class fun and interesting.
loved him
No Comments
Very knowledgeable but very disorganized. Expect to be doing a lot of self-teaching

This isn't a history class. It should be called Colonization and It's Effects because that's all he talks about. We spent an entire week on an Egyptian village prior to 1914. We spent ONE DAY on World War One. The Russian Revolution got half a power point slide. My 8th grade history was more informative.

A really nice, funny man, but very disorganized, and a really terrible public speaker. The way he presents is almost impossible to listen to, as he stutters and constantly jangles his keys. Very smart though, and great if you really get history.
Hard to follow and classes were pretty boring. If you don't enjoy Ottoman history then don't take this class

Prof. Findley was funny and he really knows what he's talking about. I would recommend this class for someone who already knows a lot about the Ottoman Empire, because it seemed like everyone who didn't had some trouble. Six books, a paper, a group project,a midterm and a final. Moderately tough grader.

Not a good professor. Sped through the lecture so fast most people were unable to take notes, although they were posted online.  The class was easy as I am a poli sci major and knew the stuff already, but friends complained about the difficulty for a GEC. only redeeming quality was the TA was great.

Not good. Spends the first 30 minutes of class rambling about unimportant things and then has to speed through material at the end of class. Very boring, hard assignments, doesn't prepare you adequately for tests.

Horrible experience. Class was extremely boring. Tests were rough because he didn't give very good reviews or study guides. The book he makes you read for the paper is as dry as reading stereo instructions. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS
His classroom manner is eccentric, but he is very, very knowledgeable.  I learned a tremendous amount from this course.
One of the best professors I've ever had at OSU.  I'm sorry it took until my senior year to take one of his classes.

His bowtie is astounding.  Not so bad of a class, but was out of my focus area and a challenge, as it was exams and not papers.  What you should do is pretend you are interested...you might end up actually interested in the end.
Very smart guy and wants students to learn but the material is not very interesting if you don't really like history. Not a bad 597 course, but how you do will depend a lot on your ta.
Endearing but did not learn much.
Please. Much better that he's being given credit for here.

He is a good soul who truly cares about his subject.  He is hard to take, but I feel for him.  I saw him cry while speaking about the modern problems between the US and MEast. Plus his southern charm is endearing.
His class is a joke, but thats the only good part about it. Dr. Findley is so out of touch with reality that you will learn nothing.
No Comments
The Forrest Gump of Academia. Not only does he sound like a mindless hick, his teaching is just like a box of chocolates-- You never know what you're gonna get.

Dr. Gallay is an excellent professor. He tries to present students with varied views on how to study colonial history, and he keeps class interesting. He's very knowledgeable and willing to help in whatever way possible. I took his 598, too. I would recommend him to anyone serious about history.
There is a lot of reading, at least 6 books. But he's an easy grader. Pay attention to the major themes in the books and his lectures and you will get an A.
Professor Gallay has high expectations, but I learned more in this class than in any other GEC.  If all you expect are "easy" courses, then why go to college?

She's a good professor. She encourages her students to share their opinions on the discussion board based on readings and what we have discussed in class. She is not funny but not boring. No doubt there's a lot of work for a 100 level class. Attendance is not mandatory so not many students attend the class at 9:30am which is sad.

It was a very burdening course.After completed all her work including extra credit hours, I expected an A but I didn't. I still got low grades after discussing with her about the assignment.Take her class if you wanna spend your weekends posting up discussions, doing essays and in the end,still get low grades.It was too much work for  a GEC course.

She was an good professor, but the course was pretty difficult. She assigns random reading quizzes so you have to attend class. If you miss 2 quizzes, your participation grade drops a full letter. There is a lot of information to handle but she seems to grade papers easily and the exams are not that hard as long as you go to class.

Her class is tough because she makes you read three different books.  As long as you skim everything you should be fine.  There are 10 quizzes and one is dropped.  She is very nice and helpful but loads you up on reading.  You have to skim the textbook to do well on the quizzes because you take the quiz for the chapter before you do the notes.

I loved the passion that Prof Guy showed for her topic. She painted a vivid picture of the past of Argentina, incorporating far more than just the political aspects. My one complaint? Some of the reading assignments were massive and oh-so-dry. FYI: midterm & final are take-home, but written, w/vocab IDs and essay prompt (~6-10 pgs altogether)

I dropped the course after 3 weeks in her class because she talks to students who are non history majors like we are stupid. She is condescending when a student is wrong or contributes something that may not be exactly what she is looking for. Don't take her unless you are a history major.
I had Donna as a prof 12 years ago at the University of Arizona. Long story short, she made a lasting impression. I enjoyed her insight on Argentina studies and was a pleasure to have her as my prof.

Profesor Guy is one of the most impartial professors I have had. She is definitely NOT a feminist and while I had not prior interest in Argentina before taking this class, the readings and assignments caught my interest because Donna was both passionate in her teaching and helpful in her instructions
Donna is wonderful...any of these comments saying she is terrible are probably from people who fail to go to class, do the readings and pay attention-a lot of slackers that were in my class
I am taking the History of Argentina with her right now and I can say that she is one of the best prof's at osu...she is committed to the students and she knows so much about Latin America.

Any comments saying she is "the worst professor at osu" are completey and utterly false. Prof. Guy is probably one of the nicest, most caring and intelligent professors I have ever had. Her lectures are carefully crafted and she goes way out of her way to help students comprehend the material and improve their writing abilities. Take her!
Worst teacher at OSU.....period and I'm a senior.

If you are interested in history and not a feminist or a liberal I would not rerromend this class.  A ton of reading that does not help and you have to answer study questions about the reading.  And be prepared to be taught by the history channel as well.

Amazing professor. Recommend her highly to any student studying history. She actually uses her books she assigns, goes out of her way to help out students, and is one of the most caring professors one will ever meet. Expects highly of her students, and thus her students can expect highly of her in return.

I absolutely loved her. This was one of the most interesting and thought-provoking classes I have ever taken. I can see where she might come across as intimidating at first but she's really nice and helpful and she REALLY knows her stuff. Excellent!

The WORST teacher at Ohio State!! Speaks to students as if they are kindergartners - assigns an unreasonable amount of reading and demands each and every individual page to be read (mark my words - if it is not done... don't show up to class because you wi

The experience I had with Donna J. Guy was: her being the worst teacher I've ever had while at Ohio State.  The reading might be heavy, but it was dry and boring which I learned nothing from. You can't base a class on soley reading. She treated the student
She is interested in teaching her students and helps you pick your own areas of interest. The reading is heavy, but she does a good job bringing in other sources like movies and cultural influences.

This class could have been soooooo much more intersting than she made it.  She's a hardcore feminist, and Latin America is her speciality so every thing that we talked about eventually came back to Latin America.
you can't go wrong with her.  She is the best thing OSU has to offer.
Luved her,...would recommend her again and again

Requires 4 books, costs a lot for a GEC. Lectures are incredibly boring, she never hints at important points and her slides are substanceless. Lecture consists of her droning on for hours quickly spouting off dates leaving you with a page full of half started sentences and no idea what to take down for notes. Do not take her class!

She is an absolutely awful teacher. She gave us assignments worth 40% of our grade that were based on fictional books. Treats it more like an English class than a history class. It's really awful. She's very full of herself and thinks she's always right. Do not take a class with her unless you absolutely have to.

She is a great teacher IF you are willing to put the work and effort into the class.  She lectures, uses textbooks, novels, visual aids, music, short movies, etc. as teaching methods.  She is always willing to help and meet with students.  I highly recommend her, but be ready to work and participate.

WOSRT TEACHER I HAVE EVER HAD!!! SHE GRADES EXTREMELY HARD! AND HER COMMENTS ARE VERY RUDE. SHE SHOULD BE A LITERATURE TEACHER NOT A HISTORY TEACHER. I HATE GOING TO HER CLASS. SHE IS JUST A BAD TEACHER. DO NOT TO TAKE HER CLASS.

She is at Texas State now. Taking her for second tier Freshman history. DO. NOT. TAKE. Her lectures are long and tedious. Her tests and essay questions are ridiculously hard. She is brand new to the teaching scene and is like a baby rattlesnake, way too much venom when biting down. Do yourself a favor science majors, take Montgomery.

She is really nice and very helpful, but you have to keep up with the work. Reading the textbook is important because she quizzes you, but other than that her lectures are interesting and easy to understand.
I absolutely loved her. She loves to teach, and it comes through in her manner of instruction. i wish i had taken more classes with her

Well spoken professor. High lecture based. No need to buy the textbook if you can take good notes in class. Very enjoyable and interactive. He is very knowledgeable. Midterm exam is short answer and essays. Final is 2 essays submitted via email. You will read several historical books/novels and complete essays. Recommended.

Early on he stated that he did not believe in As! He assigned so much reading that it was ridiculous. When an upperclassman saw me checking out so many books, he said good luck. I had to read an entire book over one weekend. Sad part is that there was only one question about it on the test and needless to say I did not get an A for my response. A-
Great guy! If you can write well, and have at least some interest in the subject, you'll be fine.

He certainly did his best to make class interesting and enjoyable for everyone. His exams gave everyone a chance to succeed, as long as you were willing to put in the time to study. I would certainly love to have him as a teacher again. He's very approachable, knowledgeable, and takes the time to answer any and all questions. Grade A teacher!!
Very knowledgeable and passionate about what he is teaching. I liked that he let us pick our own paper topic and write on our own opinions.
Great teacher! needs to liten up on the grading scale

Knows his history and is always helpful if youre stuck on something or dont understand it. Shows interest in the students and shows hes excited about teaching and seems very friendly and can be funny sometimes. Hes a bit of a hard grader, but he tells you exactly what is needed and expected and how to do your best and use the information from class

I do not recommended this class to anyone.  The amount of work is ridiculous.  If you take it expect to have over 700 slides to study for each test not to mention the huge amount of reading required plus the two additional book reviews.
Way too much for a 100 level class! I couldn't keep up with note-taking in class. Amount of reading for this class was excessive.
Hard Professor! 3 papers (graded to his bias). Mandatory class. Long lectures (Don't expect to get let out early). Powerpoints online only good asset. Flies through notes. No time to write down.
This guy flunked all my papers after a political disagreement.  He's extremely biased and irrelevant.  I have over a 3.0 and flunked this class due to my ideology.
Boring is not strong enough to describe him.

ABSOLUTELY POSITIVELY DO NOT TAKE HISTORY 151 WITH THIS TEACHER. HE IS THE WORST AND HARDEST PROFESSOR I HAVE EVER HAD AND IT IS FOR A GEC CLASS. HIS TESTS ARE IMPOSSIBLE AND ALL ASSIGNMENTS ARE USELESS, TIME CONSUMING AND AWFUL. I AM CRINGING AS I AM WRITING THIS.
Easy class... she's great!  Really down to earth and interesting lectures.  Her TA Jamie is a raging psycho though, avoid her at all costs.

Awesome teacher.  Wonderful person.  Most popular instructor in the entire History Department.  Gives away lots of test answers ahead of time.  Gives extra assignments for extra points; showed films where we would write short ID essays at the end, for more extra points.  We wish only the best for Dr. Hegarty in her career.  She is truly inspiring.
AMAZING PERSON!!! Funny and super entertaining. The class is so easy but you still learn a lot!!
Pretty Good Professor.  She knows what she is talking about.
A joke of a class. If you're majoring in something that takes up a lot of time and needing an extremely easy History GEC, take this class. Pathetically easy.

AMAZING person. If you are ever fortunate enough to have the opportunity to take her class... DO IT. She is truly an inspiration and a wonderful teacher. I did cry on the last day of class. Her course is what "the college experience" is all about.

While I'm sure Dr. Hegarty does a great job teaching Hist 151+152, Hist 526 is her true love. I thought people were crazy when they said they were sad to leave on the last day of class, but now I know what they are talking about. Such an eye-opening class that is low stress. I hate history, but this has been my favorite class at OSU.

Her class is very easy and informational. I would suggest going to every class. Not only will you learn alot, she will also end up telling you what is on every test, and give extra credit some days attendance seems low. She is very witty and interesting.

This class was a joke. I maybe went to 3 lectures in total, but honestly dont even worry about going to the lectures and also dont ever print out her online notes. I got an A in this class just by reviewing the study guide which she posts bfor the exam and **read the text** and never missed a recitation. If u do all these you will def do fine

Never went to lecture and got an A- in the class. Just go for reviews for midterm and do the review sheet, study it, and you'll be fine. Pretty easy class. Exams are take home paper and a small in class part consisting of fill ins, multiple choice, and short essays. Everything that is on test is given to you before hand.
Great lady. I would definitely suggest her class--very easy :)

There are major rewards for attending class, as she gives hints about the midterm and final -- especially when attendance in lecture is low. There are study guides for both the midterm and final, which includes ID's for the essay questions. Hegarty is a sweetheart and even though I wasn't looking forward to history, I left having learned a lot!

She is a really nice lady and her class isn't very tough but as far as her teaching ability goes, she isnt the best. she knows what she's talking about but she kinda rambles on and on so its really hard to take notes (which you dont really need that much anyway). I would recommend her class, she is very easy going and it wont be tough

She was really sweet, lectures weren't mandatory, and she puts helpful notes and reviews on Carmen.  Exams are also nice: 4-5 page papers that you write at home, and a multiple choice test. She usually gives the prompt several weeks before the midterm and final. I would recommend her to anyone. I learned a lot.
I think Dr. Hegarty in FABULOUS!! I would recommend her to any student taking history at Ohio State! She has been my favorite and best teacher since I have been in college!

This class is an easy A if you study smart, not hard! Get the info you need for the IDs from the book, and ask Prof. Hegarty & the graders for the answers they want. Just make sure your essays are written well, and MEMORIZE. It should be easy because YOU wrote them.

She is a good professor to have. She pretty much tells you whats going to be on the quizzes and she tells you exactly what will be on the midterm and final. The TA's grade kind of hard, but other then that it is easy to get a good grade. You dont have to come to class but it helps because she tells you what will be on quizzes and other assignments.

The TAs are what made this class hard; they grade ridiculously difficult on the midterm & final (5 essays). If they did not grade so hard, the class would have been very easy as long as you read for the quizzes. She also gives the terms before the exams so that you can plan them beforehand. Class attendance is pointless. Pray for a good TA!

TA's got to grade papers and were merciless. Regardless of your essay answers, they could've been verbatim, and they would've still marked them wrong. No incentive to come to class or to even read, Prof gave IDs for essays before taking exams. Easy to be a slacker and still get a passing grade.

This class is minimal work and easy tests the ta will "review" the answers to the test with you prior to taking it the midterms are 150 and 100 is the paper, quizes are easy if you read the information, 5 attendance points and attendance is completely pointless the lectures are terribly boring

Wonderful professor.  Lots of information to process, but intelligently presented.  Leniency in grading.  Good movies; videos.  Great at explaining at concepts.  Good coordinator of the entire TA group.  Always friendly and helpful to students.  Approachable and lively.  If you get a good grade, you have earned it.  Down to earth; not arrogant.

Prof. Hegarty seems like a very laid back person, which is probably why her exams are easy. Her tests and quizzes are multiple choice, fill in the blanks, ID's, and take-home essays. It would also be good to have an easy TA because (s)he grades everything.

Easy tests! An easy recitation teacher makes a huge difference!  Michael Hale was a piece of cake, he would give you answers to quizzes before givin them.  Would take attendance at recitation but not at lecture.  If you get a bad recitation teacher then you at least want Hegarty!

Dr. Hegarty had easy tests compared to the other teachers and that's the bottom line!  Instead of the whole test being writing on terms and you either do good or bad at that she mixes it up and gives you an opportunity to do well in other aspects of the test like multiple choice, writing a pretty easy paper, and describing specific terms. Easy!
This class is interesting.  Your grade depends on what TA you get, my TA was great however my roommate had a different one in the same class and he was awful.
How you perceive the class depends on your TA. I highly recommend Matt Foulds...coolest guy ever. Overall, pretty easy class.

First history class I have ever enjoyed! AMAZING. Class is super easy.. exams are cake. Attendence was taken in lecture a few times and every recitation but I loved my TA so it was enjoyable. I learned so much. GREAT, I HIGHLY RECOMMEND!
Great teacher, hilarious aswell
Doc is alot of fun, interesting to talk to outside of class. Willing to help her students succeed. Takes roll occasionally by passing around paper to sign in on. Didn't care for my TA though.

I thought she was a bit hard to follow.  Her lectures would just be her just standing up there rambling, and it was hard to bring the book, rtap, and her lectures all together.  She was very funny and laid back.  Exams were managable, but overall your success in the class depended on your TA.

This class is soooo easy if you have a good TA. If you get the chance, def. take this class w/ Matt Foulds as your TA because he makes it impossible to fail. He doesn't believe in testing so he gives you all the answers to the reading quizzes, and has a great review before both the midterm and the final.
Really easy class. Gives a study guide for midterm and final, which besides recitations is the only grades. Don't need to go to class in order to get a good grade, just do the reading.
Easy to Follow

Pretty Easy. Written Exams are very easy as long as you go over the study guide a little bit. Papers are worth more and are graded by your TA, so it's kinda luck of the draw there. Overall, should be an easy A or A- with any effort at all. She's funny and makes lecture easy to get through.

really easy. it's good to go to lecture bc she gives away the test questions, but i still got an A with not going that much for the second half of the quarter. If you like history then I wouldn't recommend her because she's so unorganized in her thoughts that you don't really learn that much

This class really depends on your TA.  Her objective midterm and exams are pretty easy but the essays are graded by the TAs.  Also there are very hard reading quizzes in recitation each week.  The questions asked from the readings come out of obscure little details.  Try and take this class with Dr. Van tine instead.

This class was soooo easy. She has one midterm which 50% is a take home essay, and same with the final, which she gives you on the last day of class. Personally I thought she was boring, but she isnt one of those teachers who's out to fail you. My TA was Doug, and he's pretty good at preparing you for quizes. Easy A.

she is great. not the most interesting prof ever but she tells you what will be on the exams and makes them easy. there are two 4 page papers that coult for most of your exam scores. i got a high b and i hate history

Very knowledgeable.  Lots of information to digest, but pay attention.  She really knows her stuff.  We even saw short videos after which we wrote critiques.  She gives everything away ahead of the tests.  She tries to make it as easy as possible for everyone.  You should try to get Dr. Hegarty for both 151 and 152 in this sequence.

This class, if you're not good with history (like me), all depends on your TA.  I had Matt Foulds, and he gave you ALL the info you needed for the test.  As for Dr. Hegarty, she's basically good if you like history, and a little too boring if you don't.  Two 5 page papers were 50% of your grade.

She's liberal, but if that's your style or you can put up with it, she's very easy.  She gives you half the answers to the tests if you go to class.  Also, it didn't hurt that I had the best TA I've ever had.  If you can get Ryan Dawkins as your TA, do it.  He's more knowledgeable than she is.
Lectures aren't that clear because she doesn't teach cronologically, but the exams are really fair. She gives you 9 ids to study, 6 or which she put on the exam.
No Comments

One of the best classes I've taken yet. No tests, only essays. I would take a class with Lyn anyday and would recommend her to anyone who is looking for the ideal college experience. You will learn a lot and the workload isn't too bad. Lots of reading.
She made class interesting, and most importantly she was not bias in her teaching.  The course I had with her was a women's history class, and she was honest about everything women have been through.

Great class...totally eye-opening. Lots of reading, and she could mumble off and lose your interest in lectures. Lots of in-class discussion, no exams, all papers, which she grades very easily. I'd recommend this class to anyone, if only for how eye-opening it is.

Great teacher! Perfect for this course. She was engaging and had lots of knowledge and, best of all, she let the class discuss the readings. Be interested in this class before taking it and you will have a GREAT time! I almost cried on the last day because I will miss coming to class twice a week to have conversations with her and the class.
No Comments
Lectures are really boring, but the recitation is okay. 2 take home essays are 50% of your grade and the tests are pretty easy.
She's a fun lecturer and does the best she can with boring material...her tests and essays are fair...Recitation is an easy addition to grade
Boring lectures, but she has a good sense of humor. Just go to recitation, because that is where almost ALL the test info is covered and read the book.

Most boring teache in the world.  Recitations are nothing but mandatory busy work, as nothing you learn there is on the midterms.  She teaches her own interests (No readings or class time given to revolutionary war whatsoever, but an entire chapter (and paper) devoted to womens rights movement.  Terrible Class, DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS!
No Comments
lecutres are really boring but def an easy class if u r just looking for an A. but u prob wont learn too much

If you are looking for an easy and don't care if you learn anything then take this class. The class was easy but she is the worst lecturer that I have ever had. She couldn't keep my attention for 20 minutes.
Nice lady, okay teacher! Class is easy if you just memorize the review sheets. She shows a lot of movies and trails off on her own little tangents.

knows her stuff and opens the floor to questions.  go to lecture, as she shows a lot of videos and sometimes takes attendance.  the videos are clearly made by Democrats, but if you just study the history and not the politics, this class will be fine.  also tells you answers to certain questions on the exams.
No Comments

if you are looking for easy and nice - take her.  if you are looking for learning new and interesting information covering the historical events - take another teacher.  great class if you just want an a.  she does like to help and is liberal - so you are really against that kind of stuff - dont take it.

Can't go wrong w/ Hegarty! Extremely dedicated to teaching, incorporates humor in lecture, tells you exactly what will be tested (refer to study guide). Grading really depends on your TA, so pick a good recitation session.

maybe the least engaging professor i've ever seen. mumbles through lectures and relies on movies to present material. instead of teaching, she bribes students with low standards. embodies everything wrong with university education.
easy teacher, mad nice, and couldn't be an easier GEC to take
skips major historical events.  lectures suck and there is no point to go.  i rely on my TA for all my knowledge...don't take her
Excellent teacher.  Cares about the subjects and the students.  Humorous and means well.
Extremely nice, helpful, easy and interesting. Take her!
Go to class!!! If you do the study guide and really study it before exams you'll get an A

She taught only the most important things we need to know about American history.  Her class was interesting and I enjoyed it.  I'm looking forward to her 152 class next quarter.  Great teacher for a GEC!
SO EASY... I rarely stayed at lecture and never read for anything... I still got an A... i'm not that smart, the class is just that easy
I LOVE this teacher. She made me like history again. Go to class and she will pretty much tell you what is on the exam. :) She is funny too. BUt don't talk in class, she doesn't liek that very much.

Go to Class, go to class.  You will not know anything for the exams if you do not go to class.  She tells you exactly what is on the tests.  Quizes and papers difficult.  RTAP reading BORING BORING BORING.  Hard to get through unless you are interested in history.
Excellent professor - she teaches everything that you'll need to know on the midterm. Go to the review sessions - she gives out answers.
Dr. Hegarty is a very inspiring american history teacher. I truly believe that, unlike some professors, that she enjoys teaching and has a passion for the subject she teaches. She is awesome!

Hegarty is the best.  She will answer your questions.  She will identify with you.  She is patient and understanding.  She won't talk over your head.  She is better than all the male history professors in the history department.  Take both 151 and 152 with her if you can.  You won't be disappointed.

Other than Warren Van Tine, she has to be the second easiest history teacher at OSU.  Still, she is clear and helpful.  Gives you the whole test in advance if you just listen in class.  Do youself a favor and take her to kill that stupid GEC history class!
Fabulously easy, and very kind

This teacher is awesome, she tells you exactly what is going to be on the quizzes and midterms and then she will make sure everyone knows the answer to them! She is the best teacher I have had at OSU!
Very good instructor.  Teaches hundreds of students each quarter, and really enjoys her job.  Inspires a lot of people to do their best.  I give her an A, and a 10 out of 10.
Great teacher!

Very smart lady.  Should be department chair.  Could be dean.  She is a saint.  She worked hard to make sure we knew the material.  She practically gave away all the final exam info in advance.  Take all the classes she gives.
American History Civil War to present.  Professor is very knowledgeable; very astute.  Fun to work with.  She really cares about the students.
Great teacher. Maps out the course in person and more importantly online. Makes it fun, do yourself a favor and get in her class.
A really nice person, but totally insane...  Says the craziest stuff in class.  Compares everything in history to the Bush administration.  Easy tests.
Hot.  Hot.  Hot.  The best teacher in the history dept.  She really wants to teacher upper division classes, but says they won't let her.  She is so much better than the rest of them.
Very pleasant lady. Tests are very easy. Very Subjective grading on essays because each TA is different. Would stronly recommend.
She was just fun and enjoyable, and I hated History until now.

Makes you work hard.  Most fun instructor I've had.  She works hard for the students.  Love to hear her New York stories.  I'm amazed at how she tames all the TAs and makes them toe the line.  Gets "best teacher" award.  Nicer than other history
Explained exactly what was on the tests, and what was expected.  Gave extra credit, and maintained a good atmosphere even in a 200+ person class

She is very out of it at lecture - talks to herself a lot and not to the class. She puts each lecture outline on the internet so you can have it before class. She also tells her everything that is on her test.
She was one of my favorite teachers I've ever had.  I love her accent, and sense of humor!
nice lady.  tests are 8-10 fill ins and 10-12 mulitple choice.  easy.  big essay at the end though.

took it over the summer, some reading, few assignments, great teacher and discussions, one of the best classes i've had at osu.
Great teacher, cares about students and makes the class easy, gives great study guides.

easy class, yes, but a wonderful teacher who really cares about students
Take her class, it is easy and actually sorta fun too.

very strict...terrible
Love her! She is a genius when it comes to WWI and is VERY interesting. Let's students decide their own opinions and considers everyone's viewpoints.

Do NOT try to BS this woman! She knows everything!  Gives clear criteria for assignments, very helpful in one on one interaction.  An extremely well respected scholar.  You will learn a lot from this prof! Highly reccomended.

Amazing teacher who is very interested in his field of study (it is apparent in his lecture). Class was always fun and worth coming to.  The only problem I had was that he NEVER response to emails. He actually never sent an email to the class the whole quarter either.  If you get a chance definitely take one of his classes.

Stephen Dale is by far the best professor that i have had at OSU.  His special interests lie in the history of the middle east, but he is knowledgable in a wide array of subjects.  This research and methods class immensely improved my analytical writing skills.

He's a horrible professor. He sits and lectures about anything that pops into his head that has nothing to do with the class or the subject.

Is a fun lecturer,but his papers and assignments require hard work and you have to make sure you've got the details he wants or else you won't do well. Talk to him about the papers before writing them! (It really helps!)
Tells great stories, but sometimes the class feels a little unorganized.
Very easy class, very little homework.  If you care about the subject, he makes the class very rewarding.  Does tend to get off on tangents and interject political opinions at times.
Outstanding professor. He really enjoys what he teaches and makes class interesting. He makes learning about other cultures enjoyable and easy to understand. I really learned a lot about India!
Not a good teacher at all.

Class is really long but it goes by fast. He lets you pick what you want to learn about (Rome, Vikings, Religion... anything!) and is very dedicated to keeping cost of textbooks cheap. Fun class even if you hate history!
Extremely based on jewis history . Nothing to do with generic history. If you are looking for a jewish history class he is the man.
He is the man! Keeps a really long lecture class entertaining. Relates info in a way that is easy to understand. He expects a lot from you but is super cool
Pretty easy but very average teacher

Professor Ugland has a dry way of introducing material, but his old-thyme humor always makes it better. He is very quick with material, and it is imperative to keep up with reading, but most of the tests are based on the connection terms and nothing else. Be prepared to read 100 pages per night, but if you take good notes, this class is a breeze.

He assigned the most homework of any teacher I've ever had. I had a crossword puzzle to do. His reading consisted of about 100 pages each night and his tests didn't relate to anything that he taught us. DO NOT TAKE HIM! Your GPA will suffer.
assigns WAY to much homework and busy work...he was insane with the amount of work he assigned
awesome teacher. very helpful and genuinely interested in helping his students.  GET HIM IF POSSIBLE
The texts picked were terrible, the discussion boring, and the originality minimal. I love history but this class was painful.

This is not a cake class, and he and the TA are not an easy graders. BUT you will learn a lot from him. All he asks is that you try. There's a decent amount of reading but if you like history, you'll enjoy it. Attendance is not mandatory yet it is crucial to attend to hear what he says. He's willing to help but you must approach him.

The most contradictory grader I have ever had. In addition, he is ambiguous, he will just underline something in a paper with no explanation as to if it's good, bad, out of place...I spent countless hours trying to meet his expectations and my final paper grade was the same as my rough paper. My major GPA is a 3.6. My two grades from Childs: B-, C+

An insane amount of reading for a 300 level class, not to mention the hardest grading scale ever for his exams (all essay and short answer). Very condescending and unapproachable.  Don't take for a history elective, your GPA will suffer, even if you're a stellar writer.

DO NOT GET CHILDS FOR THIS CLASS.  His grading scale is out of this world.  I am (was) a 3.7 student majoring in history and I barely got a B- in his class.  He relies on three books every quarter, which are required.  All three books are absolutley pointless to read.  Avoid his class at all costs.

Very difficult to keep up, lots of reading, and lots of papers to write. If you have a full time job, forget it. I dislike the author Gaddis, but it appears Childs likes him. Avoid Childs for this class.

Very Hard Class. There is an assignment every week and a lot of reading. You should probably Participate in the class as it will help your grade in the end. Has no problem helping you with his paper, but he really doesn't tell you how to improve it. He does not give A's on papers until the end of the quarter. Be cautious

Very hard grader. This professor grades harder than any english teacher I have had in the past. If taking this as an elective I would suggest looking for a different class. Exams are very hard 1st one consists of 5 short answers (2 pages each) 2nd one consists of 1 essay (5 pages) and the third one conisists of 4 short answers & 1 essay (13 pages).

I felt lost in this class from the first day. I read 5 books and wrote 10 papers. Dr. Childs grades tough, but the class somewhat improved my writing skills: He told us after the first paper that our writing as a class was "atrocious." This kind of teaching is not enjoyable. He is willing to help at office hours, but I avoided them.

Unrealistic grading expectations.  Thinks undergrads should be able to produce the same quality work as grad students.  Very challenging, did more work for this course in one quarter than my other 3 combined.

I went into this class with high hopes. Within the first week I regretted taking his section of 565. His historical knowledge is minimal compared to other professors offering the same course. Quite disappointing considering it is a higher level class. When challenged with difficult questions he typically responds with a poor and ambiguous answer.

I've despised this class from day one. I finally figured out why today. A student asked a pretty decent question this morning about Hiroshima, and Childs - who clearly didn't know the answer - basically told him the question was stupid. The more he lectures the more it becomes obvious that he's not very smart. He compensates by belittling us.
He doesn't care how much you know, he just wants you to write how he would on papers.  If you get the TA to grade your papers and not him you might be ok.

If you want to get a good grade in this class, you need to be a good BS'er.  Childs expects the world from your papers, yet makes his questions extremely broad.  You need to work hard.  Forget the stupid quizzes and just worry about doing well on the tests.  Even our TA agrees he is completely unreasonable, though, so good luck.
The class was very difficult, but if you pay attention to his lectures and take A LOT of notes you'll do fine.

This class was real interesting.  His southern slang made the class less dull.  He also showed movies and played radio clips.  I liked the class overall, but the TA I had was way too hard in the grading.  On B papers, she gave C-'s.  It was BS and be careful.
terrible.

His class was truly an awful experience.  He grades so that the average is a C, not because you necessarily deserved a C.  Asks very open-ended questions on assignments, but is looking for a specific answer with specific evidence.  STAY AWAY!!

Total Ass-hat.  Very smart, but expects way to much from basic assignments.  Seems to grade everything so that he makes the 78% avg, but doesn't grade to performance.  Unclear expectations and deceptive questions on tests.
Prof Childs is more concerned about cheaters and NOT giving good grades than actually teaching anything.  As a senior history major, I was very disappointed with the class and prof.

I had no problem with Professor Childs. I thought that he was a great guy, who would help whenever needed. The problem I had was with my assigned TA who made grading WAY too difficult. Prof Childs is a great teacher, and would recommend him to anyone who i
Prof. Childs is a good guy, but he teaches mostly from an economic standpoint.  This was not my intrest, so I found myself bored in the class.  He is not an easy grader.
He is a good lecturer, knows his stuff. The grading is tough.
Interesting and engaging, but vague. Sometimes hard to understand what he's looking for- but definitely willing to help students.
If you already have an interest in American history, Prof. Childs is a great proffesor. He doesn't gloss over complex issues and often has an interesting opinion/analysis to add.
Sometimes I wonder if he even knows what he's talking about...
BORING

It's difficult to understand what he is looking for in tests and papers. He gives prompts for the papers that are unclear and really lame. His lectures can be difficult to follow at times as well. It left me wondering what the point was.

He is a very interesting individual, however hard to please
No Comments

Dr. Hartmann really cares about the subject material and teaches this class in a seminar style. She does have trouble with technology but with a little help did just fine. Not very good with technology and gets frustrated with it easily. Only 3 papers in the class, all the same format, but was not very clear on what she wanted for the first one. Semi-difficult, but fair, grader and gives good comments. Make sure to contribute to the discussion. Very understanding and flexible with due dates, etc.

She is almost entirely deaf. Going blind as well--if you sit in the front few rows she literally cannot see you when she's up on stage. She is not unkind, but entirely too self-righteous since she helped write the textbook. Tests are not difficult, and essay prompts are fair, but her grading of essays is not.

Overall, not an easy class, but not terribly hard. Recitation is required, lecture isn't. Keep up with your textbook, it's easier if you do. Essay prompts are difficult, but the TA should help you. Dr. Hartmann has a hard time using technology & the TAs have to help her a lot. Midterm/final's mult. choice questions can be tricky.
Essays prompts were not clear.  After essays were proof read by professionals, average grade was recieved.  She speaks very slow and often says "umm."

She was an extremely hard grader. Essay were very vague and confusing. Midterm and Final were ridiculous. She is technology retarded. This woman was a political junkie and on the biggest ego trip ever. This course is her life and shes up on a pedestal looking down at everyone. I would never take a class with this professor ever again!

Ridiculously tough grader for a GEC class. Essay topics are vague- I've been regarded as a great writer by my teachers all my life and I pulled two C's and a B- on the three (yes, three) essays. doesnt know how to use technology.

Essay question are unclear and very difficult to answer. The multiple choice questions on her midterms and final are also extremely difficult as she gives you only possible answers to choose from. She treats the class like it's a major requirement and not a GEC. Good luck!

Cool and reserved but very interested in helping students.  Excellent comments on papers.
Dumb class and Sarah makes it worse.  Doesn't clarify lectures just focuses on useless primary sources.  If there is a choice choose the other TA. Although she was nice and not too strict on grading.
High energy. Great clarity. One of the best professors I have had.
Outstanding teacher that cares about the subject matter and students.
Very entertaining class as the way it was covered kept me interested.  Clear and organized approach which allows for deeper understandings of the topics covered. Very good learning experience!

Mark was an great professor and very knowledgeable.  He loves what he does and has a good sense of humor that lightens up the classroom. Mark was a great instructor. His lectures were entertaining as well as thought-provoking, and his sense of humor made it fun to partake in class discussions.
Knows his stuff and is funny.  Uses powerpoints to supplement his lectures well and likes to create discussion

Great guy, extremely helpful.
Helpful and funny, very hardcore on history. Highly recommended  for all ages.

Really enjoyable professor

Jumped around a lot and liked to say "And uh". Book is very necessary because he doesn't cover a lot of the major topics that are on the exams. Took forever to post grades (even during a 5 week term class). Always behind the syllabus material by at least 1-2 days.

Very interesting class. I learned alot from her. You can tell she really knows her stuff. Very willing to help if you need it. Gives review sheets before the MTs. If you answer all of the questions before the midterm and memorize it you should get an A. Definitely would take this professor again.
She's fair and seems to enjoy teaching. I would take her class again.
The class does drag alot but she is very good at explaining and knows her information very well
i highly recommend this teacher. Class is pretty boring but her grading of tests are very fair and as long as you study you can get an A

If you listen in class he tells you absolutely everything you need to know and his reviews for tests are excellent. Very good teacher, I hope to have him again in class. Fair grader.

Great teacher. Although, he goes through the material at a quick pace, it is easy to highlight which material you will be required to know for quizzes. Seems to be genuinely interested in his students, and gives plenty of opportunities to get a good grade. Go to lecture and its an easy A

He was a very knowledgable man. He definatly knew about history. He is a tough paper grader, and lectures fast so pay attention but other then that attend lectures and study and its an easy A or B.

he is very straight-forward. Takes random attendance as part of your grade. GO to class, take notes and you will get a good grade.

Wonderful class, loved every minute of it, lectures and reading material are really helpful and she is FAIR in her grading, as long as you go to lecture and prepare for the essay question portion of the midterm and final you will do well in the class.

She is knowledgeable about history and tells you interesting facts that aren't in the text. Grades really hard, expects a lot for a GEC. Write down every detail you can possibly think of. Go to her review sessions and office hours and you should do fine.

Denice is a good TA. She talks about stuff that you probably won't learn anywhere else and has a sense of humor. Tough grader, but I found that going to office hours and review sessions for the second midterm helped.

Denice is a really good TA, and very nice. She will give you some interesting tidbits regarding perhaps taboo subjects that are pretty cool and probably left out of your profs lecture. She is a pretty tough grader, and expects you to get down to the letter what she thinks you should for an A on essay questions. Pretty cool TA though all in all.
Denice is pretty good in class, but the midterm review really helped. Make sure to go to the review sessions if their offered.

The best teacher I've had at Ohio State, and he's only a TA. Very engaging. In my other classes I often zone out, but without even trying I could pay attention in his class because his presentation is so good. Only knock on him is that he's a Red Sox fan, but I can overlook that.
Great teacher, really helped me out
Very intelligent and easy to listen to, she doesn't lecture too fast so you'll have time to take notes.  Great teacher but pretty tough, be ready to read alot.

Amazing professor! Very clear, organized, and engaging in lecture (even if you are not a history major). Her TA Daniel is awesome and super helpful too. It's quite a challenging class and involves a TON of reading but you will learn a lot! Bottom line: take Dr. Spierling!

She taught the material with crystal clarity, was a sweetheart and was always willing to help you understand any foreign concepts. Easy assignments, pretty easy midterms/final. Just make sure you attend class so you can get the material to put in your outlines. :)

Does a great job explaining things! Very good lecture. You have to go to class to get the notes, she doesnt put notes online. Very nice, but very hard grader. Could have explained certain assignements better. Study guides somewhat misleading.

Ray is fun, and keeps the class interesting by swearing alot. 4 quizzes (multiple choice/fill in with one or two extended responses from the readings) all pretty easy. One response paper from the readings and a final paper. The class was easy if you can memorize well, I got an A-. Attendence not mandatory but participation is 15% of your grade.

People like her are why I am a science major. This class is a bit of a joke, but I got nothing out of it. Just another couple thousand dollars of my tuition down the toilet. Rachel is a great person, dont get me wrong: engaging, funny. But, I'd much rather go get a beer with her than learn from her.

She was so cool. If you do what she says, you will get an A. If you cannot pay attention in class, participate, and write a paper don't take her then.  In comparison to most GEC classes she is the teacher to take for an easy grade and some entertainment.
I loved this teacher. The in class group work was actually fun. She kept the class entertaining and easy to follow. Compared to other history GEC teachers she is definitely one of the best.

She is a good professor that keeps things interesting. I would recommend her for a history GEC. There is a lot of reading though for class. Most of which you get tested over eventually. She does read right off of the slides usually so it does get boring.

Easy class, but not a good choice if you actually want to learn relevant historical facts - I know she tries to make it interesting, and she does, but only by skimming over all the "dull" stuff and focusing on sex and witchburning.  Posts notes, which is helpful, and basically gives you the test questions beforehand.
Ridiculously easy class. Rachael is a lot of fun, and easy to listen and talk to. Take her class if you get the chance!
Very fun teacher, curses like a sailor so she keeps things interesting.  GO TO CLASS.  Tests are easy, and she tells you exactly what you need to know, failure is your own fault.

I think she's a good teacher. A lot of times with history classes, you get lecturers that drone on about boring crap without keeping a class's attention. She's not like this. She's upbeat, prepared, and relates well to the students.

the fact that she is able to teach is more a mystery than the why this class is even necessary.  if you don't read and talk in class and flips out on people for not discussing.  She makes it seem that this class is actually important when it is really a BS GEC that noone really wants to be in.
She really loves history and tries to make it interesting.
She was pretty helpful and was willing to look at drafts of papers.  She held review sessions before tests that helped a lot.

Great teacher. Has high standards but if you attend class and ask questions when you have them, you shouldn't have any problems. Gives you the exam questions a few weeks early so studying is no problem.

The class is lecture based, so you'll be lost if you don't come or pay attention. Only 3 grades: Midterm, Paper, and Final. If you work hard, you'll do well. He sets his expectations clearly early on, so there's really no excuse. He's extremely knowledgeable and covers a ton of information. Be prepared to think "big picture" for exams. Nice guy.

His lectures were interesting but his exams/grading system were not set up well. 3 take home exams of only one question, which should have been called term papers. Since they weren't, he would offer no help with the answer.  I'm not a history major so analyzing history is not easy for me.  If at all possible I would avoid this instructor.

Miss Rodriguez has a clear passion for history (esp. military history) and her passion made the class a joy to attend.  Her lectures were always very through and, as a result, no "surprise" questions made there way on to the exams (although some found them hard due to the amount of material covered).  70% of the grade was 3 take home essays

Although it is obvious that Professor Hall knows and is interested in History, he is  very unclear about what he wants in papers, especially due dates. He rambles a lot, and repeatedly asks if there are questions, and won't move on until someone asks a question. This class seemed generally pointless, and we didn't really discuss the homework.

one of the worst professors i've had. none of his prompts are clear, classes are a complete waste of time, and he's not helpful at all when you ask him questions and is not clear what he's looking for. i recommend avoiding him and the headaches he causes at all costs.

Genuinely caring, nice guy. People who can't handle his HIS398 class should not be majoring in the subject; it is not that difficult. A book review, two short group essays and a final paper on two books by a historian. He is quirky and pretty funny, and most certainly is a knowledgeable guy.

Worst teacher I have ever had; I didn't learn anything I didn't already know. He says he is willing to help, but he just rambles and doesn't really give you any suggestions on how to make your work better.   He is also obviously bitter that he isn't a popular historian.
listed is 300, sould be 600. STAY AWAY!!

The class was difficult, but Professor Hall is always willing to help. I can tell that he really wants his students to walk away with information that will be relevant so while it may not be easy, you will end the class with stronger abilities.

He seems to be a nice guy who knows his stuff, but his lectures were terribly boring and i had no interest in the class by the end of the second week. He also had a lot of trouble with assignments, they were always confusing.

Prof Hall is fairly nice but overall not a good teacher. He doesn't explain assignments well and rambles in class instead of teaching. The notes barely prepare you for the midterms. I ended up googling the answers the night before. Lots of work, more than a typical hist 152 class. Don't buy the books, you never use them.

Disregard all the negative comments on this professor.  He is very helpful if you ask.  American History is more than facts- that is the overall point of this course.  IF you can't think about the classes you take avoid this one, because thinking is mandatory.

Prof.Hall is very VERY interested and knowledgable in AFAM history. He loves what he is doing and tries to make sure that students get something out of class as well as enjoy it. But, he expects ALOT out of his students and constantly seeks to challenge them academically. Alot of CRITICAL thinking, writing , and reading. GREAT CLASS!

Terrible professor with absolutely no interest in the students.  No help on papers that were submitted for review.  A lot of work for a GEC.  Three papers, one of which is a critique on a book for its historical source.  Our class ended on the Civil Rights Movement because he spent so much time rambling.  Worthless class, worthless professor.

Dr. Hall is a very intelligent man, however he does not explain the coursework well. Lectures are very boring and dry with no use of modern technology, but he gives out the copy of the midterm before the exam. It's and easy B.
Avoid avoid avoid. Far too much work, and though he allowed you to submit early drafts of papers for review, rarely offered any real help.

Professor Hall is the nicest man you will ever meet.  Unfortunately, it is very difficult to hear what he is saying even when you sit in the front row.  He has no visual notes, so you just have to pick and choose what you think is important.  He hands the midterm and final to you on a silver platter.  Fill out the answers and study ahead of time!!

lectures are boring, almost tiresome to sit through. He also has mandatory lecture attendance. The class is not hard at all, the challenge is staying alert. He still uses dusty overhead transparancies
He is a sweet guy, but lectures are boring. It is realy easy though if you write out the essay answeres the day befpre the midterm and  memorize them, that's what I did and I got an A-.

Horrible lectures...hard to understand, he mumbles a lot and repeats himself very often. The class is rather easy, but with attendence taken in lecture - it will be the longest 48 minutes of your college career.
Dr. Hall is a great professor.  He is interested in his students and wants you to learn and succeed.  However, he does expect a lot from you!
The TA's did the grading, but 81% of the class got an A or B, with no F's.  Boring lectures, some work, but fairly easy B
He is nice and very knowledgable of the material - but it is so hard to follow him because he is quiet and trails off.  Tears papers apart, don't expect a good grade unless it's a really good paper.

He has a tendency to drift off at the end of his sentences so is hard to hear even from the front row. I think he knows his subject so well that he fails to explain it in a concise manner. His train of thought is very hard to follow.

The class wasn't too difficult, but really keep up with the readings and slides. Took this course last year as part of my GECs. I did not enjoy this class at all.  Way, way too many powerpoints for one class period and in the end, they weren't helpful in preparing for the tests.  She is a tough grader and not all that helpful.

Everyone is right, she is not the professor to take. Makes the material much much harder than it should be, the material on the quizzes are presented in the upcoming lecture. How does that make sense? Everything done is in essays, blah. Horrid.
Horribly unorganized. Class is hard to follow and quizzes are hard.  Lectures are really really boring.

TAKE HIS 151 WITH LAHUE.... if you want to sit in 2 hour lectures that will bore you to death, quizzes on material she will cover in the following lecture, all essay midterms, and an overall unhelpful and unresponsive prof. FAIL.

DO NOT TAKE HER--- YOU WILL WANT TO KILL YOURSELF. I spent 7 hours studying for the midterm, and got an 80% compared to other classes where I don't study and get A's. Hard to judge progress in class because all assignments fall at the end of the quarter.
very boring teaching meathods

maybe it's because i'm a history major, but i thought she was a pretty decent teacher. her grading might've been a little tough (especially for people in the sciences), but she was always available after class to answer questions. the powerpoint lectures got a little tedious, but otherwise it was a well-organized and interesting class.

ridiculous teacher for the fact that this was only a GEC.  She expected us to know a lot more about history than what she tought us in class and kept you in class every single day until the last minute.

terrible teacher. her exams are made for graduate students, not undergrad. she expects you to know every little thing about history then explain it all back to her. if you can avoid taking her, i would. i learned the hard way.

terrible TA! if you e-mail her, she gets pissed. if you miss 2 recitations.. expect a B+ at the most. gave random quizzes that were impossible.. everyone failed. argues with every comment u make in class and mocks your questions. if you get her... SWITCH TAs IMMEDIATELY! i dont know anyone who liked her.. its like she wants u to fail or something

Let me make it easy for you: the class asked if she was teaching 152 next quarter...she said no but she will be next year...we all jumped on the wagon and took it next quarter.   AWFUL, i studied so hard and worked on the paper forever! She hates to see people do well....any other TA would be a breath of fresh air compared to her!!!!

Worst TA ever. Gave quizzes EVERYDAY, marked down how much you participated, got mad when you asked questions. Yea, she knew her stuff but was insane about it...she thinks everyone's lives revolves around history like hers does. I would suggest switching to a different TA!

DONT TAKE! she is a horrible TA she doesnt care what you write your grade is soely based on your class performance in recitation. which will not help you if you study hard for the tests or anything.  she is horrible absolutely do not take!!!

DO NOT TAKE HER! Yes, she knows the material but sometimes that really screws you when you are writing essays.  She doesn't use criteria when grading and just gives you the grade she "thinks" you deserve.  I found her to be a nice person, but a bad TA when it came to grading and overall helpfullness.
great TA, really knows her stuff.  explains things well and is open for questions or extra help.  keep up with reading and go to recitation cause there are random quizzes for a participation grade

I took him for 151 and again for 152 simply because the made the content so interesting and fun to learn. But he is not an easy grader. He grades essays pretty hard, you really have to study for exams.

Great teacher. Very little out of class work, except for reading, but he's very clear on what readings might appear on a quiz. As a student not interested in history, he definitely made things interesting, especially with his own random facts. Wish I had him for 151 too!

I had him for 151 and 152. He is better at 151 than 152. He gave extra credit assignments in 151 and seemed to know more about the material. He was OK for 152. Two tests (complrehensive), 6 quizzes (only 5 count) and a paper. Attendance is not mandatory but highly recommended. Fun guy who likes to talk about random stuff.

Made class interesting with disucssions. Used the book a lot and class attendence is highly recommended, although not mandatory. His lectures were very to the point and his tests and exams were easy provided you went to class the majority of the time and kept up with the readings!

Very helpful and simple. I mean this in the best possible way, but it was like being in middle school or something again. It didn't feel like another boring college class. He generally likes what he is doing and calls things out as he sees them. Highly recommended.

Very helpful and easy if you go to class and take good notes. The study guides are the most useful for the IDs, good notes will mean better organization for the essay part. Would take him for any class.
great teacher. funny and helpful.
No Comments
No Comments
I am so happy that this guy is gone. Good riddance!
smart guy, funny. kind of hard but he makes it interesting. he does want you to learn.

Dr. Hunt is an overbearing, egotistical, arrogant, man. His need to convey himself as a celestial being often interferes with his ability to communicate information regarding the course. He has a habit of humiliating his students should they fail to acknowledge his existence as a herculean, omnipotent, creature worthy of the upmost praise.
He really knows what he's talking about. Gives you a ton of info every class, which is a bit overwhelming. But he is very clear about what he expects you to know for exams.

Hard class. On papers you seem to recieve a 100% 50% or 0. Learned more about his disertation than the subject matter(wish he would have asked about his it on the final). He looked and talked in a way that reminded me of Greenskeeper Carl Spackler from Caddyshack so I always got a laugh at lecture.

I enjoyed the class and him. Lectures were thorough and interesting and he often threw in some fun facts. There are a few papers but don't let that scare you off as they are relatively painless. He has higher expectations than a usual GEC but was helpful and genuinely wanted us to "get it" and do well. Has a sense of humor too, which kept it fun.

John teaches his class well, but the amount of information covered can be overwhelming.  The texts used are almost all primary sources, which can make it difficult if you prefer a textbook to check facts and information.  Lots of papers, but fairly easy quizzes.  Genuinely interested in teaching.

I hated this class. I spent twice as much time on this class than my 500 level classes. I could never get caught up on the readings and I was always writing papers for this class. Some liked him only those who loved history, otherwise take from someone else.
very smart guy, definatly knows his stuff.  not too painful for a basic GEC class.  if you do the work and show that you're somewhat interested, he'll give you a good grade.
spent too much time on religion.  very specific on what his expectations are, forces you to use proper english.  fun teacher.

The class was easy but I wouldn't take him again.  He was on a power trip and seemed more interested in making the class follow his rules (like not wearing hats) than being an effective teacher.  Seemed like a high school class both in the way he treats students and the level of understanding of the material needed to get a good grade.

The class itself was reasonably easy. Although the material on the exams was kind of random, he is a very easy grader when it came to papers. if you don't mind sitting through boring lectures and some annoying/irrelevant opinions he likes to throw in every now and then, i don't think any smart person could get lower than a B in the class
Lets just say that I loved History 151, but dreaded going to my History 152 class!
Awesome teacher.  Changed my life.

Chapin was an awesome instructor.  He related to the class on a personal level and made the material interesting.  He opened class with a story and ended lecture by bringing all the themes of the course together.  He assigns alot of reading but you can get by without reading the text book as long as you show up for class everyday.

Average grade in his class is a B- (he told us). sometimes i wondered if he took pride in that. he didnt answer my e-mail for help on the final paper which was a big part of the grade...i would take someone else

I thought he was a good professor except for one thing - grading(the most important thing to students in a GEC class). He only offered help to SOME students on papers, ignoring others emails. His tests were mostly based on preperation for specific things rather than knowledge of the course.He made grading a history course fairly subjective somehow.

Chapin was a great professor.  He began class will various stories that made the material seem more relevant. He also played several youtube clips of interseting moments of history.   His lectures were linked together very well.  A bit too much reading for a 100-level class  but two of the books werent history book so it was easy reading.

He was awesome. He incorporated lots of interesting video clips that were actually relevant and helpful. Only two papers, and neither of them were hard to write. Also, the books we had to read were relevant but really easy to read with an interesting story line.

Chapin is a great teacher.  I hated history before his class but he made it into a dramatic story with deeper meaning than a bunch of facts and dates.  He knows his stuff and is passionate about teaching. I actually looked forward to his lectures.  He grades kinda hard on the papers but allows for extra credit and accounts for improvement.

The way she talks is really annoying. Tries to sound like she's giving a formal presentation or something, not like she's teaching a small class of students - makes it seem like she doesn't like teaching at all! Her class is boring. Quizzes are not that bad if you actually study your lecture notes. She grades the papers very tough. Not fun teacher

She is very boring and grades papers and quizzes based on whether she like you or not. I would recommend not taking her. She is boring and she tried to sound smarter than she actually is by using large words that were out of the context of what she was trying to say.
Her voice will annoy you after 5 min. She drags out the end of her sentences. Her lectures are mandatory and fast. Her quizes are 100 point each and you will never get a 100.
Monotoned, boring...VERY borning. No real learning that went on...just memorization and then forgetting it later. Did I say Monotone and boring??

This prof is crazy. She makes you read a ton and takes the classe so seriously.  She is boring and only gives outline notes and then you have to furiously try and write everything down.  Too much work for a GEC class, sorry my life does not consist of reading a history book. I advise not to take her. Its only the 3rd week of class and I hate it.

Agreed. I have never had a teacher I liked less. Shrill, condescending, unable to answer questions that veered her away from her beloved Powerpoint. Her attendance policy was as rigid and ridiculous as her overall demeanor. Takes her position way too seriously. Avoid.
Avoid at all costs. An absolute waste of what could be an intereting class.

She was very easy!!! You don't need to read the books at all.  She gives only one test, one paper and then 5 quizes.  The quizes are the easiest things on earth and the paper was over Frederick Douglass which was an easy read and an easy paper.  She talks fast but besides that she gives you lecture notes and shows movies! Take her if you can!

Absolutely one of the best professors i have ever had. He is very strict on grading and he makes you write a lot. His lectures are extremely enjoyable. As long as you go to class, take notes, take the class seriously, visit his office hours, and work hard, you will do fine. You will definitely learn a lot.
Absolutely brutal grader. You'll learn a lot, and he's a good teacher-but a harsh, harsh grader, and very picky about the many papers he requires you to turn in.

He's a very interesting professor probably the most interesting professor that I've ever had at Ohio State. He definitely keeps the lecture interesting however, the grading system is hard and harsh! If you don't mind learning a lot while your grade suffer, take him.

truly a great and knowledgeable teacher, everything on the tests is in his lecture, go to class, take notes, and you'll be fine.  He does make you earn your grade , but the class is absolutely worth it. If you have to take 182 TAKE IT WITH PADILLA

Yes, he will keep your interest-But I hope you don't mind trying to take notes while he rambles on and writes incoherent chicken scratchings on the blackboard.He is also very close minded: if you don't like what he likes, you are wrong (he liked to EAT dog while living in China, and is proud of it) Too much work for a 100 level class.He's Arrogant!

Rob is one of the best professor I've ever had.  Only person I know that can lecture for 2 hours with no visual aids and keep the whole class interested.  He requires a ton of work, but it will help you in the long run.  Always willing to help students.  Knows the subject and loves to teach it.  Recommend him to anyone.
History of American Medicine.  He was the assistant, but he was a great backup to the professor.  Padilla was well organized, and I feel treated the stduents fairly.

One of the best teachers I've ever had.  His class is hard, you will work for your grade, but he knows a lot and goes way above and beyond to make sure you understand.  Many students met with him outside of class and he was always happy to help.  If you work hard you will learn a lot.
No Comments

Honestly, he was a horrible teacher. I only read the book to do the essays. Nothing we learned in class was pertinent for the essays.  His expectations for the essays was extremely high.   I only went to class because it's my favorite subject, otherwise I would have skipped his arrogant lectures.
Horrible teacher and made me actually hate history. I would NOT recommend him to anyone.

Pat seems like an ok guy. But, again, he's just another grad student who doesnt want to be teaching, it seems. He rambles at length about stuff that no one in the class is really too interested in learning (typical GEC at OSU). I wasnt a fan of his testing style, which were just overarching essays to prove that you can read historical documents.

Although he knows his history, his teaching style is not good. His lectures cover so much material that you always NEED to be in class paying attention. He can't summarize events. He expects everyone to write at a grad school level. His expectations, in general, are ridiculous for a 100-level class. This was a writing class, not history class.

His class was very tuff, and he really expects a lot from students taking a 100 level class. However, he is a good guy, and he does give you everything you need to do well in the course. Studying is an absolute must, as is attending lecture and paying attention to every single one. He is big on maps and very big on cause and effect and effect and e
