Patrick was one of the TA's for my History 152 class. He is the biggest jerk I have ever encountered. He is always giving everyone dirty looks, and generally just suffering from a major case of "power trip". Avoid him at all costs, he is worthless.

He was a fine teacher. I was a little disappointed in his strict grading but he is a nice guy and very knowledgeable about South American history. He also makes the material very interesting. I recommend him.

She is really funny and sarcastic.  Just do the readings and homework and go to class and pay attention.  Warning:  She hates cell phone use in class but she warns you at the beginning so just pay attention and don't be stupid and you should do well.

She made going to recitations unbearable.  There was reading for lecture, and then she would throw a 40 page reading for recitation on top of that.  She then expected you to remember every singe part of the reading otherwise she would threaten to end class early (which would have been fine with me).  Worst T.A. to date hands down.

Worst TA I've ever had. Clear in what she says, but 8am was just ridiculous.  Wayyy too much reading outside of the book. Who wants to read Antigone anyhow? Avoid Hist151 at all costs, its just too much information to memorize in 10 weeks.
the class was kind of fast paced because it was summer, but he was knowledgeable and if you attended lectures you would do well on tests! and he has a cute accent which helps =)
awesome professor.  the class was a lot of work, but well worth it.
The final Paper deal is rough

Brian seems like a nice enough guy, but this class requires WAY too much work for a 100 level GEC.  He's a tough grader and I think he forgets most people do have other work outside of this class.  Reading quizzes covered sometimes 200+ pages of reading and the class average was ~70%.  He did give us a nice curve, but it was still a LONG quarter.

This guy was terrible. He has been teaching History 152 for a while, but he's still terrible at it. Class wasn't terrible, but it wasn't great. I fell asleep three times all quarter. He said reading should take 5 hours per week. He helped me with my take home essay and still gave me a C and the class average on quizzes is a C-...I don't recommend.

There's a lot of reading that you need to keep up with in order to do well on the quizzes (20% of your grade).  Also you have to do a midterm paper and final paper that take a while but as long as you keep with the notes/readings they're fairly easy.  Definitely take him if you don't mind lots of reading because he is interesting
B. Ken is tight!! I liked him, he is down to earth, kind of goofy though. His quizzes are easy if u pay attention. The papers not that bad either, just do your work and you'll be fine. Hes chill!
haaated this class. way too much reading to keep up with. lectures are boring. the only cool thing about it was that he played music before class started, and let us out early most of the time.
Great teacher. I had him summer quarter so we had no papers.  Tests were fair and gave oppurtunity for EC.  Has a lot to offer in terms of extra information to keep the class interesting.
hated this class, his accent was hard to listen to, he rambled about unimportant trivia and then required long papers about books that were never discussed.
Great guy.  Super nice.  Lots of notes and very little discussion but tells a lot of interesting facts to keep you tuned in.  Take him.
He's a great guy with a great Boston accent. Go to class everyday and keep up with the readings. He's young and relates well to his students.
No Comments

very uptight and boring teacher. got overdramatic with me and others for coming in late, yet missed many classes and came in late numerous times himself. also very funny how he flaunts his knowledge of asian languages, often with wrong pronunciation and meaning.

He is boring, but I only had to put up with him for 48 minutes at a time so it wasn't as bad.  While I do believe he earnestly enjoys what he does, almost everything was prepared by the TA.  Our TA was the only reason we all passed.  That being said, though, as long as you took the TA's advice, most people ended up with a really high grade.

Yeah, he is as boring as dirt. The good news, I didn't attend a single lecture after the first midterm and got an A in the class. Your TA does mostly everything including grading. If you study what they tell you to, and read instead of listening to his AWFUL lectures you will get a good grade in this class. He sucks, but it was easy?

You would think this would be an easy class because it is history and just memorization. I can assure you, if you do not study the book with a fine tooth comb, you will get a B. Like other reviews said, he cancels class often and hardly and never lets you know. Your TA will be your grade pretty much. My TA was nice, but picky on grading. Avoid him.

TERRIBLE!! Glares at students who come to class late, but is most often late himself. Cancelling class alot if a plus, but he doesn't send out an e-mail or gives any warning. Powerpoints are useless, monotone, and very hard to keep up with... the only way i got through was a great TA!

He is monotone, and reads an essay on a topic and with less than useless power point presentations. Seems like a nice guy, but not approachable. I learned very little from this class, and i often became confused.

Worst Professor Ever. Never shows up and does not let his students know he is gone. His lectures are very dull, boring, and his TA's do all of his work. Your TA's will make your grade. Did I mention his voice is so slow and boring

Horrible class. He displayed little interest in the material or the students. Class consisted of short lectures and a "discussion" which counted for participation points (this was in a very large class). You'll get out early but the hour you're there for will drag on. I recommend avoiding at all costs.

I learned nothing from this class and it was agonizingly painful to sit through (and this class is related to MY MAJOR!) He relies COMPLETELY on the book and solely tests from it, provides bare-bones boring lectures, and says "uhh" to the point of distraction. This class was basically a self-study class that required you to waste time in a lecture.

monotone, worst power point presentations that do not guide you at all, and he just doesn't show up to class some days. It was a waste of my college tuition to take this class with him as the professor. the TA was good though.

Subject matter of the class very interesting. 2 exams,  1 term paper, and participation and attendence in discussion all significatly contribute to final grade. Cons: No outline for notes, and kind of a monotone. Pros: Missing lecture isn't a big deal, exams consist of 10 mult. choice and 4 essays out of 8 topics. Easyto get a B, not so easy for A

he seems like a nice guy but i would like him as an uncle or my accountant. every time i go to his class all i can think of is leaving. he makes the material so boring it drives me crazy. he reads off of his notes and he's extremely monotonous. nice guy, but he could use some work on his teaching

I do NOT recommend this professor. The class has 50+ people, yet *participation is required & graded (for the 15-20 minutes we have for "discussion"). Everything he lectures on is straight out the book; he gives no new insight on the effects of historical events. Topics he says to "focus on" for exams comprise less than 10% of the exam material.

Great prof. Very funny. Knew what he was talking about and was able to communicate well with his students. Class was easy, didn't have to study much,I got an A. Would definitely take another class with him!
Very entertaining and clearly communicated subject matter.Nice guy but a relatively tough grader

funny prof but overall pretty good. TAs do all of the grading so not really much else to say, go to class and take notes, study guide that comes out before exams are essential, look up the study guide terms in the book and know them the best you can and you'll do fine. use info from lecture, discussion and readings for essay q's and its pretty easy

It was a really easy class. You go to class and listen to lectures and write a few one page analyses. The final was long, but not too difficult. Definitely go to class and take part in discussion b/c participation is a big part of the grade. Prof Cornell is a good guy who is pretty funny, even though not many people laugh for some reason.

good prof, really knows his stuff and explains it well.  nice and funny guy, not a bad class.  only had 1 paper assignment and 2 exams, just keep up with reading and pay attention in lecture and you'll be fine
